hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: There are newer hotels. The New Otani was famous years past for hosting the NKK studio dancers for musicals/shows like 42nd street in the 1980s. In the 1990s there was even an attempted assassination of the PM Hosokawa in the business Tower section. The Gardens which were once legendary have been pared down. They are still iconic and in a much smaller scale you can angle shots of the red arched bridge and zen rock display. The garden view cafe used to host breathless fans waiting for the likes of such guests as Rod Stewart, Michael Jackson and Pe Yon Jun. The once vast lobby has been chopped up quite a bit, it once rivaled the Imperial in Hibiya and the Okura in Kamiyachoo. They have a few concept restaurants and still maintain one of the few once glitzy revolving restaurants in Tokyo (can be seen in the photo provided). It's a good hotel if you can find a rate which is discounted.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great place to stay in Tokyo. Apparently most of the Presidents and senior government officials stay there. One of the best breakfast buffet spreads. Some rooms have been renovated. The decor of new rooms is excellent. Request for the newly renovated rooms. One of the most beautiful views of the Tokyo CBD.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: To be honest, I only booked here to be able to say I'd stayed in the office block from You Only Live Twice! I'm sure this is a lovely hotel for those with the money, but it all seemed a bit out of our world. Not a patch on the Nogha Hotel in Ueno. Nice big rooms, but the Sky Bar - you are going to need to remortgage your house for a round of drinks. I can't rate more than average - sorry.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I feel bad to write any bad review in Tokyo as we only came to eat on our way to india and had great service experience all the way from airport bus to checking in at hotel new Otani. We ate at L’effervescence and Narisawa and both great places. I worked out at New Otani fitness center by paying and was treated wellThe only bad experience I had was during breakfast where I was embarrassed by [--] who continued to remind me that I needed to pay for breakfast from the minute I walked in. He embarrassed me and interrupted me during my meal that I erred to pay before I left. I finally asked him if he was suspicious that I would walk out without paying and asked him to bring the bill so I could pay before I finished my meal so he stopped embarrassing me. I have never had such experience in my entire lifeTo make matters worse, his breath stinks. He should not be in a customer service business. He is completely not suitable for his job

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my second stay at the Hotel New Otani in Tokyo. Last time we stayed in the tower; this time in the main building. The hotel is a large complex with three sections (buildings), a beautiful Japanese garden, and many western style luxury goods shops in several layers of shopping arcades.Our room had a traditional wooden tub and a place to wash next to it before climbing in for a soak. The tower building has a rotating restaurant with views of all of Tokyo. On a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji.Most of the people coming and going are business people, in suits and ties or heels, with smart briefcases. We were decidedly not that. But we enjoyed our stay immensely and find the location very convenient to the subway and to points of interest.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for Christmas in 2019. I found that I lost my “Louis Vuitton” bag strap in the room after 5 hours of checking out. I am 100% sure that the bag strap was left at the sofa, because we checked out early in the morning and didn't go to any place else. In that checkout morning, the strap was first attached to my bag and then I released it and put it on the sofa, just to take off my coat easily. However, some other issues came up later and disturbed me and then I forgot to attach it back. It is a bright pink, quite wide, cross body leather bag strap, in other words, it's something not tiny but instead could easily get attention. And it is a gift from my husband for our anniversary. We then called the hotel immediately, however, they said the housekeeper didn't report anything and they would call us back if they find it later. We were positive but we never heard anything from the hotel, so we had to come to terms with the fact that nobody actually did anything. It's so hard to believe that the housekeeper didn't see it (such a long, wide, bright pink, cross body “Louis Vuitton” strap), and we are really disappointed. We will never come back and won't recommend the hotel to our friends.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a really lovely room. The hotel was close to lots of restaurants most of which you could reach whilst staying undercover. We also walked to a beach on the Bay from which you could see Tokyo. We also walked to a very good Japanese garden not too far away. Had dinner out but the breakfast was very good. There was lots of choice and the food was tasty.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I highly recommend you stay at this hotel, everything about it was excellent. The staff were the best, they were so helpful, anytime I look lost someone would ask me if I need help.I wanted them to do something they would do so.Hotel has shuttle bus from hotel so easy to get from airport and if going to another city have service to send your bags to next hotel, supper easy.Hotel quick walk to the trains, they take a day to workout how to use but are cheaper than using taxis, get IC card.Rooms are very big and modern as well clean.Breakfast at the tower was awesome experience and the staff were great.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: On the map, the hotel appears to be isolated from local cuisine, when in fact, great food and bars are only a 5 to 10 min walk from the lobby. We had a bit of communication issue / language barrier when we checked in, and were frustrated that we couldn't get any recommendations for a late night snack. By morning and when the sun came out, all the stores were visible from our hotel room, which made exploring the nearby area easier. There is a beautiful garden on the grounds, would highly recommend taking full advantage even if its cold outside.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: What a fabulous hotel. Customer service unsurpassed. Extremely helpful staff and room was immaculate, well supplied with toiletries and the Toto toilet is indeed a game changer that I will install in my retirement home. Concierge very helpful for directions and all. Next time will bring family. Upon departure staff precisely made sure all in order to make teip to airport. Great job. Cheers, Jack

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 1.5 Years ago we stayed at the garden tower, this time we stayed at the main. Still rooms are very dated with carpet, very old fashioned looking phones, tiny bathrooms and brown color palette.Rooms at the main have floor to ceiling windows which gives you a nice view (if you look past the huge parking in front of the hotel. On a vlear day you can see Mount Fuji though behind the Tokyo skyline.Rooms are all nicely maintained, quiet large with a dressing area. However the bathroom is supersmall, 2 people can't brush their teeth in there. One at a time only. You stand in front of the mirror with the bathtub behind you, the toilet on your left and door on your right. Shower is in the bathtub and is attached to the wall, pretty much pointing to the back of the bathtub and you cannot adjust. Love the pink tiles as well which came straight out of the eighties or seventies?Hotel is pretty large with lots of restaurants and hallways. I did like the fact they had 'silence signs' put up when you exited the elevator on your floor. A lot of people never seem to realize you wake up everyone if you chat loudly in the hallways.Check-in and out is very admin heavy and takes a long time although they do have all your details already as you had to provide at booking stage. I requested a late check-out (1.5hrs later than normal) and I first had to become a New Otani member, otherwise I had to pay for those 1.5 hours.....And lastly, the bathroom is stocked with so many in plastic wrapped amenities: comb, razor, toothbrush, showercap, men and women's kit with sachets with cleansing gel and day cream etc, cotton balls, tips, etc etc.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in the New Otani for about two weeks during the Rugby World Cup. It is one of Tokyo's great hotels. It is vast and has a gorgeous 400-year-old garden. Basically the hotel is three separate towers located just West of the Imperial Palace and that are linked by a long linking building. The New Otani famously was built for the Tokyo Olympics that took place in 1964. Many aspects of the hotel - the quality of the fabric of the buildings, the furnishings and so on are second to none and gave an opulent feeling to the place. The function rooms are enormous and seem similarly plush; and some of the restaurants we tried were very good. So why only three stars? Well the place to me seemed a little bit stuck in a timewarp. There is an extensive shopping arcade with lots and lots of shops selling expensive dresses. There were also some art galleries but all these outlets seemed short of customers, making me think there were too many shops of the wrong type. We were given vouchers for breakfasts and it took us a while to discover that not all breakfast restaurants in the New Otani are created equal. By the end we found a good breakfast place in the hotel but that was after numerous days of slightly disappointing breakfast locations for which there were long queues at 8 am. However for me the kicker was that the hotel has a gym and pool club membership of which cost about €30 a day. Considering what the accommodation cost this was steep. The hotel does provide free workout rooms but these are basically recycled bedrooms with some treadmills, elliptical trainers and a floor mat in them. The one nearest my room also had a chest press machine but no other weights equipment. I would say the maximum number of people who could use that room at a time was about ten. For a luxury hotel I have to say the exercise provision was poor unless you were prepared to spend a lot of money on temporary gym membership.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I first stayed here in 1980....and have been back to Japan many many times staying at a variety of hotels. I had to be in Tokyo (on my own) and could not get a booking at my usual hotel. The new Otani was a pleasant surprise...exceeding expectationsMoney has been spent on a broad refresh and it shows! The room was fine, The concierge service was just excellent. Taxi access good. Bus service to airport well facilitatedI have applied to become a New Otani member and will stay there the next time I am in Tokyo

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Heavy patterned carpets and fake wood completely fail at giving a luxury feeling. The breakfast is average, no fresh fruit available, only preserved and the fruit juice are bad quality industrial. Plus the management of the queue at breakfast is mostly inefficient. Very nice staff overall, especially the clerk at the gym. Good food at restaurant but overpriced.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: What at hotel! Stayed here for 4 nights in March 2019. The staff were so helpful and friendly. Day and night there was always someone to help you. The views from the restraunts were unbelievable. Rooms were spotlessly clean. The traditional Japanese gardens were beautiful.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Can’t really disagree with most of the reviews of this hotel. The positives: It is very well appointed with beautiful carpets, good sized rooms, extremely well kept, fantastic location close to metro shops and palace. The negatives: The cost of food and drink is just extortionate. A small beer is £24, breakfast if not included is £48. You can also treat yourself to a 10oz Kobe steak at £650. It is also a very impersonal hotel because of its size.The message is absolutely stay here because it is a great hotel but eat and drink elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We recently stayed in the New Otani. It felt like we were staying in a shopping mall. It is incredibly vast and with its numerous shops and restaurants has no sense of identity as a hotel. The breakfast buffet was mediocre at best and was often not replenished. Service delivery and attitude was poor. The rooms are good and level of cleanliness satisfactory. The hotel is very well located

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I originally booked this through the Qantas website and remember being completely impressed with the room I chose - Shin-Edo with the cedar bath. I had read the hotel rooms in Tokyo can be very cosy, so was pleased to see how spacious this appeared to be - and it was beautiful! We were meant to be here 4 nights, but because our cruise ship was delayed in docking, we only had 2. Will have to return on our next trip as it is a stunning hotel! Others have already said how big it is and the 10 acre garden is stunning! And yes, the restaurants are pricey, but our last night we had dinner in Nadaman and what an experience! Thoroughly enjoyed it!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed recently following Wales in RWC. Insanely enormous. Rooms great. Service excellent. Breakfast pricey but ok (I’d thrash the extra on the posher one! I mean how many times are you going to Tokyo !), Beer prices ludicrous at £22 a pint . Garden a delight and well placed for sightseeing and tube. Thank you New Otani and the whole of Japan for making us so welcome.They say never meet your heroes but I did meet Gareth Chilcott in the lobby and he was terrifically friendly and very funny......... and I’m Welsh !

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were given a map of the local are at checkin which isn’t unusual, but we were also given a map of the hotel and that turned out to be necessary because the hotel is enormous with 1,479 rooms and 39 restaurants. Put all that aside, and the room was terrific, spacious and very well appointed and clean. The hotel is centrally located with many restaurants and shops within easy walking distance if you prefer to eat out as we did.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is MASSIVE - the Main is the original hotel and has hundreds of rooms and tons of restaurants - 30+? The hotel is close to subway lines - 1 block walk and 2 bocks to Akasaka - tons of restaurants!!! About a 5 - 10 minutes walk to the train system and close to parks. The hotel itself has a fantastic Japanese garden and decent size pool.I stay for 6 days in both a King Room and Jr. Suite in the Main. The rooms are very large for a Japanese hotel - a benefit from the 1970s. The 1st room was probably 400+ square foot with small sitting area and large windows. Rooms higher up obviously have much better views... avoid the 4 -5th floors. The sitting area of all the rooms have very small older style furniture. Comfortable to sit and have tea - but not to lounge.The King Size bed was comfortable with foam and feather pillows and down comforter. The bathroom could use some updating - higher counters, however, the shower water pressure was Excellent and the Japanese style "Star Trek" style toilets are in place.The Jr. Suite ws probably 650+ square feet with separate living room - again the furniture is tiny - 2 person couch and small chairs - even though their is ample room for full size furniture. Both rooms had separate tubs and showers with super strong water pressure - the tubs fill in 3 minutes.English TV options are limited to CNN, BBC, MSN and Bloomberg TV with some Japanese news channels available at times in English. No HBO, Showtime or other cable options. Poor movie selections.Good AC Controls.So many restaurants to choose from it's mind boggling. Make sure your reservations include breakfast - else the buffet costs 2,500 Yen. The breakfast buffet selection is mediocre unless you pay up another 1000+ yen fro the special buffet. Lots of other choices in Akasaka. The restaurants offer ample choice, Japanese, Chinese, American (Trader Vics complete with Polynesian dancers)... prices are HIGH. Go to Akasaka - blocks away.Service: Very good front desk and concierge. Net net: Good value - but not in the category of the Grand Hyatt, Four Seasons, Mandarin or other 5 Star hotels... but significantly cheaper.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A very good experience. Customer service maintained with Typhoon and earthquake going on and with massive influx of Rugby and grand orix folk The hotel staff couldn't be more helpful Shame about £20 a pint but hey ho

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is in fact one of 3 hotels in one, with a beautiful Japanese garden. The staff are excellent and the rooms are spacious and comfortable, with silent air handling. However, there are few drawers for storing clothes, just shelves.There are many restaurants on site, but they are expensive. The public areas are grand and there are very many shops. It is a 3 minute walk from the Ginza Line subway.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Absolutely massive hotel with around 35 restaurants and bars there. The room itself is ok, although it can be fairly small compared to western standards. The garden is a nice touch and the location is also decent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is nice, I was staying in the main, as I later found out, it was huge complex, where the main and the tower are role into one (almost got lost on first day). Breakfast are provided in four different place, the biggest is on the hub (walkway that connect main and tower), the highest is at 40th floor, which have nice overlook of the Japan official guest house, the third one is specializing in Japanese food, but all have Japanese food in it. The fourth, is asking extra charge for breakfast, so didn't go there. As this is a big hotel, it tend too be crowded during breakfast hour, as I experience 15-20 minutes just to be seated, so I just avoid the peak breakfast hour. The hotel suite next the palace and official guest house, so it's on quite part of Tokyo. Didn't have the opportunity to use the other facility.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani has the charm of the old Tokyo but is equipped with all the contemporary and necessary equipments,free wifi included, to facilitate your life.It's a large hotel I prefer the Main to the towers but both are quite good and comfortable with the same Japanese classic and elegant service.The number of restaurants ( a very wide choice from a Trader Vics to a lovely and delicious Teppanyaki restaurant in the middle of thge beautiful garden),the boutique and bookshop are well appointed and of quality

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 4.5* New Otani HotelHuge, 3 buildingsExcellent, helpful, and friendly staffGood restaurantsGym is minimalistHas complimentary WiFi, but a little slowFood prices are very expensive $8 for a coke; $17 for a beer

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: ..we much enjoyed our stay in a pleasant end of corridor room half way up the garden tower...two windows, one to police building under construction and other of the garden.....nice quiet room with good beds....shower of the climb in bath variety....breakfast either in the garden lounge with lovely garden views or on the top 40th tower floor with fine city views.....all staff most courteous in the japanese way.....just two niggles....our room had very limited lighting....no lights over or at sides of beds..thus impossible to read in bed....hope not typical of all rooms ?....secondly the so-called hot food at breakfast in the garden lounge was close to stone cold....very odd since it was well presented....the scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon etc......disappointing since plenty of food choice in a lovely setting next to garden.....

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It was the worst hotel in Tokyo.My sister lives in Tokyo, so I visited a lot of hotels in there.I always thought that Japanese hotel staff were really really kind, even so much.But not this hotel !!!!!!!I arrived in the lounge very pleasantly, but there was an anti-Korean magazine.I couldn't understand how this hotel has that kind of magazine. I was so upset that I ruined my trip.This is a hotel that pepole of all countries visit.I want to ask you, if there is an Anti-Japan magazine in Korean hotel, what will you do? I got upset a lot, and you have to explain this matter seriously. Even the hotel staff were not good at English, and some were not kind.I asked them in English and they answered in Japanese. It was an absolutely ridiculous experience.I'm just thankful for such an absurd experience. Bye!세상에 이런 최악의 호텔이 존재합니다진짜 어이가 없네요어떻게 모든 나라의 사람들이 다 오는 호텔에떡하니 혐한 잡지를 두고영어로 물어보는데 일부로 자꾸 일본어로 대답하나요기분이 정말 나쁘네요

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I picked this hotel because of its beautiful gardens and wasn’t disappointed. Lovely, peaceful place to stroll or sit for a while. There are also several restaurants throughout which provides a nice (if somewhat expensive) place for a meal. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and nicely appointed and it was great to have the choice of a bath or a shower. I stayed in the main, which is the older part of the hotel but very nice. Short walk to the subway. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Nee Omani is supposed to be an institution. It really is an appealing place. It is so vast you get lost and it’s decor is very dated. Plus the service is awful. If you arrive at 11.45 to see if you can check they simply so No. If you explain you have been travelling for 24 hours and ask for their help, they repeat robot like that check in is at 14.00. They don’t even try and check if a room is available. In a hotel with literally hundreds of rooms. Very poor. Tokyo is great and has fantastic hotels. Avoid this one at all costs.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Our room was very confortable and very clean. The hotel location was excelent considering the proximity with one metro station. The staff was very nice. The only thing that could be better was breakfast, as it had not the variety and quality that a 5 star hotel should have.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is a huge complex of high-end shops (including a luxury car dealership), banquet halls, wedding/photo-shoot venues, fine-dining restaurants, gardens and ponds (waterfall included), conference halls and offices, and country clubs. You need a map to navigate among all the facilities on site. Hotel guests are served with obliging and eager staff meeting most, if not all, your demands, in precision and reasonably fluent English. Parcels I received whilst being a guest were promptly and securely delivered to my room. Choices of included breakfast, across different restaurants, are amazing. The traditional Japanese-style breakfast overseeing the gardens and waterfall was quite a dining experience. The more popular option would presumably be the buffet up on Level 40 in the Garden Tower, offering a mixed Western and Japanese selection, and a sensational view of the Tokyo Tower and the Imperial grounds, essentially at least 270 degrees of view around the tower, being the highest building in its vicinity. Guest room was clean and sufficient for my stay. The decor could have been dated, but I did not spend enough time staring at the decor to appreciate it. Bathroom was not luxurious, but adequate. The downside was the huge size of the complex making staying in the Main Tower tricky for accessing the Metro Stations at the South side of the complex. The arcade is on the basement floor. The separate reception at the Garden Tower is on the same floor as the Main Tower, designated as Floor 2, but exiting to the street you will walk into the ‘office’ block at its Floor 6. There on you exit to Akasaka, an amazing upscale and wealthy district in which every corner out from the Metro station is interesting, the shrines are unique and the restaurants are of a spill of international varieties.The gardens on the hotel ground are probably enough reason to stay here for even just one night.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: There is a lot of good stuff. As everywhere, extremely polite people. Magnificent staff. Everything super clean. Rooms are lovely: huge double bed and also wide beds in twin room. Everything you need is provided in the room: toothbrush, all possible toiletries for men and women. Shops inside. Different restaurants.But but but...Very co confusing place. Sign posting is very poor. Entrances in different places. Lots of things going on.Breakfast is very limited and you have to queue. You have to join the club to use the pool - what a joke! Why?Food is very expensive. Do not eat in hotel. You can walk to a lovely and lively streets 5-7 min away and left and right from Wendy’s and find all possible cuisines. For attractions, next time we will choose something closer to Akihabara etc.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A good hotel for our family of four, nice resort-style pool, and reasonable size room. Very close to the Metro, and lots of restaurants. Staff were helpful, and had a a solid grasp of English, which was important to us.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the new otani in part because my tween daughter wanted to go where her favorite tv series “Fuller House” was once filmed. Although our accommodations were very spacious and comfortable, the room itself and the hotel in general were extremely dated.We appreciated the large space and the fact that they had a couple of TV channels in English (something hard to find in hotels in Japan!) We also enjoyed the Pierre Hermès patisserie on-site and the gardens.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I had only one night in this hotel but my room was huge and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was pure luxury and the hotel grounds were stunning. I spent hours exploring the traditional Japanese garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: First, the good: the staff people are all well-trained, super-polite, and very helpful. And all speak English well, mostly. The air-conditioning works really well, which is important especially in the summer. The breakfast buffet in the Garden Lounge is great and worth the price. The bathroom was nice, and spacious. Everything else was disappointing. Maybe most Japanese people prefer firm mattresses; I do not. These were so hard and uncomfortable that I was not able to sleep well at all, for six straight nights. Not good. There are only three English TV channels: CNN, BBC, and CNBC. The garden is very nice, but you can't actually see it at all from a "garden view" room in The Main tower, so don't be deceived when you're making a reservation. You'll only see the tops of trees and rooftops. The hotel is in a good location in central Tokyo and there's a train station nearby, but if you're staying in The Main, you'll have a long walk (ten or fifteen minutes) all the way to the other end of the hotel (Garden Court tower) before you even get to the street to walk to the station. The most disappointing thing is that everything in all the hotel shops and most of the restaurants is ridiculously overpriced. Only the super-rich could buy any of it. Rarely did we ever see a single customer in any of them and no wonder. Five or six HUNDRED dollars for a steak? Seriously? It was sad to see all those chefs and servers in empty restaurants with absolutely no one to serve. Sad.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a very large and in many ways very pleasant hotel. The staff, particularly the younger ones are friendly and helpful. Whilst by no means luxurious, the rooms are well equipped and very clean. The location is very pleasant though not at all central. The downsides are the size and the impersonal nature of the hotel. Whilst the room rates can appear reasonable, you need to be aware that eating or drinking at the hotel is crazily expensive. For example, the main breakfast buffet has a good selection of food but the price (£42) is crazy. The breakfast buffet in the Terrace restaurant is marginally cheaper but poor quality. Most absurd of all is the pricing in the terrace restaurant for a cup of tea (£10!). My advice is to find somewhere smaller and more accessible. If you are going to stay here get a package that includes breakfast or eat elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: One or Two Times in a year since 1995 I stayed at Hotel New Otani Main. For me it was a healing place in Tokyo. I really enjoyed the japanese breakfast in nadaman and Tempura in Horikawa, especially Teipanyaki in Sekisintei. It was very delicious made me happy.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: For our last few days in Tokyo we decided to stay in what we suspected would be a beautiful hotel, but it far exceeded our expectations. This is most definitely a high-end hotel with service to match. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The hotel gardens are gorgeous and serene and amazingly huge, waterfall and all. The rooms are very large and well laid out and of course well appointed, we lacked for nothing. Even the coffee in the room was ingeniously designed and delicious. The hotel has several restaurants, a delightful bakery and several high-end shops. To quote the Blues Brothers “this place has everything”. The restaurants were very expensive but the room was surprisingly and happily not. The location is excellent, a short walk to the JR station and a shorter walk to the subway. This is a great place to stay, fantastic value for money. We are very glad that we stayed there and will do so when we return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights which was too long as it was not the kind of hotel where you feel like you can relax after sightseeing and exploring Tokyo.Our room in the Main was described as a triple room deluxe. We thought it would be more comfortable and have the usual double or queen bed with an extra single bed. Imagine our surprise when in 2019 a major hotel had three single beds lined up like a dormitory. The wardrobe was so small once again for 3 people. There was no hospitality at all in the way of a turn-down service at nighttime, biscuits or fruit in the room at all throughout our quite lengthy stay.Breakfast was the worst I have seen in a hotel - we travel overseas several times a year - no Bircher muesli, no omelette or pancake or dim sum stations, no home made breads - just supermarket breads. No fresh fruit other than grapes and pineapple- every day- others were all frozen or tinned.There was no piano bar or lounge bar where one could sit and chat and relax like in other similar hotels of this standard. The only positive was that the location was so convenient and the staff were plentiful and polite.Should we return to Tokyo we would stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We loved our stay at The New Otani Main.For us it was a home in Tokyo.The staff is magnificent!! Specially the Concierge desk. They the most PROFESSIONAL and helpful group of attentive individuals ever! Their English is perfect! And they KNOW all the secrets of the city.Both buffets we attended were scrumptions and delicious. But we really enjoyed the Japanese breakfast.And what can we say about the most beautiful and well kept Garden in Tokyo?? That lovely cascade, with its white birds flying and nesting, sure makes the stay at The New Otani Main a breathtaking experience!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a very big hotel with almost 1,500 rooms, with all the problems that comes with a property that large. The rooms are relatively small, with small bathrooms, where the toilet, the single sink, and the tiny bathtub are all crammed into one small space. In our case, the room had a bad odor that they could not get rid of during our 4-day stay. We suspect the guests before us had smoked in this room (even though this was a non-smoking room) and they tried to get rid of the smell by dousing the room with detergents and air fresheners. The staff at this hotel are, understandably, very cold and impersonal. How can you pay attention to the needs of one guest when there are 1,500 guests jamming the hotel? The location of this hotel is geographically central but quite inconvenient. The hotel is in downtown Tokyo, near office buildings and commercial properties. There is nowhere to walk when you get out of the hotel. You MUST take the subway or a taxi to go to any of the fun or touristy destinations. The hotel has a very nice garden, which is well worth walking through. Quite beautiful.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Checked in for just two nights because of a conference. Had requested for a late check out of 30 mins to an hour since coming back from conference center for the morning session means I will be running slightly late. The front desk insisted in charging an extra 30% late charge since check out time is noon and won’t even consider a goodwill gesture of a slight delay. This is in addition to them knowing I’m booked on a bus ride to the airport with the hotel shuttle service. The hotel management reasoning is the reservations were made by the organiser and there’s a big delegation. They can’t accommodate each request. What I don’t get is what does it matter when we remain guest and we are still paying for the accommodations. Such inflexibility sends a wrong message to any hotel guest esp when the request is for a maximum of an extra hour. It’s not as if I intend to stay on for the next half a day! I’ve never been so disgusted with the rigidity exhibited by any hotel whether it’s 3 or 5 star hotel. This is my first stay with Hotel New Otani and I’m certainly never coming back to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed there on a business trip and was very happy. Service was great, with most people speaking fluent English. The grounds outside were so well done and relaxing. Basically an oasis in this huge city. Ok, it’s not next to a train station, but a short walk to two different stations, so you have options on which line to take. Good breakfast and many restaurants on the property, so there are plenty of choices. The best part was the room. Top notch. I wish I could have spent more time there. Easily worth the price paid. I will be there again, when visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were very disappointed with our stay, having picked the New Otani based on so many positive reviews. Our flight landed in Tokyo at 5am and we got to the hotel about 7am, I had contacted them in advance to tell them that we had paid for the full night before but would not be arriving until the next morning and they confirmed this was fine. On check in we were then told we’d have to pay a late check in fee which was more than what we’d paid for the night, it took about 15 mins before they would accept that we had paid already for the night. We then got to our room which looked so old and dated, and the carpet was not particularly clean. My husband went to ask if there was another room available and after keeping him waiting more than 30 mins was told there was only a room with twin beds, which wasn’t an option for us. We were visiting on our honeymoon and although the hotel knew this they did not acknowledge in any way. We had breakfast one morning at the garden restaurant which was ridiculously expensive for average food (5,200 yen for a small omelette, small ‘American breakfast’, a tea and a coffee). Location wise the hotel is not near to any major attractions, it is near a station with good connections but it took us almost 15 mins to walk through the hotel to get out of there. On checkout we were charged tax but hadn’t been notified about this on check in (we were aware of it due to reading previous hotel reviews). On the plus side we enjoyed the tempura restaurant and cocktails at Trader Vics. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, it ruined the start of our trip.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spent four nights here while on business. The service is fantastic, and the hotel, whilst a bit tired, is very clean. The rooms are well appointed, but in typical Tokyo fashion, a tad short on space. There is free wifi and great concierge service. Lots of expensive restaurants within the hotel, but one can go a five minute walk to find many fine local restaurants and coffee shops. Given the location, and price, I highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We usually stay at the Main or the Tower location. We like this hotel because it is centrally located to most of Tokyo areas. If you walk down from the Tower Annex area, Akasaka Subway station is only a few minutes walk with so many different Subway lines stopping at this station. The other thing we like is that there are so many variety of restaurants, you don’t need to go out. There is even a Seven Eleven type food shop called Sakagami where one can get bento, onigiri, you name it. You don’t need to spend thousands of yen at restaurants. To top this all, there is truly a beautiful Japanese Garden. Also, the employees are so perfectly trained with a true spirit of Omotenashi. It is so popular both by foreigners and Japanese, the reception area is always crowded both in the main and tower area.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just about to complete a four night stay at the New Otani Hotel. Built on a grand scale it has an old world feel about it. The demographics are of an older clientele. The service standards are very high and the staff very pleasant and helpful. There is a choice of of dining from buffet to fine dining to a Polynesian themed restaurant called Trader Vic’s. Food is of a good standard throughput but is priced on the higher side. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Close to the train station which makes visiting the rest of Tokyo fairly easy. Has a beautiful Japanese garden that is an absolute delight to wander through. Would stay here again when on another business trip.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was buy far the fanciest hotel I’ve ever stayed. The service was above and beyond great. Someone was always offering to carry my bags or offer assistance. Room service was excellent and fast with a wide variety of selections. The room was spacious, clean and offered a large quantity of free amenities. New Otani Hotel is a little pricey compared to some hotels in Tokyo but if you look for a deal it is more than worth the extra expense. Extra great feature is that the two nearby train stations will get you to anywhere in the city. Overall great hotel and I will stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Huge hotel complex in a central location. Walking distance to subway and central Tokyo...but likely the same for almost any Tokyo hotel. No need for taxis. Staff was helpful and English speaking. Restaurants were many and varied pricing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is a beautiful and comfortable hotel with many excellent restaurants and superb gardens that are the focus of the downstairs breakfast area. The breakfasts are among the least good aspects of the New otani but the view is great, grab a window side table if you can.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent very large hotel complex in perfect central location. Walking distance to subway and central Tokyo. Wonderful staff, amazing shops (restaurants a bit too pricey) and of coarse signature Japanese garden is a bonus.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent service at Excecutive Lounge, staff was very helpful and professional. Lot of places to shop and eat within hotel, easy access to public transport and nice location.Throughly enjoyed the stay.Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is huge. There are two buildings connected and when you check in, they give you a map. You actually would need it to walk inside the hotel. There are many restaurants in the hotel. The breakfast buffet is a bit disappointing although it's better than the one in Prince Gallery. However, Prince Gallery's in-room dining definitely beats New Otani's. The hotel is located close to Akasaka shopping and restaurant area, but it's not connected directly to the Metro stations. You have to walk outside for 2 minutes. The facility is a bit dated but the rooms are nicely renovated. The Japanese garden is definitely the highlight. It is the place to have a refreshing walk either in the morning or in the evening after coming back from office.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nts at the start of our Japan Tour with Riviera Holidays. This massive but pleasant hotel has 1479 rooms, built for 1964 Olympics by an ex-Sumo wrestler Mr Otani & is set in a magnificent old gardens. The hotel is located in the heart of Tokyo, close to the Japanese Parliament, nearest Metro stop just a few minutes’ walk (station names in English). Also nearby is a good selections of shops and restaurants. We were on the 28th floor, in a comfortable large room 4806. Our view was just of buildings at back, others were luckier. Our biggest problems was getting a table for morning breakfast. We had been warned about the queues. The selection and quality of food was good and staff very pleasant, but the queues tedious - not sure there is a solution, when all tour groups & business men needed to eat early. Our deal was B&B - evening meals were above our price range so we walked to a nearby restaurant.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Main is a large part of the huge, centrally located New Otani Hotel. Yet it is so well run, it almost feels like a boutique property. We found nothing but perfection in our three nights here. On arrival, we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. Booking direct really helps these days. A package we had had sent there a few days prior was waiting for us at check in; another was delivered to our room the next day, right on time. The breakfast is wonderful, though costly, but there are many options off property should that be of interest. We dined and had drinks at the onsite Trader Vic’s, an historic favorite of ours. Other nights we walked through the amazing garden and found ourselves surrounded by restaurants across the street. This hotel is a classic, reflecting Japanese culture brilliantly. It is clean, lovely and elegant. We will stay nowhere else when next in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We went to the Sky bar for drinks at sunset, it was very good. A little pricey, but no cover charge and great views. They have a buffet on which we didn't try, it did look good though. Huge hotel, be sure to go to the 'Main' building.
user_name:
Stephen M
Alhama de Granada, Spain

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel was easily accessible by limosine bus from Narita airport. Check in was quick but my mother and I were put on separate floors so had to get another keycard to access the floor on the elevator.The room was large, quiet and very well appointed. Transport links are very good with a number of subway/train lines close by.The gym was very good also.The Breakfast buffet ( in the Garden lounge) was very good with both Japanese and western dishes ( join the New Otani club to save money)The gardens are outstanding with waterfalls, bridges stone lanterns and a sakura tree. There is a Family markt in the Garden court tower.All the staff were very friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A very helpfull staff meets you and help you to your room. This is a large hotel with many restaurants and shops. Nice rooms.Take the lift to the buffet restaurant at floor 40 and enjoy the vju over Tokio. No need to pay for a trip up in the tv tower after seen this

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Location was excellent,close to station. Rooms are very big and spacious. Room was on the 13th floor beautiful view, Can see Mount FIJI on a clear day. Excellent Customer service by the staff. Definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Well if you find yourself at this hotel it is a must you try all their restaurants as each one of them offers an amazing experience and great food. You dont even need to go outside. Also i would highly recommend you try the desert from their pastry shop it is amazing.The hotel as a great location, staff are amazing and very helpful and will cater to all your needs. I would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: + Excellent location+ Beautiful garden area+ Room felt spacious for Tokyo standards, good quality sleep+ Great service disposition by staff- Breakfast was crowded and selection slightly underwhelming - Lobby felt crowded at times; it was a pretty busy hotel when we were there overall

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, superb hotel, great rooms, very close to Underground, also very close to the restaurant district. The restaurant was great for breakfast, included in our package, western and japanese breakfast was available on a buffet style.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is enormous and has the most beautiful garden.I was surprised by the outside space at this hotel. You can walk the garden, which also includes a choice of resturants. The interior also has many resturants to chose from and one has open viewing of the garden. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size with quality linens and towels. We had some difficulty with the lighting system, getting individual lights to stay on there own, it was all or nothing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel has everything, a supermarket and stores, shopping and tons of restaurants. It was nice for the convinence. Good deals are available. The main town is much nicer (renovated) than the garden tower. Breakfast buffets were disappointing (unless you go for the more expensive one which was pretty good. The gardens are amazing and the restaurants were lovely.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent one night in this hotel at the beginning of April 2019, but it was the second time for me.the staff is perfect and you have all the comfort you might need.the rooms are a little old fashioned, but this is a traditional hotel in Tokyo. In any case they are very clean and offers many comfort.would definately recommend it!
user_name:
Beatrice P
San Zenone degli Ezzelini, Italy

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I went for sakura viewing and booked the shin-edo room in advance for the full japanese experience from the end of March to the first week of April. The location of the hotel is central to so many attractions i can't even begin to enumerate them, and is conveniently surrounded by metro stations almost all were a 5 min walk from the hotel (bear in mind the hotel is huge so im not including the long pleasant walk inside the hotel all the way to the station). From day 1 i was greated by pleasant staff members who also speak english and that friendly atmosphere continued throughout my stay. The room had a huge window facing the fascinating japanese garden with many types of trees including sakura trees and two beautiful red traditional japanese bridges with a koi fish pond and a water fall, the most amazing view I've ever had in any of my trips to japan. Walking in the huge hotel there's literally everything you need from a convenience store to a coffee shop to clothing and accessory shops, antiques... Etc. Room service was very fast and available 24hours a day. My reservation didn't include breakfast,but the front desk staff still offered me a schedule of all the hotel restaurants open for breakfast with their prices (maybe next time I'll try it). On my last day i had called the front desk in advance the night before to reserve a seat in the airport bus and the staff was very helpful explaining the full time table and the price to pay. The transportation too and from the hotel was very convenient since you can choose whether you want the airport bus or taking the metro directly (the difference in price was almost 400¥ bus being more expensive of course).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very good location and warm hospitality. The room is very spacious as well. There is a Family Mart in the building. However, it does not operate 24hours, it closes at 11pm. For those who need some snacks at late night should take note on this.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Visited for six nights with my wife during cherry blossom season. The hotel is located in a kind of quiet business area. It is centrally located so in between of most areas you might visit. The views were great from our room and the amenities were much more than we expected. Bang & Olufsen bluetooth speaker, mobile phone with free calls and wifi (300¥/day which is ok). In general it offered us more than we expected for the price. Only complaints would be the bed that was not bad but not great either and the in room dining which had no European choices

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Beautiful hotel with fabulous Japanese gardens, which are separately mentioned in guides as a tourist attraction. Breakfast was very good in the Garden Court section of the hotel and we had views over the beautiful Japanese gardens. You can also breakfast up on the 40th floor.We felt that it was more of a hotel complex for business people and it did not have a tremendous lot of character. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we do not have any negative comments to make, but due to its size, felt that it was quite impersonal. We had a most impressive corner room which offered not only views over the beautiful gardens, but also, a fabulous Tokyo skyline and on a clear day, Mt.Fuji in the distance. The room included usual tea/coffee making facilities, toiletries, robes and slippers. It is situated very close to Akasaka station and there are many restaurants in the vicinity. Would recommend as a well situated, large hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 3 tower type blocks linked on lobby floor. Quite confusing finding your way to various floors. Stayed in the Garden Tower, lovely room, dreadful views, low beds, 4 ghastly hard pillows to choose from, a very complicated toilet to operate! Lovely restaurant on lobby floor overlooking the garden which was really nice. Breakfast very good, massive range and choice of foods, Japanese, English etc We had a couple of evening meals there. The restaurant in the garden served excellent Wagyu steaks but the prices were very high. We ate a burger type meal in the Garden Tower restaurant bar which was pretty poor but I don’t think Japan have taken on high end burger meals anywhere as yet. Great selection of hotel shops, always empty as their prices were astronomical. The day I left, the prime minister of Japan was visiting. Apparently an old Bond film - “You only live twice”was filmed in the original hotel before the two newer blocks were added.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: In Tokyo for business meetings and a few days of sightseeing. The hotel was conveniently close to the meeting location in nearby Minato-ku. The hotel is adjacent to the Akasaka-Mitsuke Tokyo Metro station. The hotel is large with 1,500 rooms and has the main tower and the Garden Tower. Centrally located, it is about 30-40 minutes from Tokyo Haneda Airport, don't fly into Narita unless you have to. The room on the 23rd floor of the Garden Tower was very comfortable with a very large king bed and had able storage with a chest and closet. The desk was very workable with plenty of power plugs. The WIFI is very adequate and there is no charge. There is a clock built into the nightstand and it also has an alarm. There are plenty of very excellent bathroom amenities and there are two 500 ml of water each day at no charge. The bed is extremely comfortable and the rooms are very quiet. Service is, of course, first class. The breakfasts in the Tower Buffet and the Garden Buffet are excellent. The Tower Buffet is on the 40th floor and gives beautiful views of the City and on a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji. The Garden Buffet overlooks the beautiful Japanese Garden that is several hundred years old and is just beautiful.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel has a unique location in Tokyo and the property has its own sightseeing: the Japanese garden and its 39 restaurants! This is my second time there and I found a whole world there, you have from salon to little convenience store, clothing and souvenirs stores. It’s famous for banquets for weddings and graduation parties. From my window I could see Mount Fuji in a very clear and sunny day. The hotel itself is a touristic point. About 100m from Akasaka Mitsuke metro station and a street full of restaurants and a hug BIC Camera store. It’s worth to be there!!!!Ps: breakfast is great too.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed on the 25th floor in the Garden wing. What a painful shock when I woke. The soft lumpy old bed gave me very bad back pain. My friday ski plans had to be put aside. Of my dozen times visiting Japan and skiing, this is the first time experiencing a bad old bed. I planned to ski friday and saturday, to much disappointment I could only ski one day with the assistance of panadol.This is a very grand hotel with a beautiful 400 year old garden, many upscale shops and restaurants. Breakfast room was elegant.I loved the service mostly. Those cute bellhop girls were the best. Well spoken in English, with smiles ear-to-ear and offering freely to bring our heavy large luggage through the long corridors, elevators and taxi stand. They were the best! Giving me directions to the metro in perfect English. It’s the only hotel that has provided this great service in Japan without a translation gizmo. Every effort has been made to make a tourist feel welcomed and comfortable; with the exception of the lumpy bed of course.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Arrived in the port of Yokohama on a cruise ship and following disembarkation travelled to Tokyo and checked into the Hotel New Otani and was offered a room in the Garden Tower on the 28th floor which offered good views of the city. The room was modern, comfortable, clean and well equipped. The hotel is in a complex with a large variety of luxury shops and a considerable number of restaurants offering international, Asian, French, steak bars and cafe style cuisine. We dined on the first night in the Tower buffet in the 40th floor which offered a fixed price buffet (additional discount of 10% for hotel guests) and the choice of dishes was excellent. This restaurant is highly recommended and offers panoramic views of the city.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani has 39 restaurants, a private Japanese garden and many room styles, but it manages to provide a personal service that makes you feel at home. A wonderful breakfast with a view of the gardens, roof top bar and restaurant and easy bus shuttle to and from the airports.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We pay for a tour to mont fuji and the hotel personal told us to wait in a room, but no one come to pick us up and the hotel it’s not taking responsibility for their mistake and they also make us pay for that

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a very nice hotel - rooms are well furnished with good, firm beds (which I like). There are a good variety of restaurants as well as some shops (the cake shop is popular) and service level is excellent. Breakfast buffet spread is good and the Tower restaurant provides a great view of the city skyline. There is a beautiful Japanese Garden with koi fish pond which is great for a nice stroll.A couple of not so great - bathrooms are a small and there is no separate shower cubicle. The subways are a little bit of distance. There are 2 train stations nearby - the JR station and Tokyo metro. Both are slightly more than 10 minutes walk.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spacious and very comfortable room, high quality materials. Excellent breakfast with a choice of 3 different restaurants. Super friendly staff. Great location next to the metro station. Highly recommended if within your budget!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed at the New Otani (The Main) upon a recommendation from a family member. We wanted somewhere that was a nice hotel and in a good location that was not too highly priced but offered a lot of quality.We stayed here 4 nights and I’ll break up my review into two themes:Hotel and Facilities:Checkin was very smooth and despite flying the red eye from Singapore and arriving mid-morning we were given a room upon arrival, which was a pleasant surprise and very much needed. I was again very surprised later to find when I opened the door to such a large and spacious room! The bed was amazingly comfy and we both had a great night’s sleep each night. There are many light touches that are very nice; dressing gowns, slippers and plenty of complimentary things in the room and bathroom. The hotel itself is situated in such beautiful surroundings with a fantastic garden with a waterfall. There’s a number of shops on the lobby floor as well as a nice bar at the top floor. Staff were all brilliant, helpful and very friendly.However, the reason I didn’t give the full 5 stars was the ‘Accommodation Tax’ levied upon checkout. There wasn’t a mention of this upon checkin and despite paying in full online beforehand, the 200 yen per night was due on leaving. I think a simple ‘by the way’ or explanation at the checkin process could have made the difference to a 5/5 as I don’t appreciate having hidden costs added at the end.Location:This is the most outstanding part of the Hotel overall. A quick walk through the lobby, past the shops and down the elevator brings you to the street and a further 5 minute walk brings you to Akasaka Mitsuke subway station. This line is well connected to get to Ginza, Shibuya, Roppongi, Shinjuku and Tokyo stations in a very short time. A perfect location to explore central Tokyo and beyond.Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short or long visit as well as for business travellers. I would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A top quality hotel with an excellent Japanese garden (well worth a visit in its own right and as good as many of the admittedly larger well known gardens of Japan). You can even eat breakfast overlooking it in one of the many hotel restaurants and there is also a 'Tully's coffee shop' (like a Starbucks or Costa) in the hotel (which suited my wife's need for a daily coffee to supplement traditional Japanese tea).The metro is a short walk (5 mins) away beside which there are a couple of streets full of restaurants (so you don't need to travel into central Tokyo if you don't want to). The metro is very easy to use with numbered stations which mean its very easy to work out which direction to travel in. One thing to bear in mind is that a 24 hour metro ticket (which usefully is not day based but starts when you buy it) isn't usable on all the metro lines (about 8 are included but a further 8 are private and need their own tickets). Hence you need to plan your route using appropriate lines if you don't want to pay more than necessary.It's worth a visit to one of the towers to view Tokyo at night (we went to the Roppongihills tower where the observation deck is outside and allows you to see the more famous lit up towers from a good distance).Food at the hotel is good and there are useful vegetarian options in the western style breakfast buffets.We would recommend staying at the hotel and enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at the hotel after 21 years, and it was great to enjoy the same great service. The garden is as beautiful as I remembered, and the view from the 40th Floor while having breakfast is a nice way to start the day. This time I signed up a s member of the New Otani Club which comes with addiional benefits.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very nice rooms, clean and comfortable, decent price for minibar, very big shower and great view, the hotel have many bars and restaurants, very good food, don't miss breakfast at the rooftop amazing view for the morning, great location, and splandid service.Ill definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My partner and I arrived at the Hotel New Otani through a side entrance and late in the evening. The rather imposing security man directed us to the 6th floor hotel lobby of the Garden Tower.Alighting from the lift, we were greeted by the staff who relieved us of our baggage. The check-in process was swift and pleasant. As the bell-girl walked us to the room, she pointed out pleasant details about the hotel and gardens, which are gorgeous, even in November.Our room was in the Main of the Hotel New Otani, built for the 1964 Olympics. The room was newly refurbished and was especially well-appointed. The lighting controls were a bit of a mystery, and the position of the downlighting was a bothersome at times. Despite the minor lighting issues, we enjoyed every aspect of the room, from the complimentary sake to the housecoats. The Japanese bathtub provided much relief after a day-long trek through the sights of Tokyo. The hotel is centrally located, and reaching the transportation network was a breeze, though there were always taxis parked out front.I intend to return to Tokyo again and again. The Hotel New Otani will be my first reservation after choosing my flight.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: OK, so we may have been silently upgraded to a much larger room on the 10th than we booked, but the room was very large by Tokyo standards. Not sure what you call this bed, but it was 30-40% wider than the king, would fit a sumo couple comfortably. Separate shower and toilet rooms. View of the TV tower (the other side is likely better, it overlooks crown prince's residence and the 400yo garden). Carpet looked like it'd seen quite a few visitors, but all the rest was as good as new. We've been escorted by a cute little bell-girl, who wanted to roll our luggage and didn't want any tips, to our room and given full instructions on AC temp regulation and whatever else we wanted to know. Akasaka-Mitsuke is a great area to stay and walk around. All the areas frequently mentioned in travel guides were swarming with people and cheap merchants catering to them ugh.The hotel has a Kyubey (!) sushi restaurant on prems. We walked in and got a choice of sitting by the bar or at the table, Saturday evening!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I didn’t think hotels like the New Otani existed any more. When I was a kid, my parents used to take me to quietly elegant hotels where upon stepping in, one felt enveloped in a blanket of comfort and luxury, with every need taken care off. I was also reminded of the grand hotels I used to visit by the top quality shops and restaurants in the New Otani, such as Pierre Herme and La Tour d’Argent. The gardens and the view from the tower restaurant is spectacular and while the rooms are compact, they’re extremely cosy and have quality toiletries. Yotsuya metro station is a short walk away. I would definitely, unquestionably stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Loved this hotel, it is an old style but very nice with a beautiful Japanese garden, food was excellent and service was too, i will be back. It is not central for walking in to town, but a short taxi or train journey and your are down town.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I recently stayed at this hotel twice on my trip to Japan: once at the front end of our trip and then again at the end. The hotel is very large with several different room towers, restaurants, bars and shops. Our room was great on the front end of the stay. Our room was on the 11th floor, club level in The Main tower which had recently been renovated and updated. The amenities and toiletries in the room were great! We enjoyed complimentary breakfast in the garden room both mornings with an excellent view of the garden, waterfall and koi pond. However, on the back end of our trip, our room in The Main was the exact opposite. We were on the 4th floor and the room was very very outdated. The room had very few outlets and our phones which we were using as an alarm clock had to be plugged in across the room. The bathroom was very small like bubblegum pink tile and two people could not be in the bathroom at the same time. The toilet took up most of the space and the ceiling was very low.We did enjoy breakfast in the sky tower the last morning of our stay which had a unique view of the Tokyo skyline. For more of my trip to Japan, check out Mullen-It-Over on Instagram!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is easily accessible from the airport via the airport limousine bus. Check-in was speedy. Service during our 5-day stay was very politely and delightfully Japanese. The rooms are well-stocked with Shiseido toiletries. Sleep quality was excellent. Guests must not miss seeing the Japanese garden, and you'll usually see locals having their wedding pictures taken, in elaborate kimonos. There are 2 train stations nearby, the Yotsuya and Akasaka stations. But we also spent a lot of time wandering the little streets around the hotel. One con- the pool is not free to use. And upon checkout, you still get charged an 'accommodation fee' or 'resort fee' of 200 yen per person per day, whether or not you used the pool or business center.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Avoid this hotel if traveling on business. It is outdated and both service and facilities are lacking. Was told by the receptionist and the duty supervisor that they cannot provide a copy of the folio because it was a prepaid stay through American Express Platinum card. I have stayed 75-100 nights a year in hotels for the past 10+ years, and this is the first time ever a hotel refused to provide a copy of the folio for reimbursement. They simply asked me to leav by saying “thank you for staying” five times to all my questions. Shockingly poor service.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is an older Hotel but it is very nice. MANY restaurants! Lots of people too! Tons of shops. You really do not need to leave the hotel! Will be back next year! The staff was wonderful! We had a wonderful of the SkyTree!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We spent four nights here at the end of our 18 day central Honshu holiday. We were placed in a recently refurbished “Edo” room and couldn’t have been happier. The generous inclusions were replaced each day, including a bottle of sake and apple vinegar wine in the refrigerator. The toiletries supplied were of a high standard. The bathroom had a traditional cedar bath. Please don’t think I am a miser but I did not eat or drink in this hotel after a few early experiences. These included a $40 AUD glass of whiskey and a mediocre $17.50 cafe latte. We certainly weren’t going to pay $45 AUD for a hamburger at ‘Trader Vic’s’...come on. Luckily there are some great restaurant choices only a 10 minute walk away in the direction of the Metro station. We can recommend the sushi at Itamae Sushi Edo in Akasaka... enjoy the musical road crossings on the way.During my trip I had some gifts stolen from my suitcase. This is one of three hotels in which it may have occurred. I can prove nothing as the loss was discovered later.All I’m suggesting is you lock your suitcase when outside of your hotel room ... even in Japan.If this is your last ‘port of call’ in Japan and you are returning to Narita airport, the Friendly Airport Limousine bus stops right outside the hotel. So easy and you don’t even have to touch your bags until you arrive at the airport. Much cheaper than the NEX from Shinjuku.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent three great days at this large but lovely hotel on central Tokyo. Everything was wonderful: impeccable service from the front desk, housekeeping, the Concierge desk. The New Otani is a huge hotel, but their excellent service and courtesy give the place an intimate feel. You can tell a lot about a hotel by the caliber of the concierge desk, and the New Otani’s was superb. In particular, Ms. Sayarha Nishijima was excellent: flawless English, great patience and courtesy, and a highly informed knowledge of what a non-Japanese -speaking tourist would need to know. She was quick to make a call, print a map, describe a place, etc. She even came to wish me goodbye as I left on the Airport Limousine Bus.Everything was elegant and meticulous at the New Otani, giving a great experience of Japanese hospitality and pampering. I can’t wait to return, and I left a few hours ago. I will attach photos of front desk, Ms. Nishijima, the staff uniforms.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were on a family vacation to Japan. The New Otani, The Main was a large hotel with a different feel of its own. It’s a huge hotel with 32 restaurants small and big and a lot of shops on the lower floors to choose from.Though it’s a very large hotel, it has a personal touch to all its guest rooms. It sure strives for excellence. The garden needs a special mention and one must keep a couple of hours free to enjoy it. It has a lovely waterfall and a little stream flowing through it. Loads of seating is available in the garden to enjoy the peace, calm and meditation.The staff is super friendly and warm and will go beyond a call to keep the guest happy, satisfied and comfortable. The hotel is about a 4 minute walk to the nearest station which connects you to the Tokyo station. The hotel provides you with a cell phone with unlimited internet access and calls anywhere locally or internationally for the duration of your stay. This service is one of its kind provided anywhere in the world.It was a great and comfortable stay and we sure will come back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This very big hotel is an experience on itself. First not to get lost inside and then try to experience one of the five different breakfast possibilities. The staff is experienced and very friendly and all is smootlhy organised. The only but are the small bathrooms. For a five star hotel would you expect a big shower and separate toilet. Showers had to be taken in a small bath with curtain. Nevertheless, this is a hotel I wish to return to the next time. Not cheap though, but no hotel is in Tokyo...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here with a friend early November. The hotel is huge and fairly easy to get lost in if you're only staying a few days. Easy to find from the Tokyo Metro - Akasaka Mitsuke exit D, turn left over the bridge and it's right there. Staff are really pleasant and helpful and we had a good room for the price. To note though, everything is extra cost including the Spa which is 5000 yen plus tax - and if the pool is busy (4 people) they will only let you in for half an hour. The Japanese Spa, sauna and steam rooms were a bit dated, but really good to use. Also note that if you are being picked up for onward travel, make sure you know where your transport is picking you up as there are 3 potential areas!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is outstanding, easy to get to board limousine bus from Narita airport. Staff was phenomenal, attentive, and super helpful. From the hotel many pubs and restaurants are easy walking. There is a beautiful shrine close by as well.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was recommended to stay at Hotel new Otani by a friend who visits Tokyo extensively. Even though I had heard great things about the hotel, I was still very pleasantly surprised.I booked a room in the main tower and had a beautiful view of Mount Fuji in addition to the view of the Japanese Garden. The staff are super friendly and exceptionally helpful and go above and beyond the call of duty and are genuinely concerned about your wellbeing and enjoyment while you are there.The hotel is very well equipped, the room is large and there are numerous restaurants and stores. They even have a pharmacy, a post office, a bridal shop and a florist.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first non-business trip to Japan and like many hotels in Tokyo, the New Otani strives for excellence. Despite its size, the hotel is very personable and although there may be need for some refurbishment, that is neither to do with the quality of the fittings or their age it is more about the style. There are two parts to the hotel and I understand that one side has gone through this.They have an interesting concept, with luxury shops on the lower floors as well as places where one can buy a snack or trinket. There are numerous, very high quality restaurants and bars dotted on the premises. These are of a high standard, indeed excellent but pricey - recognising the skill of the chefs and kitchen teams. Breakfast is a choice between the ground floor section overlooking the delightful garden and waterfall or up in the higher level (40th Floor) with buffet along with table service for coffee. There is a chance to try a Japanese breakfast as well.The garden is well worth a mention, as it has been preserved to a very high standard and is a place to relax. There is a pool too, nearby, but this is open more in the summer months.New Otani is positioned well for metro stations and we found the metro to be very tourist friendly - beware locating exits and do homework on that.I suppose in summary, New Otani has wonderful and timeless values, it offers more than a glass atrium sanctuary and has the capacity to cope with many guests and not feel like a tourist hotel. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Big hotel with great service. Make you feel very welcome. Love the free loaner phone. Restaurants and bars are less impressive, food was good but expensive (even for Japan) service in the noodle bar was very slow, there was only one other person in the place but our food still took forever.
user_name:
Nick H
Kirkland, Washington, United States

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel has direct limousine bus to and from Narita airport. If you purchase the return bus tickets it's much cheaper. Once arrived, the hotel is accessible to two stations within 6 to 8 minutes walking distance and you can Access Shinjuku and Shibuya with ease.The front desk service and all other services by the hotel staff are heart warming. The room is okay and understandably good enough for Tokyo standard for single occupancy. We like the bath salt provided in the bathroom. Many shops and amenities on the long lobby corridor including a pharmacy, bookstore, and many arts and fashion store.There're about five choices for breakfast places. The one closest to the lobby is just like any other business hotel, we'd recommend Garden cafe as the best breakfast spot. You'll have the view of the famous waterfall and Garden of the hotel. We visited in early autumn and it's absolutely beautiful. The koi fish are big enough you can see them swimming from a distance. Come early or try your luck to get the spot near the glass wall. Everyone made sure they took photos with the scenery before they left. Other Japanese style breakfast choice serves top grade Japanese food. Very honoured to be invited by the organizer to stay in this luxurious hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My room in the Main building seemed to have been recently refurbished, and had modern conveniences like a tablet with information about hotel services etc. The range of TV channels is very limited, and the few English-language channels had Japanese voice-overs. The main lobby bar does not have any non-smoking areas. You have to pay £22 to use the gym and/or pool, which is ridiculous given how expensive the hotel is. Nice bathrooms, with a traditional Japanese wooden bathing tub as well as a shower. Sakura is very good for a buffet breakfast. Overall my stay at this hotel was an underwhelming experience, considering how famous it is in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first time at the New Otani and we were almost overwhelmed by its size and the number of shops and restaurants on the property. Modern and well maintained, the Hotel New Otani has a lovely Japanese garden on the premises, complete with waterfalls. A great place to start your day!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed in the Otani previously and each time I get surprised how enormous this hotel is. I still manage to get lost in the gigantic maze of corridors, shopping malls and elevators. The hotel is super clean; the staff extraordinarily friendly and polite and the location central. Be prepared to fork out for hefty in-hotel food and coffee though. But that is Tokyo for you. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was a guest of this hotel in the early 80’s, back then is was fantastic. I’m glad to see that after so many years it’s still n excellent option for a pleasant stay in Tokyo. Rooms are ample, clean, full of amenities, and deliver its guest a great experience.
