The beds are a delight after a long day and bedding is of top quality.If I were to be extremely picky, I would say that our only problem was finding the light switch for our room which was located in the living area rather than the bedroom.I found the breakfast buffet to be lacking in substance compared to the rest of what the hotel offers.There are several luxury shops within the hotel mall as well as an ample selection of different restaurants.Be sure to visit trader Vic’s and order the seafood parrillada.The gardens are a memorable view as well.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is out second stay here and again it did not disappoint.The hotel is huge and I think it is in a class of its own for style and service. The garden restaurant setting is stunning with a long wall of glass overlooking the 400 year old Japanese garden. Don't leave without taking a walk around the garden. I can't imagine what such an area of land must be worth in the centre of Tokyo so having it preserved and part of the hotel grounds is quite a thing.The hotel itself is conveniently located near the Akasaka-Mitsuke metro station - just in case you don't arrive in a Rolls Royce! In Akasaka, near to the station, there are three parallel streets that are full of shops and restaurants and are well worth exploring.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for 10 days in August. Lets start with the good. The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful and the hotel has a lot of amenities including a really nice garden. The location is also pretty good. The only place you can really walk to is Akasaka (I think I have that right) but this is a great place for eating and not bad for shopping, plus there is a really nice shrine. You can't really walk to anywhere else of interest in Tokyo from here (with the exception if the imperial palace if you up for a bit of a stroll) BUT its only a short cab ride away from pretty much all the tourist spots. Now the not so good. Check-in is pretty much a nightmare and takes for ever (big tip here, join the New Otani Club. Its a FREE loyalty scheme but gives you a separate check-in desk and free entrance to the pool plus discounts at most of the restaurants). The hotel seems to be very fond of 1980's carpet. The room was a decent size but about 1/3 of it was taken up with the bathroom, which was actually very well appointed but also very 1980's. The carpet in the room entrance was threadbare and again the decor was a bit dated. The room has floor to ceiling windows, which turned out to be a massive issue. August in Tokyo is very hot. The room has a tiny aircon vent at one end and a controller that seems to make NO difference. With teh curtains open the room becomes unbearably hot almost instantly. Its like sitting in a car in a sunny car park with the windows up. This means when the sun is up you MUST have the curtains shut else you will fry. As the aircon vent is at one end of the room it also means that at night the bed furthest from the aircon has no cooling at all so it makes for very uncomfortable sleeping. The next issue is the lack of storage. This is very odd in a modern hotel. There are lots of very small drawers (sock drawer size) and a large walk-in closet but that's it. So you can hang clothes up but there are no drawers big enough to put any clothes in, so they need to remain in your suitcases. Next is the bed situation. We had 3 adults staying in the room (myself, my wife and our adult son). The pictures on line show nice 3 bed rooms. Actually what we had was a 2 bed room and a medieval torture device that the 3rd person was supposed to sleep on. To be exact it was a hard wooden board with a 2 inch mattress on it. No springs, no comfort. It was honestly more comfortable sleeping on the floor. Let's move away from the room and talk about the amenities. We didn't make it to the pool (which you will need to pay to enter, even as a guest) or the tennis courts, but we did eat at the hotel. This is a big mistake. The food is generally good but, at approx £10 ($13) for a coffee, about the same for a glass of orange juice, £20 ($26) for a BLT and £35 ($45) for a burger, the prices were insane. 3 drinks and a sandwich in the hotel bar cost about £90 ($117). We did eat in the coffee shop once but gave up after an hour when they were unable to provide the waffles we had ordered. We eventually walked out and the manager confirmed we wouldn't be charged but the charge of around £100 still appeared on our bill (for 2 coffee's) and Waffles that were inedible which we didn't eat.So approx £400 ($520) per night and EVERYTHING cost extra and is insanely expensive. In 10 days we managed over £1500 ($1950) in room charges.So, in short, good location, friendly staff, insane prices, poor rooms. Its not actually a bad hotel, it just isn't worth the money.Tokyo, however, is one of the most amazing places on earth. It also has the friendliest and most helpful people and some of the best food I have ever eaten. Its also nowhere near as expensive as its reputation would have you believe. Unless you stay at the New Otani of course......

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Amazing hotel, from the decor to the traditional garden - and not to mention the awesome staff that work there. Was felt very welcomed until I left - I felt ill on the night before I flew and the staff (and managers) took care of me exceptionally well - making sure I was fit again. Thank you again for the service and I will be coming back soon. In terms of location, I feel it is ideal enough just outside of the main Tokyo-busy hubs, with quick and easy access to trains.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a great hotel with everything you need inside: restaurants, room service, shopping mall and a pool. The location of the hotel is good, walking distance to lots of nearby restaurants and the metro. We got upgraded to the junior suite which was amazing. Ordered some room service, the service and food was both great. We also tried the pool, during the heat wave in July this was a very warm experience as the temperature in the water was above 30c. There is just one pool, so we also had to share with a bunch of kids. This, plus the fact that the hotel was a bit dated makes it a 4 out of 5. Would definitly recommend the hotel, the service and experience overall was amazing and we enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I had a room in “The Main” which was large, comfortable but the bathroom was straight out of 1982. They are renovating currently so I expect this will change in the future. Otherwise this complex of hotels, restaurants, shops has excellent service and is well positioned in central Tokyo between the two imperial palaces. My colleague stayed in “The Garden Tower” and his room was small and very dated (key entry even) so I would avoid this part of the hotel currently. The upgraded Japanese suites on a couple of the floors in the main building look outstanding but are twice the price. The gardens and waterfall are very relaxing and I ended up enjoying the feeling of travelling back to the late 70s as I walked along the endless hallways. Get coffee from Tullys coffee or across the road at dean and deluca.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This place has hosted the G7 several times which is a testament to the quality. I’ve been to Tokyo 3x now and every time I stay here. It’s consistent and a nice location with a metro station about a 2 minute walk. The rooms in the Main are the nicest more than the tower. The breakfast buffet is nice but they really need to add an omelette station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel New Otani is huge. I was staying in the Garden Tower - the room was moderately sized but comfortable. The service is highly professional and has that Japanese quality - ometenashi - which is rare in the West. A converter plug sent to my room in 5 mins free of charge - bravo! Apart from its many restaurants & bars it has the most exquisite Jaoanese gardens with waterfalls. Loved it. Would go back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Well located and with a 400 year old Japanese Garden this hotel fid not disappoint. Spent 3 nights, the first was in a Shin-Edo room giving me a taste of luxury Japanese style. The Garden Lounge buffet breakfast was excellent. A 5 minute walk brings you to an area full of restaurants and convenience stores.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Having stayed at several other hotels, in Tokyo, Nikko, Kyoto and Osaka, we found the New Otani Main to be by far the best. The price may be a little higher, but for the size and quality of the rooms, the location, the quality of the staff - and for the amazingly beautiful Japanese garden, the extra is well worth it. To be able to relax in a large and sumptuous room for 2 nights, after a 3-week tour if Japan, was a perfect ending before our long flight home. Restaurant meals in the hotel are pricey, but like most non-business guests we avoided this by eating out.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Perfect location - 5 min walk to the subway station and on the main line to all the tourist attractions.the hotel staff are amazing in catering to all your needs and have information sheets and maps in English for all the top locations. Staff even helped me with the breakfast buffet as I have food allergies. all food was labelled in English and picture identifying what was in each of the dishes. rooms are well appointed and spacious, perhaps a little dates but still nice. Bathrobes are in your room for use along with slippers. And the bathroom was huge! Internet is fast and FREE Our room didn't have much of a view (4floor) but looked towards the gardens. i'm sure a higher floor would have better views. the only down side was the bed - it was a super king sized bed that was extremely firm. it was the only down side to the whole place. I would highly recommend this place to anyone wanting a zen get away in the heart of the city. NB: if you are looking for a late night meal try the beef and rice dish on the night time room service menu it's AMAZING!! Oh and the room has a door bell

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. We were very pleased with the quality of the rooms and very clean. Breakfast buffet has a good selection and was overall a good quality. The staff at the hotel is very professional and attentive. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Lots of good restaurants close by. The hotel is also located close to a metro station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here at the beginning of our tour of Japan. The hotel is like a small city with three towers, thousands of rooms, and around 40 restaurants. In our first room there was a problem with the air conditioning the hotel moved us to a better room. The hotel is spotless, the service polite and friendly and efficient. Language was not a problem because if no one spoke English, the menus had pictures. Elevators were plentiful and fast. The included breakfast buffets had a large variety of foods and again everything thing was spotless. There was lots of variety with a very nice presentation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If size matters then this hotel is for you. The rooms were bigger than most Tokyo apartments! Great ammenities in the bathroom including Shisedo products which is a nice touch. Staff were all lovely and room service varied and good quality. I was slightly disappointed in the breakfast buffet which didn’t have the range of other 5 star hotels eg no fresh fruit. Location is in the business part of Tokyo so there wasn’t heaps to do close to the hotel, but close to train station. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just huge with muliple restuarants and shopping throughout coupled with highest level of service from every area.Perfect breakfastGreat location with a metro station within a short walkHighly recommended

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A old school hotel, that could teach many newer hotels a few things; ambiance, service, luxury, We loved it, the bellman & women in their uniforms that were always so helpful, front desk personal too very friendly.It is a huge convention hotel, but still felt comfortable while we were there for holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A really fascinating hotel with 3 towers excellent breakfast. Beautiful Japanese Garden at the Ground level views from all restaurants. Large rooms and excellent service. Very courteous Japanese staff.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great Hotel to stay although it can get a bit confusing due to its shear size.Rooms are quite large with over size king bed, unfortunately they could have devoted more space to the bathroom which is VERY cramped. A seperate shower and toilet would have made our stay at this hotel perfect.Great Wi Fi throughout the whole complex which is the size of a shopping center - oh it includes a shopping center.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed 2 nights at the Garden Tower when I was there for business last week. The hotel is huge and a little impersonal with a number of shops and 4 restaurants to choose from. I had breakfast sent to my room using the breakfast coupon that was given out when I checked in and what I ordered was lovely with warm croissants and freshly brewed coffee. The room I stayed in is a bit dated and the ceiling's pretty low but it is extremely clean. The hotel is right in the city centre of Tokyo, but located in a quiet and peaceful corner next to a public park. The Narita airport limousine bus stops right in front of the hotel which is a big plus in terms of convenience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is my third stay in the New Otani and it seems I’d been lucky until now. Checked into my room on 7th floor and then saw the bathroom - fixtures look like they’ve come from a 1970’s plumbing catalogue and had a horrible fabric shower curtain that is cold and sticks to you when you shower. The shower water pressure was fantastic, but this was the only good thing. Breakfast buffet was good but there are horrendous queues at busy times, even when there was a plethora of free tables. Service is friendly, but my Japanese is poor so I have to use English and sometimes there were struggles in communication despite our best efforts.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Room clean and comfortable with all amenities. Hotel very large so can be hard to find your way around, and can require walking for some distance. Dining options limited as away from local restaurants, in house very expensive, drink and small salad for 2 cost over 85AUD but superb view of Tokyo at night .However good variety of options for breakfast. Staff friendly but some difficulty in explaining directions

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We are delighted to be staying in the New Otani Tokyo. It's simply amazing. Located in a 400 year old garden, it has shops, restaurants and cafes. The staff are wonderful. The rooms and bathroom are really spacious for hotel rooms; they've thought of everything, even an emergency torch.However, we arrived yesterday and slept very badly last night; consequently arrived to breakfast two minutes late and would not be admitted.We were with Japanese friends today and they were very disappointed and said this is not typical. Yet, what are we to think? We'd paid in advance as it is a package. We explained that to the young woman but to no avail. We're very disappointed.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is an OLD hotel. If you need a taste of how old.. check my photo of the room key. The TV and furniture looks like it has been here for thr past 20 years. AC on the room? Doesnt work. Bathroom is so bad and unwelcoming, makes you want to just shower and run out. Ammenities?? You better bring your own. No body lotion, etc. Front desk is amazingly rude, buffet expensive and not worthy. I came here for a first trip with my mom (70years old). She got her daily call from my 6 year old nephew who lives in USA, and ALL waiters rushed to tell her to hang up the call.. this, in the middle of an open restaurant, not luxurious, not fancy, not nothing, just a buffet in the lobby of the hotel. Was ridiculous. The call was not even loud. BTW you cannot go to the pool if you dont get a membership. And forget about going to the spa if you got tattoos. They will decline the service. This is NOT a japanese traditional hotel, its supposed to be an international hotel and yet, they dont know how to treat different cultures. I dont have excessive or over the top tattoos ( which shoudlnt matter anyway). My tattoos are small and in written says " life is a dream" . Is not even offensive. And yet the reason given was that " in japan mafia yakuza uses tattoos". Honestly I dont look close to being japanese, far from being mistaken for a yakuza. Just for the record: Im a CEO, I own my company, Im in technology and have seen the best tech guys wearing the best awesome tattoos. And the same goes for artists, accountants, etc...So if they pretend to be an international hotel, they better act like one. Now let me go for food experience. I paid 895USD for a teppanyaki. Yes, it was my decision, i have the money to do it, and i couldnt care less. YET, after I ordered my teppanyaki , i was approached 3 times to tell me about the price. I guess is ok the first time. Makes sense. Its an expensive dinner.people should be warned. BUT 3 times seems annoying and almost that they dont believe you can afford.If you want to have a nice time in tokyo, please avoid this old hotel with old furniture, bad manners, and expensive food. Not worth it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I love visiting Japan but hotels are sometimes problematic as many are quite old and the prolonged weak economy has meant not all are upgraded or only partially so, and i feel that this probably applies to the New Otani. Saying that, the welcome, service and cleanliness is impeccable here. On the approach this is an impressive hotel but as we walked the long corridor to the garden tower I felt time recede with each step. From the room, there was no garden evident, only tennis courts and a building site and although the room was decently decorated it felt and smelt tired and was a tad damp, not what I was expecting. Had we been staying more than one night I might have requested a room change and I feel it is likely they would have done so such was the excellent service.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for our last couple of nights in Japan, and the hotel was good to explore Tokyo. The location is fairly central and there are stations nearby. Our room had a nice city view and was very large. The style of the hotel is quite old school American with a massive lobby and a rooftop bar (great for a night cap), so parts of the hotel can look a little dated. The staff was very nice and polite but the service was a little slow, especially when it came to luggage, as the hotel is so big. Overall a good option for a Tokyo visit.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights in July. It is a very busy hotel and I'm told it has its own hospital. However, the rooms are large and very clean as with everything in Japan. The place is run like a swiss watch and every detail is attended to. We were on a group tour so our guide was a great asset to us. Overall this is a great hotel right beside the subway to get you anywhere in Tokyo. There's plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicinity also.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The place does epitomise the perfectionist ethos of the Japanese. From the reception/concierge to the impeccably clean rooms to the wide variety of foods available. A default base for business travellers.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms are a bit dated, but nice and big. The place is huge. Close to Akasaka Station which sits on Ginza / Marunouchi Chiyoda lines. Restaurants are typical hotel style and a bit pricy. I have stayed a few times, but tend to eat out - lots of options just across the street in Akasaka.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We spent some Japanese time in a couple of Ryokans to get a taste of true Japanese culture (sp?) and these were by and large good BUT how lovely it was to come back to Otani with its space and cleanliness like an oasis in the desert. Loved the shower (sometimes lacking in other accommodation), and the lovely large bed.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I chose this hotel because of its walking distance to our office in Tokyo and I ended up having a great experience. Clean, big, and comfy rooms, decent food (not great for Japan though) and excellent staff. It is conveniently close to Akasana metro so all the city is easily at reach, but you also have a jewell right at your fingertips ... the hotel gardens, that used to belong to an old samurai lord.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A really enjoyable place to stay, with good, if slightly basic (it was built in the 1960s), rooms. The staff were uniformly helpful. The place is, however, huge and you will need to remember which bit you are in. My breakfast was included in the price - the 40th floor restaurant has excellent view, despite the Tokyo smog. I would warn, however, that - as you might expect for an upper range central hotel, eating in for lunch or dinner is expensive. That said, the concierges were really helpful and there's plenty of good cheap eateries nearby. If you have 20 minutes do pop out and look at the formal Japanese garden - really relaxing after a hard day.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for for night with my family, 2 adults & 2 teens for 4 nights.Although it’s not the closest to the city action or subway, it was a lovely retreat at the end of a busy day.Large rooms included seating area, generous bathrooms, comfortable beds. Very clean. Breakfast was excellent with both Japanese and western on offer.The garden is spectacular and beautifully maintained- well worth a stroll.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed two nights at this hotel in June and had a very good time. It is a huge hotel with shops, gardens, restaurants, and services. It is has a place selling cars! So, there is everything you need. The service is impeccable, our room was large and clean, it was quiet, and the gardens are beautiful. This hotel is has the feel of past grand hotels that were full service and they take service very seriously. Because it is so big it is often crowded so you might have to wait a bit. We had breakfast in the garden room Sunday morning. Get there early and you can get a seat by the windows overlooking the garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The place is a very high end, old-fashioned hotel. Excellent service and large, comfortable room. Feels like something out of a Bond movie from the early 80s. However, we booked the hotel solely based on the presence of an outdoor pool as we are here in Tokyo for a while but on arrival in 30C/90F heat which is typical for this time of year, we learned that the pool is not open until mid-July (and it is open only for a few months). Madness. We are very disappointed. Hoping this is helpful for someone else considering this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Superb service, sizable rooms (for Tokyo), elegant and truly a class act. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are meticulously clean with all the amenities and some I would not expect like a cell phone for your use. Would gladly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Firstly, this hotel was booked by my employer, secondly the poor rating relates to the over priced food and drinks. Overall the rooms are very comfortable, although the beds are a little hard. The service was mostly pretty good, although many of the staff struggled with english. The rooms do not have an iron, although you can arrange one via room service. The gardens around the hotel are fantastic and the cafe/restaurant overlooks the garden and waterfall. Its only a short walk, less than 10 mins to at least three metro lines. That pretty much covers the good stuff, now to the bad. Charging AUD20.00 for two take away coffees is just ridicules, and in all honesty the coffee is not that good. We were charged AUD16.00 for a brewed coffee in the cafe. I paid over AUD20.00 for a Strawberry/Ginger soda...the ginger part of the drink came out in a glass bottle, which was poured into a glass. The food and drink prices are just way over the top and you need to be very specific when ordering a coffee....stay clear of the brewed coffee, it is rubbish and I can't believe they serve this in such a high standard hotel. You need to order a hot espresso coffee. There are much better options for food, not to far from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms and the service were excellent. The grounds were very nice. The restaurants were over priced and the quality of food was very average. Breakfast was ridiculously expensive and took advantage that most guests had little choice given the more isolated location of the hotel. Lots of great restaurant options 15 minute walk from the hotel in the Akasake area.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very nice hotel, with good services, location and quality. Great selection of places to have breakfast. didn't have an opportunity to try dinning there. Very good wifi.Great service at check in and check out.Rooms are medium size, very clean, very modern and quite!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Context:Staying here for 2 nights for a business trip. This is only the 2nd time for me visiting Tokyo. The first time, I stayed at Shiodome, so quite far from Akasaka - where this hotel is located. I did not know what to expect, only that the hotel is quite large.Rooms:Adequate size if on the smaller size. Room is well equipped though. Bed, large screen, control panels for lighting, coffee machine, minibar. Typical 4-5 star business hotel. Dining:The corporate rate does include breakfast and there are multiple options. I picked the tower buffer which is on the tower building top floor (40th floor). Good selection, better view, probably best view for any Tokyo hotel breakfast venue. View goes on for miles. Bonus: weather was clear, Mt Fuji was visible in all its glory!Facilities:The hotel has more than 40 (yes - four-oh!) dining venues. It is overwhelming at times, but you can never be short of dining options. Intangibles:The hotel tries to be all things to all people, and you know what - it succeeds! There is a large Japanese garden with waterfalls - very pretty. It has a rooftop rose garden, with red roses in full bloom. I mentioned the variety of dining venues. The large hotel complex has a shopping arcades - selling souvenirs, and general supplies (meds, candies, snacks), and there is a Fami-ma (Family Mart) convenience store. Oh .. and if you have a hankering to shop for a car, the ground floor of the hotel housed a Rolls Royce (yes - Rolls Royce!) dealership. Staff:Really the difference maker of the hotel. Everyone is super polite, and super helpful. I stayed at Conrad, and was pampered - as one expected for a Conrad. But the staff at New Otani is on par. If I come back to Tokyo, New Otani would be at the top of the list, just due to the quality of the staff.Location;Akasaka area. It is about 5-7 min walk to Akasaka-Mitsuke station for easy access to Tokyo Metro. The area around the station was quite lively in the evening. Summary:I have no major complaint here. The bathroom maybe a little dated, and room was not as modern as newer hotel, but staff and other intangibles make up the difference. It is definitely among my top choices for next Tokyo trips.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: the hotel itself is beautiful, enormous, luxury, however, the service was not exceed my exceptions. the operator staff couldn't understand english, even i spoke slowly, and front desk staff took about 20mins to do the check-in! my bathroom has no ventilation, so i can barely breathe every time i take a shower! the solution they offered was to deliver a electric fan! with similar rate, i could go to another luxury hotel with much better service in tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel consists of three different buildings. The main, garden tower and Gardencourt I think. We stayed in garden tower. Our building was the oldest and still used actual physical keys instead of key cards. They brought us to Japan times every day. The doors have doorbells which was handy for us because her kids are staying in a different room two doors down. Rooms are not huge but very comfortable. If I had any complaints it was the air-conditioning. It blows out cool moist air, so the air gets cooler but then everything feels sticky. I cleaned her room every day so we always had nice dry sheets to sleep on but I am glad grateful we didn’t need to spend much time in the rooms for that reason of the air conditioning issue. There are tons of stores and restaurants in the building but they are all very expensive with the exception of a convenience store located in the garden court . The location is excellent, The nearest metro stop is literally less than a five minute walk away, the nearest JR rail stop is Yotsuya, a pleasant 10 minute walk away. We had JR rail passes so we used the Yotsuda station every day . Shinjuku station was just a couple of stops away, as was the Tokyo station, and most big trains and other trains all connect those two stations. In the direction of the metro station is an area with lots and lots of restaurants and shops. Very authentic most of them don’t have English menus . One evening in desperation to find a place for the kids to eat we just ended up eating at the Wendy’s in that same area. But that’s the only time we resorted to non-local food.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My stay at the New Otani Main was a last-minute choice; I wasn't sure what to expect, especially as I knew that it was a very large hotel. But have to say, my stay there was wonderful all around, and I'd highly recommend this iconic Tokyo hotel to almost anyone.Tokyo is a vast city, and you couldn't ask for a better, more central, location than the New Otani has. The hotel--built in early sixties modern style--is famous for its fabulous, park-like gardens. But it was the room itself that I really loved. A good view is important to me, so I upgraded to a deluxe room (small suite, really), with a fabulous view of Tokyo that made me never want to leave the room. It had a large sitting area and a semi-separate sleeping area, all done in dark, understated colors. It was luxurious without being ostentatious, with one of the best bathrooms I've ever seen in a hotel (with electronic shades that made it possible to see the great view while taking a bath). Though the hotel is very large, the service was impeccable, and one could choose from an infinite number of restaurants to dine in. There's an indoor pool in the health club, a great looking outdoor pool set in the lovely gardens, and even tennis and squash courts. In short, I really loved my stay at this place. If you need a totally minimalist boutique hotel experience this might not be for you, but I felt like I got the same level of service, despite the hotel's size. One thing to note: Whether you stay in the New Otani's Main Building, as I did, or in the Garden Tower next door, be sure to ask for a good view, which in my case meant the gardens and the city beyond.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Old style grandeur and perfect service. The hotel is large and clearly popular by both locals and official delagtions. Rooms are getting in need of remodeling. Not that they are in bad order - just a bit old fasihioned.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel offers all you need for a long business stay in Tokyo, 8 restaurants and many services. The room is spacious, the bed very good and the service outstanding. The bathroom needs update though (showers only!) and the prices of the meals should be more attractive (but then this is Tokyo). I will come back next time. Do enjoy the 400yo garden !

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The service at this place is unmatched, from the unobtrusive way everyone takes care of you from the minute you step in the hotel until you leave. The location is convenient to central Tokyo and the best part is the wonderful garden and waterfall. Highly recommend it. Rooms are generously large for a Japanese hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is an amazing conglomerate. Located very close to the Diet and the Imperial palace, the New Otani is a conglomerate of three very large buildings (highrises) and a large and beautiful garden. The complex occupies several city blocks, dedicates several floors to shopping, offers about 30 choices of restaurants, cafes and bars and has excellent convention facilities. The rooms are larger than in other hotels, well-appointed, and with the necessary amenities. Prices are commensurate to its luxury status.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is, according to themselves the largest in Japan. It was built for the first Olympic games in Tokyo - so the hotel is not the newest and most updated. Stayed for two days for business, so did not make use of any of the hotels facilities. The room worked well and of a good size. I opted in for their most expensive breakfast which was a bit of a let down - I have had better breakfast in less fancier hotels. Would recommend the hotel for business travels.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: On first sight the New Otani Main was overwhelming, especially after our long haul flight. Don't be put off by the size, it's worth getting lost in. We usually prefer smaller boutique hotels & were surprised by enjoying our stay so much. I chose it over others only because I wanted to see the famous Otani garden ! I/we weren't disappointed by either. Our only difficulty was having to wait 4 hours for our room. Had it not been raining heavily we would have started exploring despite being exhausted. Our room when available was fabulous with a glorious garden view, & especially comfy bed. We made use of the shower, strolled round the garden, our first of many Japanese gardens, ate well in one of the many restaurants, then had the best night's sleep ever. We ate a hearty breakfast in the Garden Tower which also gave us our first glimpse of Mt Fuji ! We were lucky to have clear views of the city & Mt Fuji both mornings. The Otani staff were the most helpful, most efficient & most polite we've ever encountered. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend & return ourselves.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Myself and 3 other family members stayed here for the last 2 nights of our visit to Japan. From the outset I would like to say that the service here is absolutely fantastic. Staff were very welcoming, friendly, and helpful, and catered to our every need. Also, this hotel is huge, We stayed in the Garden Tower and the rooms were very spacious and immaculate. Wifi was excellent, and there were plenty of options for dining. We quickly became big fans of the buffet breakfast at the Garden Lounge which had a view of the beautiful 400 year old garden. I can't fault our stay but have a few things to note. First, it was easy to tell that the Garden Tower building is older as the hallways are a little in need of refurbishment, however this is quickly forgotten once you're in the fantastic rooms. Second, it is a little isolated and you will most likely use taxis to get to and from the hotel. The nearest train station Yotsuya has limited drop-off options. Finally, this may not be an option if your on a tight budget as rooms and dining can be quite expensive. However, with all that said, my family and I had a wonderful stay and we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We travelled to Japan with Riviera Travel. Arrived tired after an eleven hour flight. What a superb hotel to be booked in with breakfast included. It is in a central position in Tokyo with a beautiful garden at the back for sole use of guests. Great place to relaxed. Staff were brilliant and could not do enough for you. Could not praise it enough. Breakfast was first rate!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great location and service, lots of restaurants and shopsThe room has a lot of complementary items and it provides free newspaper and water every day.It's near a JR and a metro station and is the first stop on the bus limousine

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was for a business trip for 1 week in Tokio and stayed in this hotel. Most warm welcome with a fruit basket. The hotel is big and also used for big groups of tourists and business conferences. A lot of restaurants and bars. A great historical garden. Food and service is excellent. Excellent location in Central Tokio.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is lovely. Lots of shops very helpful concierge service. Nice friendly staff. Great breakfast very good choice of western and Japanese food. Comfortable rooms. Lovely Gardens Nice pool. Very well situated. Big bus tour leaves from basement floor. Plenty of Restaurants on site and nearby. Nice sky bar. Book as gets very busy.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Where to start. This was excellent from start to finish. Yes it’s not the most modern or chic hotel, but in a way it’s above all that. Feels more stately than most 5 star hotels. Staff couldn’t do enough to help you and the added bonus if the lovely gardens cap it off. The room (standard, in the main) was of a great size and more than comfortable. Will be using this as my Tokyo go to.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This a full service, large scale hotel located in a very convenient area. The staff is super helpful, and there are plenty of English speakers available.We stayed here in the spring for business and appreciated the easy access to metro and train stations, the airport bus service and the many full-service restaurants on site. We had two excellent meals, including a teppinyaki experience that was memorable.If you stay here, take advantage of your sleepless nights and go for a walk in the relaxing gardens or nearby neighborhoods. The Emporer's palace, a shinto shrine and many other interesting attractions are nearby (walking distance). We would stay here again when we would visit.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel was included as a pre-cruise extension with Viking Cruises. The room was huge and very comfortable, with excellent amenities. Our room gave us a beautiful view of the royal gardens across the freeway from the hotel. In the distance, Mt. Fuji could sort of be seen through the fog or haze. We especially enjoyed seeing the bell-staff dressed in old-style uniforms (see photo.) They were stationed throughout the hotel, so it was not possible to get lost. Most of them spoke passable English. All the desk staff spoke English.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If you like big hotels, the New Otani is a well appointed, very comfortable hotel located in central Akasaka, Tokyo. Frequented by many western tourists and Japanese business people, the cafés and lobby can be very busy at times (breakfast). There is numerous restaurants to choose from, as well as a lovely Japanese garden to walk around. The pool area (weather permitting) is possibly the largest of any hotel in Tokyo. The rooms are comfortable, and the free phone/wifi/tablet access is a good service.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was there for a business trip and sight seeing on this beautiful Sakura season. The hotel service was too good to be true when I was not having my luggage. They actually delivered to my room after the airport found it. To me, they seriously taken down all details that I told them and really do it with all effort to ensure I get it besides the Narita Airport personnel. Apart from that, there was a beautiful garden that you could view beautiful sakura and waterfall within the garden. How soothing, peaceful and nice walk after your nice buffet breakfast.You want to know more about the food, email me. The food were superb and worth. You can always go out and try others. The train stations were quite nearby with walking distance through the garden tower and not the the main entrance depending which part of your stay.This is a nice hotel and you could never miss the beautiful surrounding especially night Sakura opposite the hotel. Wait no more and try this hotel if you have the budget to do so. A worthy though and good experience. This is another part of Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Our stay at the New Otani Hotel in Tokyo was arranged by Viking River Cruises as part of a 3 day package added-on to our cruise in China. The New Otani is a very elegant hotel with a beautiful sunken garden which is open day and night for the guests. We stayed in the Garden Tower for several days and enjoyed all the amenities one could imagine. The room was large, and the bedding and furniture were either new or meticulously maintained. Quality toiletries of every description were furnished, including bathrobes and new slippers accompanied by a note suggesting we keep the slippers for use at home, too. We had received breakfast vouchers for each day, and we used them at the excellent buffet on one of the upper floors of our tower. The one night we dined at one of the hotel’s many restaurants, we ordered one small Crab Rangoon appetizer, one hamburger, one bowl of lobster bisque, one salad, and one bottle of beer. The fare was more than $100 for that small (but delicious) meal.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The basic job of a hotel is to provide a good night sleep. This is where this hotel failed. The air conditioning in the room was feeble and the result was that the hotel room was uncomfortably hot overnight. Other than this, the hotel is of a good standard with nice fittings, decent beds, good service and good food. It is also very well positioned for access to restaurants and metro.The view from the restaurant on the 40th Floors is great and not to be missed. Basically, if they could provide decent air conditioning, the hotel would be excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We chose a Western style lunch. Had a chicken dinner that was great. Very good salad and also had some rice rolled in sea weed. Service was very good and friendly. Did not stay at this hotel, just stopped for lunch.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is huge and has so many rooms spread over many wings. We were lucky to have garden view room. The rooms are spacious and has all the amenities of 5 star hotel. The bathrooms are also of decent size with tub. The toiletries provided are of good quality and sufficient in numbers.It has a v big private Japanese Garden spread over acres, exclusive for its guest. They have waterfall. They have maintained it v well. In the night, splendid lighting is done in the garden. This is excellent place for photography and sitting in peace with nature with variety of colorful fishes swimming around in the pond.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Decided on a one night stay as a treat and to get away from my small Tokyo apartment. As the headline says this is a huge hotel. It is in fact two hotels (the main and Garden Tower) and one office complex (Garden Court). They are all interconnected and the signage between them isn't always great so be prepared to get lost - Often. The other confusing issue is that the 4th floor in one building is the 2nd in another. It also seems to exist in some space vortex as you can go through one door and then return back through it into somewhere completely different! Basically it is very confusing. There are circa 40 restaurants and countless shops along with a very large banqueting suite which is very popular for weddings so as you can imagine it can be very busy. I went on a holiday weekend and it was packed. However the hotel copes well with being busy and the staff are excellent. The hotel is nice enough. It is old (original 1964) but has been renovated a few times and in, in general, well equipped and well looked after. I stayed in a standard room on the 7th floor with a view over the rose garden. I suspect it is not the premium view as you could also see various air-con condensers. Room was fairly large. Larger than other hotel rooms I have stayed in in Tokyo. They have an outdoor pool which proved to be very popular. I got there about 10:15 (it opens at 10:00) and it was heaving. They sell club membership so the majority of people were not hotel guests. Despite being busy it was spotlessly clean (most things in Japan are) and the changing rooms first class. There is also a large Japanese Garden you can walk around which is well maintained. However with a number of wedding going on it is popular for photographs. They have a New Otani Club which you can join on arrival for free. This is worthwhile as it gives access to the club room on the 3rd floor as well as late checkout.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani was originally built for the Tokyo 1964 Olympics in a 400 year-old garden near the Imperial Palace. It is a five star hotel with plenty of different alternative accommodations. The SPA, the Shiatsu, the numerous restaurants make it an excellent choice for a Tokyo visit.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Third visit, staff is always perfection. Hotel has lots of energy, many shops, unlimited (50?) restaurant options although many are Japanese and pale to undifferentiated sameness for westerners. Small complaints: small seat toilets, bottom of shower door fitted with hard closures that can scrape the skin off your toes as the door opens inward. Inward opening door also means you get soaked with cold water when turning water on to shower. No towel hooks anywhere in the bathroom.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were stay in The New Otani Hotel for 2 nights. It was our honeymoon stay. Everything was perfect from the beginning. Before our stay we wrote a few e-mails with a request of 3 Michelin Star Restaurant in Tokyo. The concierge of hotel were very helpful and they booked for us this restaurant. During check-in we got printed confirmation of that. We also ordered SIM card that we also got at the reception desk during check-in.The hotel staff was extremely polite. As it was our honeymoon trip we got little gift from the hotel which was so nice surprise.Staff took our luggage and show our room, which was with the garden view (it was cherry blossom season, so it was very nice view). Room was spacious. Very clean and with a very comfortable bed. In the room we also found very nice thing- phone with Internet that we could use during our stay. It was very helpful. It was a great idea!After sightseeing we watched James Bond movie- You only live twice (some scenes of this movie was shooting in this hotel). In the room we had all needed amenities such as steamer iron. We highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Grounds are beautiful, views are lovely, breakfast was very good, and the location was great. The subway is just a few blocks away and it gets you to the Tokyo train station in minutes. So if you are intending to travel around by train, using Tokyo as your base, this works well.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Located close to the subway therefore easy to get to other areas.The hotel itself is big and not very special. We stayed in the garden tower where the rooms are small, ceilings are low and windows are small. Bit claustrophobic. We did request a transfer to the main building however due to renovation this was not possible, the front desk did really try.The garden court rooms are in need of serious refurbishment as they breathe old style although they tried to upgrade with new wallpaper and a modern looking chair. Rooms are clean and well maintained though.There is a nice Japanese garden outside, there are lots of restaurants in the hotel (expensive compared to prices you pay outside) and lots of other facilities I did not use. There is a pool in the garden but this is also fairly old-fashioned.Staff is very nice and friendly and always willing to help. Hotel does what it needs to do, provide a comfy clean room.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nice hotel complex with everything - nice rooms, attentive service, great shops and restaurants. Not much one can't do here. Within the complex there is also an art gallery as well as a beautiful Japanese garden and a rose garden. Wifi included and close to two metro stations. Fitness center is small but runners can go next door to run the perimeter of Akasaka Palace.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I loved staying at this hotel. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, the food was delicious and the rooms were incredibly clean and comfortable. Good WiFi service, easy to access. And excellent choices in the in-room dining service too. The hotel rooms were a good size and well appointed. The tidiness of interior fixtures and fittings was outstanding and it felt like the room had only been in-service for a few weeks. Would definitely recommend - lots of rooms available with a variety of different city views.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent full-service hotel with very helpful concierge, business center, many restaurants (the breakfast buffet was very good), bell captain, bus connections to the airports... Well located with 2 subway lines very close. Our room on the 9th floor was spacious and very comfortable with a king size bed. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: When we heard that the New Otani has a Japanese garden on the premises, we decided to stay there in our trip to Tokyo. We saw reviews that the Garden wing is quite old so better pay more and stay at The Main wing (its supposedly newer). The lobby of the hotel is quite nice, carpeted which muffles any sound echoes. The rooms are not the newest, they feel a bit aging. The beds are ok, relatively comfortable (although the single beds are quite small). The window is a bit thin so there is noise from outside that comes into the room all night. We tried to turn up the a/c fan speed to drown out the sound, but the fan was still silent and didn’t help. There are not many English tv stations apart from news stations. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite. And...we liked the Japanese garden. There were some Japanese couples having their wedding photos taken in the garden when we visited it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is my second time staying in this hotel for business trips. About 5-10min walk to the yotsuya station or akasaka. Lots of restaurants and convenience stores at akasaka. There’s a liquor store that sells cheap yamazaki and hakushu, if you’re lucky they have stocks. Hotel- Classic design may look slightly old but it’s luxurious facilities make you feel very comfortable. Clean and spacious room. Big bed, comfortable pillows. Full length window makes the room bright. WiFi works well but prefer it to be auto instead of logging in the WiFi everytime I come back to the hotel. Complimentary bottled water. Well equipped. 3 options for breakfast. 2 buffet (serves same food) in diff towers, and 1 jap food. Buffet food is the same everyday. There will be additional charge for the other restaurants. What I would like is they have more food options or change their menu. Great customer service. Overall, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Due to an online portal that advertises rooms as Semi-Double, when my wife and I arrived I was told semi-double means single. OK, I need to read the fine print next time. But other than that we were very happy with this traditional style hotel that offers a virtual potpourri of delectable delights

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Despite being more than 50 years old the hotel is wearing well. It was clear our room was recently refurbished but was only gripe was the bathroom which was showing its age. Our room overlooked the car park which in any other place would be unremarkable until you realise part of 'You Only Live Twice' was filmed there giving it a kudos it probably doesn't deserve. I've given the hotel 5 stars but 4.7 would be closer due to the bathroom. Come on New Otani get them improved.
user_name:
S G C
Kingston upon Hull, England

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed in the Garden tower which was very comfortable and had all the services provided throughout the hotel complex. The service was all I desired and the breakfast was good in both western locations (I didn't try the Japanese breakfast). The location is a short walk to subway and outside eating establishments. Rating to me is luxury, have no idea how others rate it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A grand hotel in a mega city, which yet offers local charm, great hospitality and serves as a place to relax. There is a beautiful Japanese Garden next to Hotel, which belongs to the overall complex. The Garden is the piece de resistance of the hotel and allows to decelerate and recharge after business meetings or sightseeing activities. The Japanese Garden serves as the backdrop for wedding pictures. There are over 40 Restaurant in the hotel complex and shopping mall, covering the vast range of culinary tastes. The restaurants are relatively expensive, so high quality has its prize, however, there are many eating options at walking distance from the hotel with lower prize range. The shopping mall is a bit of a maze, and it takes a while to get your bearings, which at the same can be pleasant experience to just get a bit lost and browse the many little shops. Apart from the Japanese garden, my favorites are the various rooftop restaurants, which offer fantastic panorama views of Tokyo at day or night. You can enjoy a view of Mount Fuji while having breakfast in the rooftop restaurant of the Garden Tower. For rooms, I recommend to stay in the Main and avoid rooms in the Garden Tower. My stays were during Winter and rooms in the Garden Tower tend to be quite hot and room temperature is difficult to regulate. I can highly recommend the New Otani Hotel for business stays and as a base to explore Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Had the pleasure of staying in a Junior Suite at the New Otani during Sakura season. Hadn't been at the hotel in 20-years-- and wasn't aware of the fine renovation carried out, about ten years ago. The most wonderful time I had at the hotel was in the garden. It really is a serene space in such a bustling city. An excellent stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel. Near the Imperial Palace and the Tokyo Dome. A 5 minute walk to the Suidobashi station on Toei Subway Mita Line and the Suidobashi station on the Churo JR East local train. This is a quiet area of Tokyo. Hotel looks and is, clean, neat, new, and modern, with all the amenities. The basic rooms (I slept in a basic room) are somewhat small, but the bed I slept in (queen size bed) was very comfortable and large enough for me. The bathroom is roomy and equipped with all the necessities. My room had a small refrigerator and safe. Whenever I am staying in Tokyo I always book a room here. This was the first hotel I stayed in during my first ever vacation to Japan. Hotel staff spoke basic English and was very helpful and friendly.
user_name:
dbk31147
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at Hotel New Otani Tokyo during a 4 week business trip. I travel a lot for work and stay in many hotels in different countries and this hotel offered the best service I have experienced to date! The staff has a passion for service and this is the come through in everything they do. This hotel is decided into 3 separate buildings(hotels) all linked together, I stayed in the main hotel building but you have access to all restaurants and bars across all 3 buildings. Ample restaurant choices for breakfast, all serving a wide range of choices of buffet breakfast. There is not a bad thing I can find about this hotel! Expensive but worth priced good for Tokyo!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani Hotel The Main is trying so hard to please their guests. Upgrade for a bigger room and garden view for no extra charge. Organizing a good room with great view even though they’re overbooked. The room is nicely decorated, it’s really nice and quiet, and housekeeping is good. Service, hospitality and comfort are really close to perfect. But what makes this hotel really perfect is that the staff makes you feel welcome and comfortable the best they can. My husband and I feel so comfortable here that we don’t want to book another hotel in Japan anymore.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel seemed to do everything right for me. Excellent service from checking in to out. Many staff around the common areas to help and direct. It is a large hotel with a sort of grand European feel some areas in particular the long corridor that connects the two main buildings. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Three options for breakfast, one in 41st floor offers fantastic views of Tokyo but the selection is not as good as the ground floor breakfast area.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Booked 2 rooms, 1 for single occupancy, 1 for double occupancy. Shown to our rooms, both smelled stale & musty; staff came with room sprays and air con units-slightly better. In the confusion of putting the bags in the room, my son was placed in the room booked for 2 people and was issued 2 keys, my husband and I were given only one. Either we lost the key immediately or the Bell boy didn’t give it to us and reception refused to give us 2 keys and only 1 more after much discussion. We had booked for 5 nights after a 3 week trip, travelling through Hokkaido and Honshu. We have stayed at one 3 star, one 4 star and four 5 star hotels. At all of them we have received impeccable service and the friendliness and respect of staff has been amazing. Then we arrived at the New Otani. Both the reception and the Garden lounge staff have been unhelpful and unaccommodating. What a disappointment. The service in the Tower buffet and Trader Vics was as it should be. My husband has been travelling to Japan for business for the last 25 years, he will not be returning to the New Otani, nor will we be recommending it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 軽食を食べにSATSUKIへ行きました。ピラフとビールを頼みましたがとても美味しく頂きました。若いスタッフのサービスは悪くはないがテーブルを担当した年配のサトウというスタッフの接客が最悪でした。空腹な為、アルコールを食事と一緒に出してもらうようにお願いしたにも関わらず「アルコールは一緒に出しますよね？」と言われ、違うといったらありえないみたいな態度をされました。また、飲み物をサーブする際も一切「失礼いたします」や「ごゆっくり」なども言わず、笑顔も一切なし。隣のテーブルの方がコーヒーをその人に頼んでるところも目撃したが立ち止まらずに歩きながら適当にオーダーをとっていた。ホテルでこんなサービスを見ることもなかなか無いと思う。Had light snack at SATSUKI. I ordered a beer and some food which was good and service is young staff wasn’t too bad however the staff who assist me was really unfriendly service. I have never serve that way before. If you wanna dine at SATSUKI and you were served by SATO, you should ask them change to someone else.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I booked a room for my husband and I about two to three months in advance. I picked a garden view room with a king bed. We get to Tokyo and the New Otani had me booked in a single room for one person. I was already spending close to 2,000 US and they wanted to charge me another 500 for the extra person! They were going to put us in some random room that we hadn’t chosen while expecting us to pay more! I found another hotel that was around the original price and it was in a better location, the New Otani is kind of its own little city there are no quick ins and outs. So if you plan on sight seeing I would find a hotel that isn’t so out of the way. There are much nicer hotels for better prices. This place is pretending to be a five star hotel, I’ve had better customer service at a best western.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Always stay here for business trips when in Tokyo. Service is fantastic. Hotel has a museum and great garden that is worth a visit. The sushi chef made a special meal for me one evening and I would say it was one of the best meals. Within walking distance to subway so very convenience and yet not too, too busy like in Shibuya.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The “new” Otani Hotel is not new. It was built in 1964 and is showing its age. The reception areas and public rooms are beautiful, but it started when I checked in. I normally lose a key card, so asked for a 2nd key card – to be told ‘only one card per guest’. The hotel is huge – it was built to house Olympic athletes and layout is reminiscent of an east-German enforced holiday camp. Getting to the room, I asked for an ironing board, which was not standard. it arrived, eventually, with a piece of paper saying: ‘as irons are in short supply please call housekeeping as soon as you are finished’. IN SHORT SUPPLY? They charge for everything and have useless advertising tablets in each room extolling the hotels virtues, but they can’t afford to buy a couple more irons.My room on 6th floor was really small, smelt of mildew and I think had original 1960 furniture and fittings. The desk chair had no padding, honestly the toilet seat had equal support. There was no space to put suitcase. The shower dripped all night. Internet in conference room was patchy and failed when I needed it most. Also, the coverage is with multiple different networks – public areas, rooms, restaurants, conference area – all have different networks so you are constantly dropping connection as you move.On the bright side, the gardens are lovely and it is quite well located. Staff are abundant and super nice and friendly – but I am evaluating this as an hotel, because of Wi-Fi idiocy and old furnishings It was almost worth 4 points but just missed.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A life long dream of my husbands was to go to Tokyo. When booking this hotel comes up as one of the BEST thus we booked. The service the staff give is incredible and the cleanliness of the hotel literally everywhere is phenomenal. The gardens are STUNNING and the pictures do it no justice and the location is good. However we pre paid for breakfast and dinner and ONLY got vouchers that could be used for brekkie OR lunch. The spa is not free even if not just to go to the swimming pool it is apprx £50 per person. Also when we got there despite pre booking and making it clear it was our honeymoon we got a room with two single beds!!! It then proceeded to take some form words of persuasion to insist they give us a newly married couple a room with a double bed! Overall great hotel and very 5* BUT everything comes at an extra costs for example a coke of coke £5!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If you like small, intimate places to stay, the New Otani is not for you. It's huge - lots of rooms, at least three different large dining room options for breakfast and easily three times that number for lunch and dinner. Everything about it was comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. My one complaint was that the fitness room was small and under-equipped for a hotel of this size and price range.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My 7 days stay at the New Otani was memorable....great food, ambiance, clean rooms and ever smiling staff....restaurants provide amazing food, fresh coffee, fruits and there are nice shops inside the hotel....I highly recommend Hotel New Otani

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If size (of room) does matter, this is the place for you. The hotel is perfect for the family with bigger than average room in Tokyo. It is very conveniently located. Very close to the underground station and is one of the Airport Limo coach stop. Nothing to complain except it will be nicer to have more places to sit down at the lobby area.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I visit Japan often for business or family trips.Tokyo is a very developed city, and there are global hotel chains like Starwood, hyatt, hilton and Inter Continental, and I also love it here.This time, however, I stayed at New Otani Tokyo, one of the most luxurious and famous local hotel brands in Japan.The hotel has a tower building and a main building, and I stayed in a renovated main building a few years ago.The staff at the hotel was kind and cheerful and they felt that they would take the next step in advance to get what I wanted.The bed in the room was similar to the Westin Heavenly Bed, and the amenities were a Shiseido product and of excellent quality.The breakfast buffet is on the lobby floor and the top floor and I used SATSUKI located on the lobby floor. If you visit Tokyo in a short time, I recommend this place without hesitation. The western and Japanese menus offered here are excellent and they were delicious throughout the stay.On the 17th floor, there is a restaurant where you can enjoy a spectacular view by turning 360 degrees and enjoyed a dinner buffet here. We had all-you-can-eat teppan-yaki, tempura, and sushi as well as buffet menu with roast beef and fresh ingredients, and it was delicious.Location of hotel is also expensive because Akasaka, Shinjuku, Shibuya, and Tokyo Station are nearby, and taxi of infamous Japan was available freely.It is not easy to explain in words ... The hotel had a wonderful Asian sensibility that was different from the global hotel chain and it was very attractive to me.I highly recommend you use this place. Then you will be surprised and satisfied with having such a comfortable and wonderful hotel in the middle of crowded Tokyo. I guarantee.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a regional meeting last week in Tokyo and booked the New Otani. This is a large hotel with two wings (preference for the Garden Wing). Rooms are well furnished and with all expected amenities in the Japanese tradition of hospitality. Hotel is close to metro lines and in a quiet environnement with a beautiful Japanese garden. Can only recommend the New Otani for your Tokyo stays!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Overall this was a very nice hotel. The reason I marked it down though was that they pulled the classic “bait and switch”. Although I had a confirmed reservation for a king room, they had us in a twin room. When I showed them the reservation the receptionist said that there is no guarantee with the type of booking. However, “for an extra JPY 4000 per night we can upgrade you to a deluxe king room”. So we did ... (suckers?).The room was very nice and the hotel was in a convenient location for us as we were catching up with friends. The garden is absolutely lovely. We didn’t eat at the hotel at all, but I snuck up to the revolving restaurant at the top, from where there is a view of Mt Fuji.In the room, the pillows were a bit hard, and the hairdryer was one of those pathetic small ones - something I pay particular attention to :-). We found Tokyo very dry so asked for a humidifier, which arrived within about 5 mins.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I travel to Japan for work quite a lot, and wanted a break from Japanese business hotels and global chains so I thought I would give the New Otani a try. It's wonderfully Japanese with great service and great staff. I stayed in the Main building in a King room, which was pretty large for Japan. Everything worked and was thoughtfully put together. The garden view breakfast area is great - if you join the New Otani hotel club the breakfast buffet is 2,000 yen which is better value than most Tokyo hotels I have stayed in. It has a reasonable selection of western and Japanese breakfast foods. The fitness room in the Main building is kind of lame - a couple of running machines and two weights machines - although they have a nice stretching area. For runners you can do a 2.5 mile loop around the Akasaka Mitsuke palace which starts right opposite the hotel which is great because there are only a few traffic lights. If you take trains it can be a bit of a trek with bags - both stations are about a 10 minute walk from the Main building, although the Akasaka Mitsuke station can be reached by walking along the shopping corridor which links the main building to the other parts of the hotel complex. Yotsuya station at the North end of the hotel is a nice walk along a riverside in front of Sophia university. And there are plenty of taxis right outside of the Main building lobby.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My wife and I kicked off our tour of Japan here. The hotel is quite big but there are plenty of very helpful and friendly staff. Good sized room with a king bed. Also very quiet. Great variety of dinning rooms with 4 for breakfasts. Lovely gardens attached to the grounds. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. After our taxi dropped us at the hotel, the check-in took almost half an hour, as the "room was not ready", even though we were only 30 minutes earlier than their normal check-in time.Our room was OK in size, for Tokyo, and did have a good view. However, we learned right away (by almost stubbing our toes) that the bathroom floor was about one and one-half inch higher than the floor in the room. We had to really remember that in the middle of the night if we got up in the dark to use the bathroom. I do not know if it is true on all floors. I think the management should put a reflective tape or something like that at the edges of the bathroom floors.The hotel is in two towers, one 17 stories and the other 40 stories. There are literally dozens of restaurants distributed throughout the facility on several floors. Dozens of expensive shops are also located on these floors. The restaurants are very expensive, even for Tokyo, We were able to find very good food just outside the facility. However, the entire complex is so huge that you need the concierge's help just to get out on the commercial street outside. Part of this property has a beautiful Japanese garden. Several of the restaurants are located in the gardens. It was worthwhile just to walk around the garden as Tokyo recovered from an unusual 8"(20 cm) of snow.We took our breakfasts at the top floor of the 40-story tower. The views from there are incredible. On our last morning, we got a beautiful clear view of Mt. Fujiyama during our breakfast, and later even better one from our room! We cannot complain too much.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Even though the room and lobby ambient seems very 80’s , still the landscape of surrounding area compensate. Beautiful view from my room towards Tokyo Shinjuku area. Breakfast tower spot, at 40th floor- breathtaking view. It can be seen also Mount Fuji on a clear day. The garden view breakfast area, a very zen atmosphere. Nice variety of food and great quality also. Over all a nice place to feel in holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is a striking piece of historic 60's retro. The service is above and beyond and the only fault I could find was that most of the restaurants closed early. From being the back drop of James Bond You only live twice to the 300 year old traditional gardens it was a truly spectacular experience. If you're looking for that something extra special and a little quirky this is your hotel. Mount Fuji is visible from the 40 th floor breakfast room along with the panoramic view of Tokyo. Or, if you prefer you can have the tranquil view of the gardens from the full wall of glass in the breakfast coffee lounge whilst you dine. As an admirer of retro the original Seiko clock of the world, which takes up a whole wall to the original glass light fittings is a feast for your eyes as you glide effortlessly through the expanse of thickly carpeted areas from the eagerly awaiting doorman through to your comfortably spacious room. All with views of some part of the city. Excellent service, excellent food and my only regret is that I only stayed 2 nights, as wandering through the gardens past the giant koi ponds and the magnificent waterfall, through rust and gold maple and cherry blossom, walking over the lacquered red bridges makes this secret place a very special destination. I never wanted to leave the grounds. Its quiet but only 2 min walk to the subway to access all of Tokyo so everything is very accessible.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for three nights, then went to Kyoto, then came back to a different room for two more nights. This is a very large hotel that can be confusing, with two large buildings connected by a central lobby and shopping hallway. The gardens are beautiful to stroll through, and I saw a bride and groom having their pictures taken on the bright red bridge that crosses a waterfall. Both of our rooms were very large and comfortable. The beds were firm. The views from the 13th floor of the garden and the city were beautiful. The restaurant with garden view in the main building and the restaurant on a high floor in the garden tower both had excellent breakfast buffets. The staff were all very helpful. The concierge was helpful. It's easy to get a taxi from the front door, and a subway stop is in walking distance, but there isn't anything welcoming in the immediate neighborhood that I could see, in terms of coffee shops or restaurants or tourist attractions. That would be my main criticism.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I chose the New Otani because of its Japanese garden, and that turned out to be a good decision. It was fantastic to just step outside the door and walk under trees blazing with peak fall color.The hotel was able to grant my request for a garden-view room, and to my surprise, on my first morning there the view also included a spectacular 10-minute glimpse of Mt. Fuji at sunrise. (Don't count on that, though.) The room was well furnished and larger than many I've had in Japan, with an immaculate, spacious bathroom that had high-quality amenities.The staff was uniformly welcoming and helpful. (I gave up trying to sort out a glitch in the awarding of loyalty-program points for my stay, but though that was frustrating, it doesn't detract from my overall appreciation of this kind and professional staff.)Some other reviewers have commented that the hotel's appearance is dated. I found the room decor fine and considered the decor of the public areas pleasantly retro. If you like to start the day with an ample buffet breakfast, I recommend looking at rates both with and without the meal included. At the time I stayed, booking breakfast along with the room was a better value than paying separately for the meal, even when separate payment was at the "staying guest" rate. If you don't want the buffet, there are numerous other choices within the hotel, across the street, or a few blocks away.The nearby subway station will get you to (or start you on your way to) anyplace in Tokyo. I used the subway to return to the airport, but if you have a lot of luggage, you can also take the airport limousine bus. Note that it leaves more often (for Haneda at least) from the Prince Hotel across the street than from the New Otani.I was surprised that the hotel seemed to have no green policies. There were no cards in the room that could be used to tell maids that it wasn't necessary to change sheets daily, and it seemed a huge waste of water and energy to replace the terrycloth bathrobe (a nice amenity) and sleep clothes each day. I hope the hotel will have green policies in place by the time I next visit Tokyo, because I would like to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani (The Main) was the fifth and final hotel on our four week holiday in Japan. It was absolutely perfect, can fault nothing. The room we received (which I believe was a free upgrade) was very large - especially by Japan standards - comfortable, super clean, a nice view on the 13th floor and had all the ameneties you could want (divan/couch to relax), desk and mirror, huge closet for our three large travel bags and an absolutely stunning bathroom. Bathrooms really make or break a hotel room I think, and this one was very spacious, had lots of spots for storage, a modern shower and bath, good toiletries and looked stunning too. The large king size bed was incredibly comfortable (softer than most we experienced in Japan). Great nights sleep here.The look of the hotel is truly stunning, you can walk from one hotel to the Garden View hotel which is connected and we did this daily. We enjoyed walking through the hotel to look at the stunning decor as well as visiting the gardens. The service staff are very helpful and attentive. There are lots of shops and restaurants inside the hotel which we didn't make too much use of, we did have dinner in The Sky the first night which is highly recommended for the 360 degree views and the delicious food. Aside from that right across the road you have The Terrace with lots of yummy food choices, Akasaka in a 10 min walk with three small streets full of options and Akasaka-Mitsuke station just around the corner (use the underground pass) which takes you pretty much everywhere in Tokyo. Aside from being in a great spot and hold a special history, New Otani was also a great experience in itself as part of time in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights and booked a superior twin room. It was a spacious room which overlooked the rose garden. The beds were quite firm which was a bit unusual.
