This was the only thing which could be improved.The hotel comprises of 3 buildings; the main (where we stayed), the Garden Tower and Garden Court. We were very happy with the main as it was closest to the main entrance and the Japanese garden. We were attracted by the garden so it was fantastic to see that the garden was beyond our expectations. It was a truly beautiful start to our trip with a walk around the garden after breakfast.One of the best things about the New Otani was that there were 3 different restaurants to choose from for breakfast. Although, we didn't go for the buffet breakfasts, we were more than happy with the a la carte choices.There was also a supermarket and a convenience store in the complex so you can get food and fresh fruit at any time.The staff were excellent and it was a nice change to be greeted by the staff at every turn. I should give a special mention to the concierge staff who were great in providing maps and tried to be as helpful as possible.It was sad to leave the hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed 3 nights at the New Otani, wonderful hotel- needs a refurb, but other then that cannot fault it. A lot of reviews are saying its not a central location, but I do have to disagree with that. There is a train station 2 minute walk from the hotel and all the areas you want to see are only 2-3 stops away. It doesnt matter were you stay in Tokyo, you will miss out on one area or the other...so staying at the new Otani was the best choice, as it was literally in the middle of it all.Breakfast is wonderful and had the most amazing view of Mt Fuji. One tip- sign up to the loyalty program- you will get a free late check out at 3 pm if available.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Here we are in Tokyo Japan. Staying at the new otani hotel Tokyo. Massive hotel three towers. Good atmosphere lots of pe ople around. Big rooms clean and staff are fantastic always on cal breakfasts is great lots of variety. Close to some shops. Beautiful Japanese garden with waterfall  in hotel . Lots of cafes and resturants in hotel good choice. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: check in went smoothly with no problem, rooms were spacious with a tradition feel which was nice. the big let down for this hotel was that the swimming pool which is on site is not available to guests to use unless they pay £30per guest per day, which is an extortionate amount to charge.the hotel was very expensive to eat in, 2x coffee and 2x cake came to just under £30, that said it is a large complexThe japanese gardens are beutiful to walk around and is a very tranquil place. There is not much to do around the hotel area, but there are 2 train stations with a 15 min walk into central Tokyo

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. Rooms are big for Japanese hotels and well appointed. The tablet in the room provides a lot of information which was handy. The Gardens are seriously amazing and worth spending some time in. The staff and service is excellent. They will do anything to help you. Bed was comfy and there were an assortment of pillows to find something comfortable. Breakfast is pretty good in both the tower and the garden. Hotel breakfast prices of course, try and get a deal which includes breakfast. It is a little walk to the nearest subway (10 mins) that is about the only small downside. Saying that, the chuo line is one of the best in Tokyo to get you anywhere. I will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is one of the bigger hotel chain in Japan and few larger hotel in Tokyo. Was here for business conference and this I choose to stay for the week. Hotel is made up of. 3 large hotel- new Otani towers, Otani Orchard and Otani courts. There are nearly 37 eateries around the compound. There is a stop by the basement of New Otani Towers that pick up passengers to the airport. Suggest you check with hotel on availability. I didn’t have the right time slot for limo bus from Haneda airport to hotel. So took a cab / taxi ) instead.Room is standard international size. Bigger than the typical Japanese hotel. Full amenities in the room. In fact, I like the one time used bath towel and the bath crystal. They provide 2 bottles of still water each day. However, suggest you walk over to the New Otani court , level 2 convenience store to grab more water if you drink a lot. Meals in hotel is expensive. Be prepared. Internet access is slow most of the time. Overall, it is still good business hotel to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Good service, friendly staff, very clean. Several good restaurants. Located in a nice area.Underground is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel and there is plenty of good shopping places in the nearby area

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A really lovely hotel with excellent facilities in a perfect location. Made to feel so welcome by the staff. Only point of note, it is so large it does take a little longer than you think to get from one part to the other, wait for lifts etc.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: When I booked this hotel I wanted it for our last night in Japan because I was taken aback by the photos and how breathtaking it looked. When we arrived, the check in staff were very helpful and assisted us with our luggage all the way to the room as we were staying in the Garden tower which was about a 10 minute walk from the main lobby (we didn't realise it was so huge!).We were offered an upgrade at our expense upon check in, however declined as we had already paid $450 for our room. Whilst the Hotel itself is stunning, the room we stayed in (which was the Standard Room with breakfast) probably wasn't worth $450 for 1 night. We stayed in Shinjuku at the beginning of our Holiday and paid half that price for a similar view. In saying that, the bed was much larger and very comfortable, the breakfast was very nice - a lot of choices - and our view at breakfast was quite breathtaking... but I didn't see anything like the pictures on their website (which is probably part and par to the Hotel being so big, we just didn't have a lot of time to go exploring).I didn't realise there was a main building and a garden tower building. I have a feeling the picture I created in my mind with the lush greenery was in the 'main' building, so this was just a communication error somewhere - so do your research first.All in all excellent location, about 10 mins from the station by foot, lots of great restaurants and cute side streets around. Much quieter than Shinjuku which was a touch refreshing. The staff were very polite, helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first few nights in Japan and Tokyo. Huge hotel but fairly easy to navigate around. The staff are very helpful and very polite. Views from both breakfast restaurants are fantastic. Do walk around the Japanese garden a lovely place. Good location for Metro and transport links. A 10 minute walk past railway entrance is a street full of eateries. Tried a few at both ends of budget. Choose the ones busy with locals is my tip. Ramen is excellent at a few of them. Room was clean and spacious with an amazing far reaching view.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a very smart hotel with great facilities. Perhaps bit out of the way to be a classic short stay tourist hotel but the staff were so helpful and the facilities very good. Good choice of restaurants but be prepared to pay for the quality you get

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel has exquisite views of downtown Tokyo. I was there with the White House Press Corps. At the time I was there it was lucky marriage day, so weddings everywhere.There is a Japanese garden that is amazing, must see!
user_name:
Michael F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here four nights for a meeting. The service could not have been better and I felt well cared for. This was my first time in Japan and I assumed the service would be the same everywhere but nothing met the level of the New Otani. I stayed in The Main but visited other parts of the complex for meetings and meals. That said, there is are a dizzying number of restaurants and I had difficulty figuring out where to go and got lost a couple times. But it was good exercise for sure! The room was really comfortable and cozy and I liked coming back to it after my long days. Somehow in my reading for this trip, I missed that hotels provide night clothes. I stayed in four hotels in Japan and this was always the case. The New Otani has comfortable kimonos in addition to bathrobes. One of the conference dinners was in The Sky and seriously, you need to experience it. Only the outer seating area revolves, different than other revolving restaurants I've been in. Lots of shops (high end and convenience stores) on premises. I didn't find the metro too far to walk at all, and nearby that is a vibrant area full of more restaurants than you could count. I liked the area, loved the hotel and REALLY enjoyed the Japanese Garden. I went one day just as it opened and had it nearly to myself. Definitely an oasis in the midst of city life!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was at Hotel New Otani on 20th September to deliver a speech at Law Asia Conference held there I needed business center facilities The ladies on duty from 4 to 8 pm were amazing They helped me I must also add in this my first visit to Japan I loved everything following the law to the letter cleanliness and highly advanced service in everything Above all the kindness and care by people were amazing. This was very much seen in the new Otani hotel I recommend for anyone all the best

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: After having stayed at the Osaka New Otani, the Tokyo, Akasaka location felt more high end and upscale. From the moment you walk in, you can tell that this hotel is a near 5 star with its service, amenities and rooms. There are staff members everywhere awaiting to help you with any questions or concerns you may have. The rooms themselves are more modern-contemporary compared to the Osaka location, and felt really luxurious, spacious too depending on which one you book. We had a garden view room with an amazing view of the re-known garden and koi pond. Plus views of the park next door. The hotel takes care of everything you need for a Tokyo stay and adventure, including bus service to Narita right at the front, which was very convenient. Really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Like the great old hotels of NYC, the New Otani has stood the test of time a classic, spacious hotel with impeccable service. The numerous restaurants are all very good, and there is plenty of fashion shopping within the hotel. For me the highlight is the beautiful gardens covering interesting terrain and a large waterfall.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Our three night stay at the New Otani was all part of a cruise package. This hotel is very large....with the original main building and two other towers. We stayed in a double room in the main building with great views of the exquisite gardens. Many of the staff are in traditional dress and were very happy to help. The restaurants were good but very expensive however the Garden Lounge was great for a super buffet breakfast and it was made reasonable by getting a discount. The discount voucher was given at check in. The Garden Lounge was very popular so you needed to get to breakfast or an afternoon tea etc in good time although the queues went down quickly. Many of the tables have a fabulous view of the gardens....in particular the Koi pond and the Japanese Garden Bridge. Lovely to stroll the gardens when you have over indulged in the food etc lol. The rooms were not a bad size for Japan and the bed very comfortable. The toilet in the bathroom took a while to get used to with water spraying in all sorts of ways etc and heat for the seat so much so I had to take a photo of it, at least the seat did not revolve and play music as one did in Belgium! There is an in-house food mart on one of the floors which was very useful and reasonable if you did not want a large meal. Also a good coffee shop next door to the Food Mart. Overall a really pleasant start to our trip and I would stay again in a heartbeat. PS I must add that this hotel is in a very convenient location.....not far from the Imperial Palace.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed on a high floor in the Garden Tower (one of the hotel's 3 main buildings) which had a view of Tokyo that was nothing short of spectacular - easily equal to Tokyo Tower. The rooms were clean, with a comfortable bed and beautiful spacious bathroom.The location of the hotel is not great - being a good 15 minute walk from the closest metro station, JR station and a similar distance from convenience stores and restaurants. The hotel takes advantage of this by charging obscene prices at its restaurants and bars. Any of Tokyo's attractions require public transport to reach.The service was generally good, and they were happy to help when a neighbouring room was blaring their TV late at night.If you prefer to be close to transport and attractions, you might consider another place. But if you want a view, a high floor at Hotel New Otani is the right choice.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We visited Tokyo in October 2017 and were invited to dinner in the revolving restaurant. It had the most stunning views of the city. The food variety and quality was excellent! The service was great! I would highly recommend this restaurant. Afterwards, we walked through the beautiful Japanese gardens. It was a special highlight of our trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: During a recent holiday in Japan we stayed in five hotels; this was my favourite. The room was spacious and well-appointed (my only gripes were that the air conditioning was faulty and the room therefore over-warm, and that the only version of BBC World Service available had the news dubbed into Japanese). The room wasn't the best or most memorable feature though: that was the garden. The garden is extraordinary, and should be experienced in daylight and at night. The breakfast was probably the best we had during our holiday: there was plenty of choice, and the views were very good (when the fog allowed). The numerous restaurants in this huge hotel are mostly very pricey, though there are ample alternatives in nearby Akasaka (we enjoyed great ramen and sushi).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Expensive and opulent, but worth staying just for the exquisite garden. Full of restaurants and pricey shops and characterised by excellent service. We had a room on the 28th floor with a great view for our 5 night stay. Dined at the Bella Vista restaurant on the top floor and greatly enjoyed the meal and service. Location was close to an underground station for sightseeing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Really enjoyed the 4 nights spent in this hotel. Having breakfast in the garden lounge which overlook the fantastic Japanese garden was a real treat. Rooms very comfortable and quiet. This is a huge hotel and can be difficult to navigate around. There are plenty of restaurants close by, if you do not want to eat in the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in the Main building (the others are the Garden Tower and Garden Court). The complex was huge and confusing at first, but there were many helpful staff present, even stationed at the downstairs elevators to call and hold cars for guests. The restaurants were very expensive and many guests either went out into the Akasaka neighborhood or even stopped at the in-house Family Mart convenience store. We had one dinner at the delicious teppan restaurant. We enjoyed the breakfast buffets with Western and Japanese offerings in the Garden Lounge, which had wonderful views of the outside garden. The garden is a must-see place with pretty water and landscaped areas. Our room had a comfy king-sized bed and lots of open floor space. It had some thoughtful extra features such as a nightlight under one bedstand, a flashlight under the other, and two daily complimentary bottles of water. We had to get used to stepping up into the bathroom, like being on a cruise ship.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the Hotel New Otani in a split stay with two nights in Hakone. We had two different rooms. The first room was very nice, but will not stand out over time. The second was more special in that the bathroom and bar/dressing area were around the corner as a second set of rooms. We had the buffet breakfast every day. They have a very extensive assortment of Western and Japanese foods. Because of the size of the hotel, they have several restaurants to select from. Get a seat at the window if you want to view the garden; or go to the Tower buffet for a view of the city.We walked in the garden - wonderful design and very relaxing. Worth a complete walk thru.The entire hotel complex has many shops, restaurants and hidden surprises. The entire hotel staff was willing to please. Two bottles of complimentary water were provided each day.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a huge hotel with two wings, New Otani hotel & Otani Garden. Rooms are good with adequate facilities, free wifi, having options of many restaurants. Meals are excellent, hotel offers some free coupon for one starters for the Trader Vic's Bar, that was amezing. Shuttle airport transfers area available to the hotel. Location is also great, many shopping areas & happening places are on walk-able distance to venture out in the evening. Shinjuku / Akihabara etc are accessible by metro. Few Internationals players were staying with us in the hotel. Overall it ws enjoyable !! Recommended..

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had an enjoyable 4 night stay. The place is huge but this does not stop staff being both friendly and helpful. Rooms were a good size and well serviced. There was plenty of choice for breakfast ( both in restaurants and food offerings) though busy at 7pm and the hotel is convenient for the metro and plenty of local restaurants. We had one disappointing evening meal in the garden restaurant which was an exception to what was an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Male receptionist at check out counter is sexist. Only wants to serve males. *vomits* Other than that, the remaining staff is generally nice and the room amenities are spacious. Hotel is located on a hill so if you’re in japan during a rainy season like I was, good luck going up to second floor with luggage.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for one night on a short trip to Tokyo. The hotel is huge, and has two receptions, which can cause confusion when you arrange to meet colleagues there.Rooms are well appointed, restuarant areas are large and the outdoor areas, particularly the waterfall and garden area are outstanding.It is a very formal hotel and lacks a little cosiness, however for a business trip it ticks many of the required boxes.Services is typically deferential and very Japanese.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just spent 9 days at new otani hotel in Tokyo, probably one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in.. our room was on the 29 floor with fantastic views of the streets of Tokyo. The hotel has plenty of bars and restaurants but our favourite was the tower bar on the 40 floor, with its magnificent views of Tokyo tower..the hotel is huge, the staff from the moment we arrived were fantastic, polite and very friendly if we return to Tokyo this is hotel we would choose, in a great location for walking into the city and for the trains if you need to go further..

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Booked by my better half as part of our honeymoon trip. We only stayed one night, but it was absolutely fabulous. Stayed in the Junior Suite and it was without a doubt the best hotel room I have ever stayed in my life. Amazingly comfortable, unbelievable views across Tokyo, and just the best service from all the hotel staff. Nice little extras like Bvlgari toiletries and a TV in the bathroom were also great. Breakfast in the Garden Tower went above and beyond in catering to Western visitors, but also had plenty of traditional Japanese fare if you were feeling adventurous. Overall a fabulous stay, wished we could have stayed longer, but other adventures awaited.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here with my wife. I’m really impressed by the attitude and behavior of staffs. It’s the one of the most courteous ever before. And taste of breakfast is awesome. Actually I’m very eager to have breakfast here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great Hotel in an excellent position. Breakfast is very good. The best part of the hotel is it's stunning garden which you can visit throughout the day. Rooms are much bigger than in other hotels in Tokyo and Shiseido products are an added bonus!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I’ve stayed in the New Otani three times before, this being the fourth. I always get sad doing the check out. Is a great hotel, really historic and with great staff. Amazing gardens, is a must see, love to stay here every time

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Conveniently situated with good taxi service on hand. Hotel consists of 3 towers and we were in The Main. A vast hotel which was difficult to find your way around. Towers linked to each other and ,given time, getting from A to B might have been easier. We breakfasted in the Tower Garden restaurant and was a good walk from our bedroom in the Main. There was a reasonable selection of food available perhaps less weighted towards Western tastes. The cooked dishes could have been hotter but generally was of a quite good standard. We did have to wait for a table. Restaurant opened at 6am but this was quite a popular time as many trips left by 7 am.Our room was good, nice bathroom and very high standard of linen.We ate in Tom Cat pizza cafe which was fine and reasonably priced. Food was well cooked. A range of eating places was available in the hotel , some quite pricey.Hotel has many high quality shops etc.within the complex.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in this very large hotel for four nights. Room was fairly large with all the modern amenities. There is loads of options for breakfast . You can have from Japanese to American breakfast. Hotel has got the most beautiful gardens. There are loads of eating choices in the hotel but we thought they were more fine dining, very expensive. But if you go outside the hotel there are plenty eating places to suit all kind of pockets. Staff of this hotel is exceptionally very helpful and friendly. Great start to our holiday.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A hotel a bit past it's days of glory but perfectly fine. The rooms are spacious and air conditioned and breakfast choice is very good. It's very close to lots of restaurants and bars and close to a metro station which gives you easy access to all the other tokyo sites.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: On my first visit to Japan back in 1985, this was one of THE hotels in Tokyo. I stayed here with my family and had fond memories of the revolving restaurant (still going), lovely service and the Japanese Garden. Coming back here for a business conference, the hotel still has a certain charm but she is showing her true age.The hotel is massive. I think there were about 3 different conferences all happening at the same time. It takes a few trips to get your bearings as the hotel buildings and shopping mall is interlinked. The rooms are fine; nothing special but we had a comfortable sleep with all the mod cons. The bathrooms are starting to show their age but they have modern Japanese toilet and wide selection of toiletries. Nice shower with plenty of hot water and nice towels.We didn't get breakfast included in the rate which I think was good as there are a few cafes nearby including a gourmet food store, Tully's coffee and Dean and Deluca across the road. We did go and have coffee downstairs in the cafe - it was $10 which is outrageous!For a conference hotel, it is perfectly fine. Well located with nearby eating areas and within close walking distance to the metro and JR Lines. Would I stay here again? For a personal holiday - no. There is a lot more choice of better hotels in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights on business. Very large, nice hotel with excellent friendly, helpful and efficient staff.The hotel is convenient to many places and is walking distance from many restaurants and bars.My room was nice but had a dated feel about it and the bathroom was very small and cramped. I'll definitely stay again when in town.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Beautiful old hotel with landscaped garden and waterfall. Next to Akasaka Subway station. Walking distance to numerous eateries across the river. Near the Imperial Palace. Nice scenic jogging area. Free wifi. Small gym (only 1 treadmill available).40 mins drive from Haneda airport.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I first stayed at the New Otani Hotel Tokyo in July 2004 and have been returning ever since! - Little has changed in the last 13 years - and I guess this is appropriate as the New Otani mainly caters to the older generation of Japanese business people and Tokyo resident.But when old style is done well enough it becomes classic and the New Otani is a truly classic Japanese hotel.The location is ideal, one hour from the airport by regular shuttle bus, 15-30 minutes taxi drive from Shibuya main train station or Tokyo stations which can bring you anywhere, and within easy walking distance to the Akasaka area for a more relaxed environment to have dinner with your business partner. The rooms are also classic Japanese, catering to their understanding of western requirements which is comprehensive! The electric black out drapes are very helpful for the jet lagged traveller otherwise the rooms do speak to the classic 5 star standards but with nothing new to write home about.The staff are extremely polite, bowing and reciting the well rote learned "Thank you for waiting!" -for the super fast elevator! But as is so often the case - professional politeness is only skin deep and whatever happens don't be late for the departing airport bus.... I was once and they told me it had left when it hadn't.The garden restaurant serving wonderful cakes connects the main building to the tower is where you can honestly see Japanese non working spouses society on display! The hotel hosts a Traders Vic restaurant but the main dining hall is classic is nothing special. The gardens are fantastic in Japanese style- mainly used for wedding photographs but the swimming pool (outdoor and closed during the winter) and gym are are dated!Stay here if it's your first time to Japan - or if classic is your taste - but not if you're looking for something special.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: You can stay there like a king! Everything went so smooth from checking in, dining, to checking out. There are many restaurants and shops inside the hotel, but also adjacent to it, which are more reasonably priced. Need to take a cab to go anywhere.
user_name:
Hakubear
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Coming to the New Otani was a 2 day splurge after staying in a business hotel in Akabane (Daiwa Roynet Hotel) for 7 days. I can't believe I was happier at the Daiwa Roynet. No, it wasn't luxurious, but the rooms were cooled properly and didn't smell like cigarettes. Even in a non-smoking room, I smell cigarettes here at the New Otani. My sense is that the air conditioning system is outdated. The hallways are not air conditioned which is quite surprising. It is very unpleasant to step out of the elevator into a muggy hall when you're coping with the hottest days of the year. Furthermore, I was frustrated to learn that the indoor pool has a $30-$50 a day fee. This was not obvious from the website that shows many beautiful photos of the indoor pool.On the plus side, the lobby is quite upscale and the views of the garden are very beautiful. Also the majority of the staff speak excellent English which makes interactions easier.
user_name:
Heather P
Richmond, Virginia, United States

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and was impressed by the size of the room, especially for a city like Tokyo. The rooms are clean and amenities are well thought through, the hotel provided everything that made my stay as comfortable and as expected for a 5-star hotel. The rooms are clean despite being old. Hotel is well located and easy to walk to metro to get around Tokyo. Customer service was as expected and no complaints. Breakfast could be better in terms of selected and I felt myself having the same selection over 5 days was a little too boring.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Customer service and cleanliness in the hotel are out of this world. The attention to detail is amazing in everything. However, the gym was a letdown. No weights and benches, which is a little strange, just 5-6 cardio machines that could do with an upgrade.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Travelling to Japan for the first time and on my own, I wanted a hotel that had a lot of facilities and this certainly does - it's huge. The room was fine - comfy bed, silent and effective air con and a great shower. It's not as modern as some rooms but this is a hotel with history. The gardens were very pretty. I did find the food and drink prices very high but you can always eat out and there is a convenience shop The locations is good - 5 mins walk from a metro station. The service levels are very high and staff are always there to help and are very friendly and English is widely spoken.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is well located, lobby and others are ok but rooms are really small and poor. Specially the toilet needs an update.In general terms and with the prices in Tokyo these days, is ok but with a little improvement in the rooms is a really very good option.Also to keep in mind the direct shuttle from Narita airport to the hotel and from hotel to Narita!.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: What a hotel. It is one of the best I have ever stayed in. O my god. Just the bathroom amazing. Very clean, had everything you would need in a bathroom. Combs, brush, shavers, the most top quality shampoo's and con, make up remover, toner. body lotion, endless free water bottles, the bed big, the room a very good size, Views from window's, the staff friendly. Two floors of shopping,, central. Trains close, plenty of taxis. Very fast to check in and out, most helpful. Shuttle from hotel. What a wonderful hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent a considerable amount of time reading reviews before selecting the New Otani (Main Tower) and chose it based on other traveler reviews with an emphasis on the room size and amenities. While the bathroom was very nice and the room size overall was indeed large, the layout was awkward. The bathroom had a step-up which was a bit dangerous at night with the lights out. The closet for luggage storage was difficult to access due to its location right outside the bathroom, and there were not any drawers in the room for clothing storage - necessitating living out of a suitcase. These negatives could have been dealt with for a 3-night stay, but the air conditioning not cooling adequately left me with a bad experience. While management was notified and possibly looked into the matter (they left a typed response), the air conditioning never cooled and each of the 3 nights in the room was unpleasant. As for the restaurants and other features, it was quite disappointing that the pool opening date was July 15th -- very late in the summer, and with the daily temperature at 90 degrees farenheit or hotter, it would have been nice to have used it. The gardens on the property were lovely, but would not be a factor in choosing this hotel over another. The breakfast buffet on the 40th floor was very good, along with the views. Finally, I thought because of the size of the hotel (huge) and extensive number of restaurants (over 30 I think), it would be hard to go wrong, but the hotel size was overwhelming to an exhausted traveler. Also, we joined the New Otani Club thinking we would receive free complimentary newspaper and coffee/tea in the dedicated lounge for members, but were disappointed that it didn't open in the mornings until 10am, a time far too late for travelers or business people. Overall, I rated both the hotel and my experience as "average" at best.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Booked a stay over the holiday weekend while on business... one of the few hotels in Tokyo with outside pool. Rooms great, staff very attentive and service good... but this all comes with a hefty price.. pool is 2000 yen for hotel guest for the day, poolside bar drinks start at 800 yen for cup of coke, 1500-2000 yen for alcohol drinks and breakfast absurd at over 3000 yen...Pool rules include no tattoos and modest swimwear..easy to get a sun bed though. Pool ok but more family biased vs true swimming environment Good overall experience vs great

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights. A luxury hotel in a very central location. Near the rail, underground and bus network, so very convenient to get around. Near a JR line, so good if you have a Japan Rail Pass. Just a few stops from Tokyo Station. The neighbouring area of Akasuka has plenty of places to eat in the evenings, so it's definitely worth going out for dinner in the evenings. The in-house restaurants (there is a great variety of them) are a little on the pricey side, so it's worth going out for meals.The room was spacious by Japan standards, but not as much as I was expecting for that price per night. The hotels in Kyoto were better value in that regard.The outdoor pool is only open for a month or two per year, which was a pity. It was the height of summer when we went (early July), but the pool was only opening mid-July, which seemed a bit mad considering the frantically hot weather while we were there. They also charge to use the pool, even for in-house guests, which I thought was a bit mean.As in the other reviews, the hotel staff were always very polite and happy to help - excellent service.If you are going for a relax and let-your-hair-down holiday, you may find the hotel a little stiff. There were times when we felt a bit under-dressed just walking around the corridors of the hotel. It's pretty posh.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Known as one of the top-three prestigious hotels in Japan, the service at Hotel New Otani is at a different level. The staff are always looking out for ways to help the guests stay as perfect as possible. The hotel complex has everything from bakeries to barbers to convenience stores and the shopping quarter is filled with options. The rooms are quite spacious in Tokyo standards and very well-kept despite the hotel being quite old. The garden is perfect for taking an afternoon stroll (or taking wedding photos - I saw lots during my week long stay!). The breakfast is delicious but could get crazy during peak time - I waited for 30 minutes on a Saturday morning when arrived around 9am. I thought it was a nice touch they had fresh green juice to start off the morning healthily.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spacious room, great service & good choice of restaurants. The outdoor garden is simply awesome. And best of all, airport limousine bus is right at the doorstep. Subway is just 100 metres away, convenience stores and shops are walking distance from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The restaurant was very sassy. It rotates, giving you the whole view of Tokyo. I went there for my girl friends 21st birthday. The only reason I went there was because she told me that she did not want to go anywhere except this place. I understood why. It was sassy and expensive. My girl friend likes expensive places. She is very spoiled. But anyways, this place is really nice. the food was delicious and the view was nice. It cost me 2,6730 Yen.Try it out. Hope all your girl friends will like this place.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Every aspect of this large hotel was 6*. There were always attendants everything ready to assist and they were always helpful and so polite.We had been warned that Japanese bedrooms are not so large as western rooms but this certainly was not the case. In fact were resided in the hight of luxury.The range of options for breakfast was exceptional and certain would suite all tastes.Although we did not have either afternoon tea or dinner they all looked very appetising.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We only stayed one night, high up on the 22nd floor, with great views. A busy hotel, had to queue a short while for breakfast, but very well appointed rooms. Eating in house is expensive - nearby outside options are easier on the wallet.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: So, I'll be honest...the only reason I stayed here was because the hotel was used as Osato Chemicals in the 1967 movie "You Only Live Twice". Unlike the Hong Kong Peninsula Hotel, they make no reference to the James Bond movie at all. Perhaps not surprising as it wasn't a hotel in the movie, but a front for SPECTRE. Anyway, all that aside, the hotel is HUGE!! The lobby boasts countless shops and there are lots of big areas to walk, but very little in the way of seating.The room was a decent size, and clean and comfy, but could do with a facelift. The bathroom, while still boasting the ever-present hi-tech Japanese toilet, was a bit dingy and had only a shower over the bath (the shower head being at my shoulder level (I'm 6'1"The staff were very friendly and helpful. And it's certainly a recommended place to stay. Easy walk to the metro and to local shops and bars.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We booked the hotel mainly because of the pool facilities, so we were very disappointed when we heard that the outside pool was closed, and the inside pool was to expensive..5000 yen. Other than that the hotel was okay. Nice garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Excellent location. Close to the entertainment and dining center of the Akasaka district. Close to a subway station. The room is comfortable and luxurious. The service is excellent. Clean and quiet. The hotel has restaurants, shops and a supermarket. There is a beautiful garden and waterfall in the hotel courtyard. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: What a wonderful find! This hotel has its own beautiful Japanese garden. And the biggest surprise was to find a Christian chapel instead of a temple in the garden. I felt truly blessed! Enjoyed the view immensely from the cafe. You can wander around the hotel and find so many surprises - gift shops, so many great restaurants you can try with cuisines catering from Japanese to western. Really nice! A truly memorable time spent with my two daughters. Cudos to the staff - friendly, helpful and speaking English. After exploring Tokyo, it was so goood to go back and rest in this beautiful hotel. (oh the only negative is that their in room service had little choice - esp desserts).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was a great hotel for our 3 night stay, it is true as some of the reviews point out that the decoration is a little bit old but perfectly fine. The staff is beyond nice and helpful, the room was bigger than we expected and very comfortable. The only downside is that check in is at 14:00 hrs.The buffet breakfast is very good but expensive 3100¥ and the gardens are definitely worth visiting.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We selected New Otani because we wanted a hotel in Tokyo that was NOT on high floors, and also something that wasn't too "Western".We requested and received a "Garden View", but it was not a particularly good view. Further down the hall would have been spectacular. We were totally jet lagged/exhausted, or we would have tried to change rooms.But the wonderful breakfast buffet in the "arcade" between the Main and the Tower... that directly overlooks the Garden, with a perfect view of the waterfall.Exquisite!The hotel was clean and the room was extremely quiet.This was our first visit to Japan, and we had been told to expect tiny rooms.For us, the rooms here and elsewhere were very comfortable and not unusually small. After all, we didn't request a junior suite or something like that for this trip.(Perhaps the lower-priced hotels have tiny rooms?)We are planning to return to Tokyo in a few months, and although we'd prefer a hotel this time that is near more "activity" (just for wandering around), we may stay here again because it worked so well.But we'll try hard to get a better view!We had read concerns that the hotel was "too big", and there were long walks. That may be the case for the Tower rooms, but the elevators for The Main were right there in the entrance lobby.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is outstanding - it is like a small village, but run with the precision and care of a well-oiled machine. As a genuinely Japanese hotel, not being part of one the big internationals, allows them to have such distinguishing features as their Japanese Garden and a separate roses garden for weddings. The Garden is a marvel; quite reasonably sized, dotted with meandering paths, restaurants and even a water-fall. One of the restaurant is a multi-denominational chapel during the day with daily morning services to which everyone's welcome (it boasts a full-time pastor to look after the chapel and its visitors). The hotel is so big and so full of amenities, shops and restaurants that it can take approx. 10 minutes to walk from one end of it to the other... The subway station, Akasaka-Mitsuke is only few minutes more, just where the Akasaka entertainment streets starting. The room itself was very comfortable; pillow menu was also available; a separate work-desk, copious wardrobe spaces, drawers, etc. Large and luxurious bathroom too - there's was nothing lacking and service - as it is excellent everywhere in Japan - was even better than the usual if it's possible. We signed up to become Club members, and that immediately provided us with extras + discounts in the bars, restaurant and for the gym. We definitely will stay at the New Otani when next in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a wonderful week. The hotel was nice with wonderful gardens. We even saw a wedding in one of them from our room. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The concierges were great. They all spoke very good English. There knowledge of the subways and trains was remarkable. They were a great help every time we asked a question. We had a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was interested in staying here because it was used as a shooting location for the James Bond film You Only Live Twice.After seeing pictures, I figured it would be far out of our price range, but we were pleasantly surprised that it was quite reasonable valued.Pro'sThe Room- The standard rooms for the main are quite a bit larger than the average in Tokyo. Our standard king room came in at 388 sq. ft. As we were staying for 8 nights, this was a huge plus as we had room to stretch out and put our belongings.- Incredibly clean, comfortable, and plenty of amenities (mini bar, many bath products, robes, yukata, etc.)The Hotel- The Gardens are absolutely breathtakingly beautiful. Take a book with you and stroll the gardens and stop at a bench to sit, read, and appreciate the beauty surrounding you. How often are a hotel grounds one of the highlights of your trip?- Go to the Sky Bar. Immediately! Great views of Tokyo, cocktails are a little pricey, but expertly made and worth it. I asked the staff if I could walk around to see all the different views and they encouraged it! - Endless food options and many nice shops inside this massive hotel. We bought a small painting for our house to always remember our wonderful stay.The Staff- Everyone is so incredibly professional, nice, and helpful. They treat you so well and I miss the service already.- Room Service is quick and wonderful if you desire it- Housekeeping does a great job at making it seem like they are not even there, working quickly and efficiently, making your room as tidy as if you just checked in.Convenience- Less than a 3 minute walk to the Ginza, Hanzoman, and Marunouchi subway lines with other lines in reasonable distances as well.- Under a 10 minute walk to the Yotsuya JR station for any JR lines you need.- Airport Limousine stops at this hotel, which is an incredibly cheap and efficient way to get to and from Haneda or Narita.Con'sI really can't say anything negative about the Hotel New Otani. A few of the restaurants are pricier than what they are, but then again, they have quick and reasonably priced restaurants as well.Overall: Usually when my wife and I travel, the hotel is an after-thought as we are usually out and about and don't spend much time in the hotel. But this hotel blew us away. It was one of the best experiences we've ever had and really added a tremendous amount to the overall enjoyment of our vacation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is an excellent Hotel in an excellent location.I stay there on a regular basis, The rooms at the Main are very nice , mostly renovated , very clean and comfortable.WHILE I AM A PERMANENT GUEST, STAFF IS CHANGING!, YOU NEVER GET A FAMILIAR INTIMATE GESTURE,ONE IS ALWAYS TREATED ,AS IF HE IS A NEW COMER TO THE HOTEL- STRANGE AND ANNOYING!Never amenities in the room , never some special attention from management!
user_name:
Elchanan H
Hod HaSharon, HaMerkaz, Israel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have been staying at this hotel for the past 30 years. The changes that have taken place are incredible. it has gone from a 3 star to definite 5 star. Rooms are very well appointed, comfortable and large. No need to worry about the tiny rooms in a lot of Japanese hotels. Great variety of restaurants and great locations to get around Tokyo

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: April business trip, and great for short visit. You can get lost in this massive maze of a hotel which is located in a business district. Numerous restaurants and bars, great breakfast selection and always very courteous staff. Rooms very dated which was a surprise having stayed in a Japanese hotel The Okura Prestige Bangkok. Was given a smoking room which was awful, was eventually moved after about 90 mins, which after travelling many hours was not a great experience. The gardens are lovely and very peaceful. Subway 5 minute walk away and only 4 stops to Ginza's lux shopping area.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A great hotel for business stay. Always stayed here whenever on business, stay is responsive and helpful. Will come back again the next time. As Otani club member, there is a special priviledge for the club member for Otani floor. Always feel like coming home.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Probably biggest hotel I have ever stayed into Lost the count of the number of restaurants It is very well located... You can access a lot of nice areas just walking Rooms are small but clean and well thought. Bathroom OK with good water pressure Not romantic (though the Japanese garden is very nice) nothing special, but makes for very decent stay at the reasonable price

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A 3 days stay in this lovely hotel is definitely worth it. The staffs were remarkable. The whole hotel was amazing. Plus the fact that I love travelling to Japan so much. The breakfast was always amazing. The food so delish. Actually the whole amenities in the hotel were great. What can I say, I would definitely come back. Otani, wait for me!!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent Hotel with very good rooms and garden cafe.The Revolving Restaurent is excellent.Best time to visit is 15th April to 15th May as the Garden is full of cherry blossom.True Japanese experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Arriving by Taxi from Tokyo Station, we thought we might have made a mistake in selecting the New Otani Hotel, The Main. It seemed isolated from the type of busy area that we like with lots of small restaurants and shops. But once we had figured out the orientation of the two parts of this huge hotel, we discovered that by walking through the connecting lobby, taking another elevator and then a short walk on the main road, we were actually close by subway lines and a street full of restaurants, bars and shops. In the end it turned out to be a quite convenient location.The hotel itself is almost intimidating in its size but has plenty of restaurants and shops on various levels. Our room, a standard twin in The Main, seemed rather dated and old-fashioned and left us thinking it was high time for a makeover. The bathroom was the most dated part of the room, an over-bath shower with a curtain and very cramped space is not really up to date although water pressure was good and the amenities package excellent. The beds were comfortable and extra pillows were provided on request. Sleep quality was good and the room quiet. Complimentary bottled water is limited to two bottles per day although a pitcher of iced water can be provided on request.We didn’t use any of the hotel restaurants as we prefer to search out local cafés and restaurants but the main Garden Lounge seemed popular and busy at all times of the day. Staff throughout the hotel were really good, courteous and helpful at all times. Security in the hotel is high with unobtrusive security personnel at every turn. Free wi-fi everywhere in the hotel and with good speed.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We loved the New Otani, after nearly 20 hours of travelling to get there we got a very warm welcome and everything we asked for was taken care of without any hassle whatsoever. Top tip if staying here from Narita Airport the Limousine Bus service isn't the cheapest or fastest way from the airport but its easily the most convenient as one f the routes they offer brings you right to the front door of the hotel!The hotel was in a quiet suburb but its only 10 minutes walk to two different stations that link you to Tokyo's excellent transport network - be sure to get yourself a Suica or Pasmo card if you haven't bought a rail pass as it saves you a fortune and a lot of hassle too.We didn't have breakfast included but we couldn't fault anything at all - excellent and prompt service, great free wifi, beautiful japanese garden in the grounds to explore and our room was massive and impeccably presented.We would go back in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have just spent 4 days in this hotel and enjoyed. Everything was so clean though out the hotel , the staff so polite nothing was to much what ever I asked on them and the breakfast was really good including western style food. Within 10 mins walking I found a very large selection of eating places for all nationalities

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at The New Otani Hotel during a Business/leisure trip. The hotel was very well located with the metro just 5 minutes walk away. the staff were extremely knowledgeable and always willing to help. There were three restaurants to have breakfast at.Roms were a good size and very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel is Massive! Its a multi-tower hotel with a variety of restaurants to eat at and a beautiful garden. The main restaurants / lounge at Level 40 and the Garden lounge are must visit. (its not so expensive). The rooms are sizable and very clean. Toilets are small (its Tokyo). The main downside has to be the Gym or Workout Room; its seriously just a few rooms. Location is great and very easy to get around. Wifi is free and fast. For business travellers, aside to the trains, Taxis are also always lined up

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Big cities are difficult. Where to stay that is central and maximises accessibility. For mine the west side of the Imperial Gardens is the preferred location. The New Otani is an old established Tokyo hotel in Akasaka. Tokyo does not have the boutique hotels of Europe. They are generally big and bland. But always clean efficient and well staffed. The New Otani is big. But its not bland. It is very good. We had a split stay in April staying for 4 nights at the Main Hotel and on returning to Tokyo another three nights at the Garden Tower. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are small (they all are) but the water pressure and temperature was fantastic. Breakfast overlooking the gardens and waterfall was very good with a wide range of Japanese and western style breakfast food. The staff were all very helpful, professional, friendly and efficient. The location is also wonderful. The hotel is in a very smart commercial area with retails and 5 minutes away a restaurant precinct that offers an incredible array of food. The Metro is only 5 minutes away so that access to different parts of the city is easy. In summary a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The room quite different one from another, amenities 100% suitable and available all the time when required, food at its restaurants completely fine in different plates and drinks, I can't complain at all.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a Hotel I will come back to stay. Spacious room and facing the garden. Staffs speak excellent English and all are very polite. Rooms are clean and tidy. Wifi speed is excellent! The king size bed is very comfy. The garden behind is a must to visit. It give you a zen kind of peace especially early in the morning.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: the new otani has a fantastic garden and rose garden, it has a few restaurants in the garden. make sure u book the teppanyaki place to hv lunch. a very place. the rooms in the hotel is nicely spaced. main building rooms had been upgraded. easy access to the metro subways, less than 10mins walk away. it is also has a stop for airport limousine.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Vážení přátele, tak není to úplně levné, ale je to moc pěkný místo, kousek do centra a mnoho restaurací, včetně Sky Baru a baru v 40 patře. Pokud mate rádi ticho, velké pokoje a velké postele a chcete-li si dat kolem půlnoci cigeratku na baru, poslouchat živě piano :). Dear friends, it is not very cheap, but it is a very nice place,including the Sky Bar and the 40th floor bar. If you like the silence, the large rooms and the big beds, and if you want to have a date around midnight at the bar, listen to the live piano :).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first time to Tokyo and we stayed here for 2 nights. Chose this hotel because of the garden and it's location. It is a short walking distance to the subway. It doesn't seem to be a very busy area, but within walking distance to some restaurants. Dean and Deluca are just across the road, serving beautiful breads and decent coffee. The garden is huge and amazing with the cherry blossom in full bloom. The service is wonderful and concierge is always helpful. They provide you with generous amount of shiseido products, for men and women. We were also given Sakura bath salts, which fits in nicely with the season. We will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Extraordinary Hotel, magnificent garden, and generally quite expensive but my wife called the Hotel directly and got a very large room for only $275/night for 7 days. Joint the Club and get an upgraded room, as we did. Friends tried the hotel for one night several years ago and got a small room for $400/night. So call well in advance and try for a reasonable deal. This was one of the finest hotels we ever had the pleasure of staying at.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed in this Hotel on my businees trips to Japan for the last 15 years.The attentuon to detail even for Japanese standards is just amazing.Quite, classic never ages.Best garden coffe lounge for breakfast.My home in Tokyo!
user_name:
T603YSantonioc
Sant Pere de Ribes, Spain

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here as part of a group for 4 nights in April 2017. Lovely room, very friendly, welcoming and helpful staff, wonderful views, great food and beautiful, tranquil garden. A large hotel yes but it never felt overwhelming, in fact it was a relaxing, comfortable stay. Thank you everyone at the HNO; if I am lucky enough to visit Japan again I will certainly return there.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a big hotel, but once you find your bearings it is a top place to stay.Staff very helpful, room was tops as we looked out over the garden .. Cherry blossoms, waterfalls, bridges, and sunny days !Need to treat yourself ? Spend sometime here ..

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I paid a little more than other choices I had, but it was well worth it for me and my family. The hotel has everything I could have asked for. There were convenience stores, an impressive variety of shops and restaurants, a large wonderfully landscaped Japanese garden to take walks in, a medical clinic, a massage therapy clinic among all other things I would expect in one of the best hotels in Tokyo or perhaps all of Japan. Best of all, the hotel staff demonstrated to me what I consider to be one of the best spirit of customer service I could have expected. This was the second time I used this hotel and compared to other places I have used in Tokyo, I am happy to say that this place is absolutely my and my family's favorite place to stay in Tokyo. I imagine for some other types of travelors, the location may be not as convenient as Shinjuku area for example, but Akasaka night life area is within walking distance (5 minutes from the back side of Hotel) and so is the Chuo Line's Kanda train station (10 minute walk or 2-4 minute ride on a taxi) so for us it was not a inconvenience at all. Highly recommended for those who want the best service and amenities in a hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great Hotel. Returned to this hotel after 47 years and wow, better than ever. The service is great and no wonder it ranks as one of the finest hotels in the world. Wonderful grounds and gardens. Only negative is that it is located in a primarily business district. However the subway is only two blocks from the hotel and you can get to just about anywhere in the city in 10 to 20 minutes.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is within easy walking distance of both the local subway and the JR stations. The staff could not have been more helpful. The room was quite large by Japanese standards with a large king bed not too hard. I liked the fact that the room had plugs for most international connections. Breakfast if not included is around $25 AUD pp but the view of the Japanese garden from the Garden lounge is worth it. We stayed two nights had one breakfast in the hotel and one locally just down the street for a third of the cost.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We spent three nights in the new otani and got upgraded to a suite which was extremely spacious and had a fantastic view out over the Japanese gardens and the city beyond. It had all we wanted however the room was very old fashioned in its decoration, which didn't seem to march quite a modern lobby and public areas. The restaurants in the hotel were also very expensive and the cheaper option (Italian style) is very poor and still not that cheap! Overall, we had a nice stay and the room was very relaxing, but it's never going to win any style awards and it just didn't feel special for the price.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I booked this hotel by accident, when my booking in Tokyo Dome hotel was cancelled. However this is a great experience. Otani is located near subway station which have good accessibility like escalator and elevator. The hotel is good for business travel. The lobby is very large and comfortable. There are also shops in there. The room is good and has large size. Unlike other typical hotel, the bed faces windows. So if you like to watch TV while laying on bed, this might not suit you. As other Japanese Hotel. This hotel is very very clean. Including bathroom. The amenities is complete. I don't have any chance to have breakfast here. But in the morning we also visit its Japanese Garden. It has a red bridge which is a perfect spot to get pictures.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nice cosy hotel but only complain is breakfast que sometimes long. Would be nice to include coffee without extra charge if guests decide to have breakfast at Nadaman. I was charged for coffee when I had breakfast at Nadaman to avoid having to que at the other 2 restaurants. Ordered coffee without realising there was extra charge as we thought coffee would naturally be included as part of breakfast.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed 2 nights - easy access by rail, or taxi from Tokyo station. As with most Japanese hotels, the staff were really good. The room was good, quite large by any standard. Lots of eating options within the complex, although many are expensive as you would expect for a quality hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here in the Main tower for three nights. 5 minutes from the subway, so easy travel, and easy to get to from airport. Both breakfast buffets were quite good, although the one upstairs has a city view. Downstairs you can see the garden. Lovely large room as well.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent a night in the hotel, which is very well located. Besides, it was very close to the area where I had work. In any case the location is very convenient. The check-in was smooth and the staff quite helpful. The room was quite large but the view wasn't great. There are quite a few restaurant options for breakfast. I opted for the one with a view of the garden but it proved to be a little crowded.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 5 days in this huge hotel.It has a beautiful garden, fitness and swimming pool and lots of friendly personnel. Rooms are big and luxury. It is beautiful but you need a map to prevent you getting lost; there are 4 restaurants to have breakfast or dinner. One of them is on the 40th floor from which you can see Mount Fuji, another restaurant slowly turns around. It is not cheap but relative close to the centre. (in 20 minutes via subway -which comes every 8 minutes - to Hachi statue and most busy trafic crossing). Emperors pallace on walking distance.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great and clean rooms are not the only features of New Otani hotel. The lovely Japanese garden is a place where I spent a lot of time. Definitely a must-see in Tokyo. Also, the shops inside make it easy to grab something to eat late at night.The beds are huge and very comfortable for good nights of sleep :)

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani for four days at the start of a tour of Japan. This hotel is huge but still feels very friendly. Our room was very clean and well maintained. The whole hotel is very clean and well presented. The Japanese garden is great to relax in. The food and drink is very expensive we had an included breakfast each day but we had to queue for quite a while even though we had a choice of four restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It's difficult for me to report this here, but the Hotel New Otani in Tokyo is starting to look a bit battered around the edges. The rooms for New Otani Club members are showing some age: furniture scratched, walls showing wear and tear, bathrooms now seem slightly outdated. Don't get me wrong, I love this hotel. I have stayed three times in the past two years, for extended periods. The gardens are wonderful, the breakfast is very good, the concierge is unbeatable for efficiency and helpfulness. But the rooms now need some TLC (tender loving care). Also, the check out procedures need to be modernized so that you can leave easily and quickly, rather than standing in a queue and going through a rather bureaucratic process. Please do make a few changes. Thanks for listening.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here for 4 days during the cehery blossoms week. The room was included with breakfast and we had choice to have it at 4 different restaurants. One buffey restaurant located at 40 something floor where you can have nice view to the surrounding. But the best buffet breakfast I think was the one at the Japanese restaurant at the lobby. It was authentic and they have some traditional drinks that I have never seen before. The room is spacious, for Japanese standard. There are many restaurants for lunch or dinner in the three buildings of the hotel. But, staffs' service can be improved.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed in the Main section of the hotel with beautiful view over the Garden. Service is tremendous with every detail thought through. Breakfast buffet (included) is extensive and delicious. Perfect location to get around Tokyo as metro is a 3 minute walk.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: it was a very decent experience which everything was great prior to my stay till the minute we got on the airport bus at the 1F (very convenient). concierge was very helpful and well organized. the room was in a good size and very clean. service was excellent and can communicate well in english. and the japanese garden outside of the breakfast place was spectacular! location is also good for being next to the subway.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani is HUGE! Yet somehow very friendly and personal. There are two parts to the hotel: The Main and the Garden Towers which is a newer section. We stayed at the main and it was fine.The hotel has a beautiful Japanese garden, especially now, the Sakura season.There are 40 restaurants , Japanese and other. We got very good restaurant advice from Ms. Mayako Hirano, concierge. She was so kind and helpful.The whole staff is extremely nice and patient . Thank you!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This gem is luxury, 1960’s style. A beautifully preserved and faithful example of another era - an attribute that appears to be undervalued by some guests. Immaculate in most elements, and a nice halfway between traditional Japanese accommodation and Western hotel chains. If you appreciate style, stay here. If you prefer generic hotels, don’t bother.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: it has good rooms (some find then smallish - it is a personal thing), and large facilities (the breakfast room is as large as a football field and offers a busy western and Japanese food buffet). Frankly what makes this a real destination is the large and beautiful Japanese garden that surrounds the hotel. It is a dreamy place, accessible to guests, large enough to host in the shade of its trees a lunch restaurant and a chapel. The reception area can at times be overcrowded -- this is no boutique hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A top-class hotel with loads of atmosphere and wonderful service from the helpful ever-to-please staff. The ancient garden is beautiful and the hotel itself full of character as it was built for the 1964 Olympics. Breakfast was fabulous and the Garden Lounge is one of the. Best eating areas in the world! The restaurants are very expensive but there are lots of really good places to eat 5 minutes walk away. A fabulous stay!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hospitality at its best. A fabulous hotel. Super staff. Excellent ambience. Perfect location. Great rooms.wonderful restaurants and an inviting shopping arcade. On a clear day you can see Mt Fuji if you are in a room in the Garden Tower.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is the second time I have stayed here. 20 years ago and in March. Same beautiful Japanese garden and attention to detail from the staff. It is a huge hotel. Nonetheless, we were taken care of for everything we needed. Umbrellas? Yes. Purchase airport bus tickets and luggage taken down to the departure level of the hotel? Yes. Skip room cleaning but need clean towels at 10pm. Yes. What a pleasure! It is located within walking distance of the Akasaka-mitsuke subway stop (centrally located) and within 10-15 minute walk to the Akasaka area with lots of dining choices if you just want to stay around the hotel. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a tour of Japan. Unfortunately we had insufficient time to sample all of its facilities. But the Restaurants and food were superb. The Japanese Garden was a delight and our room was a good size and had an excellent view over the city. Eating breakfast, looking down on the garden was a highlight, and the staff were charming with a good command of English. If we ever returned to Tokyo, we would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Some love it -- some hate it. The New Otani (Main) hotel is the older but proper center of the New Otani Hotels on the same grounds in a beautiful setting at the heart of Tokyo (Alasan Mitsuke). À bit old fashioned the Japanese way, it has good rooms (some find then smallish - it is a personal thing), and large facilities (the breakfast room is as large as a football field and offers a busy western and Japanese food buffet). Frankly what makes this a real destination is the large and beautiful Japanese garden that surrounds the hotel. It is a dreamy place, accessible to guests, large enough to host in the shade of its trees a lunch restaurant and a chapel. The reception area can at times be overcrowded -- this is no boutique hotel!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Beautiful place for business meetings and negotiations and for romantic dates as well. Prices are quite affordable. Delicious meal and exciting view! I recommend this place for tourists from other countries as "must visit".

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A beautiful building with terrific views from rooms and restuarants. Nicely situated close to the city center. The major drawback is the very slow and complicated services. Every task seems to reguire a paper slit to written by hand. There are for example long lines for breakfast even though the tables are only half-full. More personal are occuopied by preventing people to enter the breakfast areas then busy helping to clear new siting. The staff is very polite and keep on saying saying "thank you for waiting", they seem to understand the problem but the question is if the mangement cares.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is NOT a business hotel. Everything takes too long. I was in a hurry to catch a flight and the checkout process took 10 minutes... and there wasn't even a line. The breakfast was crowded and not very good. The room was tiny and not enough space to do work. The bathroom was so small, I had to use the toilet seat as a counter space. The only good thing about the bathroom was the water pressure was great. For a Japanese hotel, this is not on par with the usual great Japanese hospitality. Do yourself a favor and pick any other hotel in Akasaka.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms are small but clean. Hotel is huge and takes some time to get your bearings. The bathroom has a step up which can be dangerous. I have no dresser in my room. Staff is extremely nice and helpful but most do not speak English. Lots of stores and shopping in the hotel. Very close to the train station. Great location.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed in this hotel before and I gave it a good review. But, perversely, I now have to put a caveat on the excellence. When I arrived this time I was told by reception that I had been upgraded to the Executive Zen class of rooms. I was duly taken to their special reception on the 11th floor. Once I had been registered and had my room allocated I was informed that although I had been upgraded to this class of room I was not allowed to use the lounge or other Executive Zen facilities. I don't know about anyone else but in my world if you get an upgrade you get an upgrade. If you get an upgrade to first class on a flight they don't tell you that you can sit in first class but you cannot eat the first class food! Crazy! They said that it was because of the price difference but that is surely the whole point of an upgrade? I was told I could use the level three Otani Club lounge; which I tried to do but there I was told I couldn't use that lounge either unless I became a New Otani Club member (this despite the fact that my previous stay in this hotel a few days previous I had been allowed in).This hotel is touted as one of the best in Tokyo - it should stop penny pinching like this.
user_name:
Christopher G
Immingham, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Oasis in the middle of the city, beautiful clean hotel, pretty boutique stores, reception helpful and room has shisedo products and bidet,house maids so humble, newspaper,was on 8the floor and had a view,quite , can't hear any sound, the garden is beautiful but chilly, koi fish beautiful and big Thanks otani

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I enjoyed a deeply satisfying stay at this iconic Tokyo hotel. The service is extraordinarily effective and pleasant. This is a large, American-style hotel with a wonderful, distinctive Japanese flavour. The bewildering restaurant selection alone will keep you from straying too far away - even in a city that is one of the world's foodie capitals. The attention to details is typically Japanese. I won't try to describe the feeling of the heated toilet seats. The traditional Japanese garden is absolutely magnificent.The location is as central and convenient as it gets for business and for tourism. The price of the clean and well appointed rooms makes this clearly one of Tokyo best values, especially relative to its newer, flashier 5-star peers.Stayed March 2017

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at a nearby 3 star hotel and was constantly using this hotel's services, from limo bus drop off, day tour pick ups, and so much more. The concierge desk was great about making a phone call for me to cancel a goodwill Guide and let me purchase a return limo bus ticket. They have a beautiful garden with 400 year old samurai history, around which two restaurants are built. I ate there at least once, and highly recommend their sandwich and desert buffet. I was trying to fend off a cold, and eating there for such a reasonable price and all you can eat was exactly what I needed... especially with the beautiful gardens looking on.Anyway, a special thanks to the concierge desk as well as the bell desk. The hotel where I was staying was Japanese language only, so this hotel saved the day for much needed hotel services and great communication. I will make a point of staying here when in Tokyo next, or in a city where they have other properties. Thanks so much again!! x

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: You never get a spacious room in Tokyo unless you pay a fortune but this time I got quite a good deal on Booking.com for this hotel. Staff is generally friendly and helpful. I think the public area and guest floor corridor have been renovated in recent years which gave me a good impression and leveraged my expectation on the room. Just that at the time I entered the room, I felt it was a bit old-fashioned (especially the toilet) compared with the public area. Besides, they should have equipped a humidifier in every single room because it was very dry and I had nose bleeding in one morning. But overall speaking, I can't complain much at the price I paid. Location is fine with a short walk to the metro station. But I found it difficult to go to the Haneda airport because taxi is just too expensive and the airport limo only operates around 4 times every day. Eventually I had no choice but to transit a few times by taking metro, JR and monorail. I will consider this hotel if I am travelling for business again but it may not be an ideal hotel for leisure travellers.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed many days in this hotel. The price is okay for the quality, but room are all noisy, and the staff is not really helpful All restaurants are really expensive you should go out in akasaka to get some food !

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This really is an enormous hotel, with multiple entrances, many restaurants, 2 gyms (of sorts), spa, shops, and more. Location wise it is great - everything in Tokyo is easily accessible.Like a lot of Tokyo though I found the hotel and staff rather lacking in that personal touch. You are treated like a number, try to stray from the norm or ask for something slightly different and you will be frowned upon.
