Everything really is black or white, with no in between.That said this is definitely a 4 star hotel, it has the amenities, facilities, and services to be rated as such. Though nothing is out of the ordinary. The 2 gyms are basic with CV equipment and little else. Oh, and if you are over 5 ft don't expect to use the treadmill. They are positioned in such a way that you will bang your head on the alcove!The restaurants are many, covering all kinds of cuisine. For breakfast you can have anything from American, Continental, to local. I would stay here again, though would look at other places in Tokyo first.
user_name:
AnthonyDB
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel, attentive staff, great choice of restaurants and lovely views out over downtown Tokyo. Rooms are well appointed with minibar and satellite tv and great views! Great hotel worth a look and the restaurants are top draw!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Staying for a few days for running Marathon this weekend in Tokyo. A nice hotel, reception is extremely efficient, staff is friendly and helpful. View from the room is awesome. Nearby subway and has a small Japanese garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights. Value for money was good for Tokyo, was on a corporate rate of ¥22,000 for a basic room.PROS:- Beautiful garden (have breakfast in the restaurant overlooking the garden). Walk through the gardens.- Helpful concierge staff who speak excellent English.CONS:- Bathroom ceiling too low, shower head too low, no ventilation. Need an update.- Dated hotel interior. This was once a majestic beauty. Not so much now.- Location is slightly out of the way, not a lot in the immediate vicinity. Requires getting on the nearby train/subway or taxi.Tip - request a room with a garden view.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stepping into this hotel is like 1960's time travel. As a matter of fact, it was featured as the villain's lair in a 60s James Bond film, and it hasn't changed much since. Along with the Imperial Hotel and the now largely defunct Okura, this is one of Tokyo's old grand hotels. Despite its age, the rooms and the entire hotel is in very good condition. Rooms are clean and spacious with good beds. Bathrooms are from a previous era and not quite up to 5-star conditions. Service throughout the hotel is excellent. The hotel faces beautiful gardens which are lit at night - and particularly elaborately during Christmas time. The 40th floor breakfast restaurant features fantastic views of Mount Fuji, Shinjuku, and Tokyo Tower. The entertainment district of Akasaka is just steps away. The imperial garden is also very close by. In terms of access, adjacent Akasaka-Mistuke station has four or five different subway lines. Unfortunately, access to Haneda using the Limousine Bus is very limited. Yet altogether, this is a very pleasant hotel. Stay in the "Main" or in the "Zen House" if you can.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 5 stars for it nice place you will like it bro and sis take your gf you will be great and i liked it soo much and do not loose your things and i went for 2 times and you may be pride for it and bye my dear friends

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This 40 floor hotel was originally built in 1964, the year of the Summer Olympics here. The classy ambiance which exudes quality is visible through the hotel complex. Albeit dated, it has aged gracefully and managed to maintain its elegance. All the staff were impeccably dressed and very attentive to our needs and many spoke English. We were fortunate to get a 28 sq.m. corner room. It's now a huge complex comprising of two hotel towers and an office tower with many restaurants, shops and two medical clinics. There's also a beautiful garden (lighted) which can be enjoyed from the Garden Lounge. We enjoyed a relaxing evening in the Tower Cafe on the 40th floor with a view of the Tokyo Tower. Everything is pricey but it is commensurate with the service and facilities offered. My wife had a medical issue so we checked with a bell service staff for a clinic that had ultra sound equipment. She accompanied through the labyrinth of elevator and hallways us right to the clinic in order to insure we don't get lost. That's very commendable service with a smile to boot.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 1. As usual like most big hotels. Very friendly front desk and staff2. Room and hotel decor outdated but clean. Nonetheless looking at the quality and material of the outdated furnitures you could tell it was a very high end hotel in the 80s or 90s3. Huge room especially for Tokyo4. Nice but quieter neighborhood. But it is understandable since it is Chiyoda where the royal family's residence is located5. Awesome garden and great view of you eat at the brunch buffet restaurantOverall a great value if you can get it for a reasonable price comparing the other more updated hotels. The hotel is outdated but still very clean and comfortable. You can also expect the same good hospitality and service as other newer hotels.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. Very helpful, courteous staff. We had a lovely, spacious, light and airy room - love the bathroom 'with a view' & privacy frosted glass at the press of a button! Dining was a lovely experience in this hotel - food was wonderful. The breakfasts were excellent - great selection and relaxed, comfortable dining. The hotel's Japanese gardens are beautiful. Altogether a wonderful place to stay, in a good location of Tokyo. Worth a visit for a luxurious stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel is broken into 3 separate hotels. I stayed in the "The Main". Classic finishes but I did see a few things in my room and the hotel that were a little "tired". All-in-all I really enjoyed this hotel. The garden and lobby/shopping are very nice. I did eat at the Sky View buffet and it was amazing!! It is expensive but you can eat for 2 hours. It is a made-to-order buffet, so everything is fresh and very delicious!! The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly to me as well. If you try to be nice and speak a little Japanese then it goes a long way. I did not encounter anyone who was rude. I would stay here again! This a place for weddings and special occasions, so the lobby and banquet halls are rather busy. The breakfast buffet was typical international fare and nothing stood out as being "great" for the breakfast. There are plenty of high-end shops and restaurants to occupy your time. Subway is not too far away and there is a street full of restaurants about 5 minutes walk away. Tell your wallet everything will be okay, but be prepared to spend some money. Make sure you get a free parking ticket otherwise parking is charged by the hour. There are also a couple of temples/shrines nearby and the Japanese Palace is also close to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for a night during the crazy new years season. No problems checking in, and the updated rooms in the main tower (probably a few years old now) were great. My family has been staying for years for a few honeymoons, weddings, etc. Mr. Osato no longer resides on the top floor of the main tower, sadly (James Bond, 007 reference).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I took my son to the buffet restaurant on the 40th floor of the New Otani for a New Year's eve dinner.The views were amazing but they were the highlight. We were stuck in a corner table at the furtherest distance from the buffet despite there been numerous other tables available. The buffet selection was only fair. The service was appalling. We had to ask for dishes to be cleared. Utensils were not replaced. Then about 9 pm the staff started clearing all the tables. No service was available - no tea or coffee offered and it was even difficult to get the bill. And for this we paid Yen 33,000 or approx USD330 without any drinks. Unbelievable!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: One of my favorite hotels in Tokyo. My family and I have stayed in New Otani Tokyo for several times, and we couldn't love more its old and calm atmosphere, convenient location (very near to Akasamitsuke staion, and a lovely night bar street) and the generosity of space, which only an historic building could dominants others. Once again, the breakfast buffet is a knock-out. If you are looking for stylish and modern Tokyo stay, here is definitely not your best choice. But if you prefer to experience Tokyo with family with a little bit luxury within reasonable price, I would recommend New Otani Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: For those who will seek design and modern Japan, the (good old) New Omani is probably not the best address in town - however, for those attracted by a feel of 1960s Japan, this hotel is one of the few landmarks remaining (now that the arch famous Okura has been ripped off!).The New Otani main (beware there is a Garden Tower, which is a not so nice choice aside from the view) is tantamount to a certain style of 1960s Japan, a mix of tradition, some kind of design and also service in the old style.It is not a ryokan, but was a witness to the moment Japan opened up and welcomed first large groups of business and leisure travellers. To be noted: rooms (even though not so modern) are significantly larger than most in Tokyo, and those overlooking the Japanese garden are lovely. Restaurants feature La Tour d'Argent, quite a funny sister property of the Paris landmark. Overall the hotel is less pricey than what could be expected for the rooms - breakfast though is rather expensive for what it is and i would say no breakfast space feels very cosy (rather more a train station in fact). But definitely worth to get a taste of old Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very nice hotel with comfortable rooms, spectacular garden, great view on Tokyo from the breakfast hall at 40th floor, nice shop gallery at ground floor. Definitely recommended. Good value for the price (but I benefit of a corporate rate).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Its been years back, but it was so nice to be back at the The Hotel New Otani. One of the first western style hotels to be built in Tokyo for the 1964 Tokyo Olympics. Of course its been totally renovated but the service is just fantastic. Japanese service at its finest! From the time you enter the hotel the bell man are there to greet you and the front desk is top notch and the rooms are large with huge beds. Its well worth the money and the experience. But best of I spent 2 days just enjoying the hotel's Japanese garden which is just world class even with a water fall.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a nice hotel with very good service, and the gardens are a national treasury. The guest rooms are small and need and update and the hotel general decor needs to be updated, but it is clean and efficient. The location is good as it is near the underground station and in the center of the city, so going to most places is easy and might only require one transfer to other line.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at this hotel after our cruise. Unfortunately check in was not a very good experience seeing that we disembarked the cruise ship at 9 am and finally arrived at the hotel just before 2 pm. There were quite a lot of passengers from the cruise ship and it appeared that they were not geared up at reception for all of us. Some of us they said that the rooms were not ready, but found if you stood your ground you were given a room. We were in the Garden Wing, which was quite a long walk through the hotel to get to this wing. However, we had a young porter who took us and our luggage to our room. Very pleasant.Our room was on the 13th floor at the rear of the hotel, and to me this was the best place to be. We had the best view ever with the Japanese Garden below us and what a lovely surprise that was.We found a quick way out of the Garden Wing. When you get down to the reception area come out of the hotel and turn right. You go over the bridge, across the main road and you are in the main shopping area, it will take you no more than about 6.7 mins to walk.We found a pub down there on the right hand side selling English food, just as well as my husband does not eat Chinese food, but if you do there are plenty of eateries and small supermarkets etc.The room was well equipped with dressing gowns, slipper, safe and something never had in a hotel bathroom, fold up hairbrushes, and any the usual toiletries plus.They put new items in your room every day.This was very clean and the bathroom had a new fangled toilet with various buttons. Very high tech.All in all a lovely stay here.JUST ONE WORD of warning...............try not to connect to the hotels WiFi on your phone or iPad, because for the last two months I have no end of porn texts in the inbox.... very frustrating and annoying, can stand all this type of language , especially as I cant seem to get it stopped at the moment.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed in three and loved the hotel the staff of the hotel is good.room service is good. The food of the hotel is very dealious and it peace full .the tiffen in the very good.the management of the hotel is good

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 結婚式をしたため、こちらへ１泊しました。全面ガラス張りで夏の昼間は暑いかもしれませんが、施設はとてもおしゃれで過ごしやすい滞在になりました。どこが一番印象に残ってる？と夫にきいたら、オータニ、と夫は答えていました。（普段あまり覚えていない人なのですが・・）スタッフの方もプロ意識があるので、気持ちのいい滞在になりましたWe stayed here for our honeymoon( since we had a wedding reception here)Staff were very kind and we had a nice stay. The room is modern and elegant.You can enjoy the view from the all glass window.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is indeed a famous hotel, but it didn't disappoint me in any way as I can be difficult at times. The staffs are quick, fast, polite, and helpful. Check-in was easy and a staff will accompany you to your room to explain the facilities available and the view I had in the room. Room was satisfactory, pillows were good, the amenities in the bathroom were more than what I usually would get in a 5-star hotel standard room, 2 different bath salts and Shiseido skin-care for ladies was provided! Wow effect. Not only that, if you are lost, do approach the staff and they will provide you a map and the ladies at concierge would recommend you restaurants and help you will reservation. If it's raining, approach them for an umbrella and if you do not have the right adapter (I brought wrong ones), call the operator and it will be delivered to your room within 5 mins. Absolutely satisfactory, and the walk in the The only problem I encountered were, no late check out and the breakfast was just alright with usual long queue. But the view overlooking the 400 year old Japanese garden was peaceful and nice early in the morning. Otherwise I would give it a 100%, as the room rate is definitely not unreasonable. I would come back again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I usually gravitate toward boutique hotels but my husband had stayed here for business in the past and remembered it fondly. It is a mega hotel mostly for conventions and business travelers but it has very lovely gardens - lots of brides getting their wedding photos taken - with pools of Japanese carp an a beautiful wooden windowed restaurant and tea room (both of which you can visit without staying at the hotel). As Tokyo Hotels go it is reasonably priced for a standard room which was smallish but very comfortable with high quality bed linens and down pillows and a lovely rain shower plus hand held options for bathing. There are many restaurant options (expensive) but we recommend the Kyubey Shushi Bar for an authentically friendly Japanese sushi bar experience with the lightest melt in your mouth rice I have ever tasted!
user_name:
Margaret H
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very friendly and efficient service, excellent food and beverage offering, great location and overall an outstanding experience... its easy to get from here to anywhere in down town Tokyo. We spent most of our time around Ginza, Akihabara and some time around Aka-Saka....

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I am on a business trip, and this is the second hotel where I stay here in Tokyo.I do feel comfortable: the room is big with two beds, I have a desk, a table where to make up and the bathroom is fine.Housekeepers are warm and well mannered, the receptionists help you always. The laundry service is super expensive, I am scared of it, but the hotel is amazing. It is near the Ginza Line (subway) and other lines. It is worth a visit.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Although it was a business trip, the staff was so hospitable and the grounds so welcoming and beautiful : it was more like a vacation. Beautful lush koi pond and waterfall garden area for walking and reflection.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is an outstanding Five star hotel. It is a landmark hotel as it has its original main building with spacious rooms and its newer tower with modern rooms. This is one of the most spacious hotels as its lobby and galley are huge. It has a beautiful Japanese garden with its own waterfall. It has numerous levels with shops restaurants and even a mini upgrade deli cum market. What I like about this hotel is its ambience and large space.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If you like gigantic hotels with numerous stores and dining options then this is the place for you. It took about 10 minutes to walk from our hotel room to the street. Overall, the hotel facility was beautiful and the gardens are a very nice bonus. Many restaurants have a spectacular view of the garden or the city (we saw Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji). The room was average. The bathroom was dated. We also stayed at Tokyo Station this visit and I think the hotel trumped New Otani. I would recommend Tokyo Station for a couples vacation and perhaps New Otani for business or a conference.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at the Garden Tower. The room was clean and spacious enough for Tokyo. Its look, however, corresponded more 3-4 * hotel, surely not 5 *. The room was equipped and looked much worse than a room in the Main building. From my room in the Garden Tower in 29 floor has a perfect view of the Shinjuku's skyscrapers and during good weather you can even see Mount Fuji. The breakfast was sufficiently diverse and views to Japanese garden was charming. A short walk away from hotel are 5 subway lines, which allows fast connections with many parts of the city.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Some of the features and styling of the hotel may date from the 60's, but they were cutting edge style and design at the time, and the quality of that design shows through. Generous rooms that have been recently updated for decor and style, a myriad of bars and restaurants, some typical hotel fair, some well beyond the norm. But the service throughout the hotel is impeccable, all staff are friendly and helpful, regardless of role and position.And the garden!There is a 400+ year old garden on the site that predates the hotel, and it is simply breathtaking. For centuries this garden has been immaculately kept to generate feelings of calm and closeness to nature, and the gardeners are truly skilled in this. DO NOT MISS THE GARDEN.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just visited New Otani Hotel Tokyo - The Main and it was awesome! The rooms were immaculate, the service was impeccable, the food was amazing, and the customer service is second to none! If you visit Tokyo, this hotel should be on your list, if not to stay, at least to try their restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is the best in town. You will find stores and kit of restaurants. It is near the subway, bic camera, restaurants and markets. The room is confortable, clean and the great e ammenities. The japanese garden is amazing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Have stayed here regularly but this time in the Zen executive house . Delightful room,great views of the city,extremely comfortable and superb service. Check in quick and even though we were considerably early a room was found quickly. Great location with easy link to subway . Generous choice of restaurants, the revolving restaurant in the main tower has an impressive lunch buffet . Breakfast in the zen executive lounge very good . Superb hotel and service will stay on next trip without a doubt .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is the second time I stayed at the New Otani in Tokyo. It hadn't changed much in the last 16 years. Of course the hotel has been renovated, so the experience was great. We were on a relaxing 3 day trip to Tokyo before a working trip to Kyoto. We tried to revive our experience at the Tsukiji fish market, but now the market treats people like cattle. Don´t try to see the fish auction. It will be a disappointment.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I am the member of New Otani Club since 1983 and enjoy the stay in the past.This time, I stayed 19 nights since I had the medical treatment in Tokyo.I stayed at Zen floor where I enjoyed not only the room but also the lounge where the employees are very professional. I had the buffets every morning and had the dinner at different restaurants inside the hotel. Since there are many restaurants at the hotel, I enjoyed the different foods which satisfied my appetite.Only two (2) problems we experienced was the Sushi at Kyubei. My wife avoided "fresh fish" and had sushi with processed/heated fishes. Although she was careful, she had the severe diarrhea next morning which seems to be caused by scallop which had the yellow color in a part of the meat. We went to other sushi restaurants outside the hotel where we had the excellent sushi who had 4-5 stars. Kyubei was 1 star from my viewpoint. I strongly recommend to avoid Kyubei.The bed was too stiff for me. I asked "feather mattress" but they did not have it. The hotels such as Mandarin Oriental, Peninsula and Park Hyatt have such features in their beds. New Otani shall prepare such mattress at Zen floor.Even Japanese hotel (Imperial Hotel) has better/comfortable bed than one at New Otani.
user_name:
M M
Los Altos Hills, California

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were in Tokyo to visit my son studying abroad at Sophia University. Perfect for week long campus and city visit, right across the street in short walking distance. Lots of restaurants and stores also in walking distance.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The ground of the hotel is absolutely wonderful, it's a botanical garden on its own. The room on the New Otani Club floor of The Main was spacious and exclusive. It has a real old fashioned key to the door rather than a card key, which makes it quite interesting, although you are given only 1 key to a room.They have restaurants and cafes spread over their 3 buildings, a good choice for all tastes.You do pay a price to stay here, and given that the hotel is not particularly close to shopping and places of interest, it is rather expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: They have a very good services, so clean, nice rooms, nice and welcoming ppl, but the view from the rooms are not so good although they have a very nice garden and I have requested for garden view but I did't get it. Also the staff on the reception are not flexible and the group and I faced problems with payments. and they are too expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Strategically located within the business district, Hotel New Otani offers large rooms and excellent service. Plenty of restaurants to choose within the hotel to eat and it is easily accessible via train. The hanging garden is magnificent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I am perhaps a little bias as I lived here for 6 months back in the 1990's, however it is still an outstanding hotel with a central location that makes it ideal for traveling around Tokyo. The hotel is fairly large with many restaurants and a truly beautiful garden oasis that host many wedding groups for pictures at the weekend. The views over Tokyo are amazing at night and the rooms and service are excellent. However one feature that many might not be aware of is it houses perhaps the best patisserie in all of Tokyo, Pierre Herme'Cheers

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very large hotel. I was expecting to be disappointed. The room was in fact very nice. Modern and comfortable. Must have been refurbished relatively recently. Everything was in good working order with the room. Bathroom not very large but comfortable and in good shape. The hotel has multiple restaurants and shops. Very large common areas. Nice and large Japanese garden outside which you can visit. The garden room is a decent place for breakfast, with a nice view over the gardens. Pretty busy though and had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated. Hotel is pretty central and easy of access. Overall, a good place and reasonably priced by Tokyo standards. Good place for a business trip. There are more personable places for private/vacation type of trips I would think.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I selected the New Otani for our post-cruise stay due to it's location. The metro is very easy to access and Viator offers pick up at this property for their various day trips of the Tokyo area. Please be aware the restaurants within the hotel property are very expensive.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Fantastic hotel. great food, set in great grounds, lovely staff.All in all the hotel is in a great location, and we loved it.The shops inside the hotel are very upmarket and ultra expensive, but nice to browse in.
user_name:
ShirleyWatts
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: At the end of a four week trek around Japan, with accommodation having ranged from hotels of all sizes and a few Ryokan thrown in for the experience, the New Otani The Main was a wonderful way to end an absolutely fabulous holiday.On arrival to the hotel you are greeted with the standard Japanese efficiency and politeness, but this hotel went one step further, nothing could have been a trouble with all of our lat minute end of holiday requirements being managed with nothing but the outcome expected.Our room was far larger than anything we had become accustomed to in the larger cities which was a huge advantage when consolidating luggage and packing for a return flight home.The grounds of the hotel a sprawled over a very large space filled with a very beautiful Japanese garden. A little piece of paradise right in the centre of Tokyo.However, having said this, as with everything in Tokyo, this hotel is within a short train ride of everything that you could wish to see or do, so the isolated tranquility is just a bonus.I can not but recommend this property to anyone staying in Tokyo. Yes it is a little on the higher side of prices but as a start to a holiday or as we did to finish off the Japanese experience, why not finish on a high and give yourself something further to remember the experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very large hotel with multiple food outlets / bars etc. Comfortable and clean. Japanese Gardens spectacular. Food in Garden view restaurant was rubbish quality but other restaurants was OK. Coupons for meals was a pain and breakfast only starting at 0700 was also a pain. There was ample justification for opening restaurants earlier as there was always a long queue for 0700 opening time.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is very good with the best private garden in Tokyo.As a very good location with many good transports like 5 metro liines and 2 train lines within walking distance.Rooms are nice, pelople are extremely friendly and helpfull. you can find in the hotel almost whatever you need.The only negative piont for me is the internet system that you need validate many times and this can disturb normal internet work.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I visited Tokyo and Hotel New Otani after 40 years and was extremely happy to see the old world charm! Large corridors, large rooms, buffet breakfast overlooking the beautiful Japanese garden were the highlights of our stay. The Japanese garden is well maintained-complete with a water fall, water body, bridges and lanterns.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: From time to time I love going into a huge hotel with huge restaurants, bars and all kinds of services that there were many in the sixties. Nowadays not that easy to find this sort of hotel where you don't need to get out as there are everything you need within the hotel facility. We love the New Otani because of the room size and the service. To my surprise the housekeeper found the tiny pill that I had lost that morning! Breakfast can be chosen between Japanese breakfast (I totally recommend it) and western breakfast. The subway station is nearby as well as many local and international restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Unique experience, was nice because it allows to feel the urban Tokyo.Close to several interest places.Service is outstanding and aligned to the Japanese culture.As all places in Tokyo are well served by public transportation

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here , with a tour group , recently . The hotel is totally overwhelming on first impressions . It seemed a long walk to the Tower reception area from the main entrance . However the staff were delightful , our room , on the 29th floor , .was well-appointed and and the decor fresh and modern . The corridor carpets deserve a special mention . We enjoyed breakfast in the 40th floor restaurant and the other one that overlooks the famous Japanese garden , which is a great feature of the hotel . We didn't use any of the hotel restaurants ; they are extremely expensive , but that was no problem as the hotel is located in an area where you can find restaurants of all kinds and price-ranges , all a short walk away .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my second stay at the hotel new otani. I booked a room for 3 nights for a business trip. The proximity to the nearest underground station and also Tokyo main station is a big draw for this hotel. Although the weather was not great when I was there based on my previous visit the can say that the Gardens are fantastic to walk through and if that's not enough one of the larger Japanese Gardens is a stones throw away from the hotel. If you get breakfast with the room then you won't be disappointed there are several locations within the hotel to have the most important meal of the day. I used the restaurant in the ground floor which had everything from a continental breakfast to a more Asian style with dumplings and noodles.I would definitely go back here for a third time if I come to Tokyo again

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nice location just a few minutes from the Palace. Rooms good size and comfortable. Bathroom well equipped with a Toto seat (heated, bidet etc). Complimentary razors.Staff efficient and very polite.The Gardens with waterfall and ponds are beautiful and well worth walking.The included breakfast buffet is good with broad selection. Unfortunately, at other times we found the meals expensive and not that good or worth the price eg two coffees and a single club sandwich $45. In total a nice pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A huge hotel with its own mini-city of shops, bars and restaurants, the hotel also has a beautiful Japanese garden, over 400 years old!It is accessible from Narita airport by limousine bus, about a 90-minute ride. The service is in one word, outstanding. People can almost read your mind, as to what you want, and provide it to you.Try to get a room on a higher floor so you can have a beautiful view of the Akasaka area and a nice garden (different from the old garden).I have stayed in this hotel several times, both in the Main and the Garden towers. Both have nice rooms but I prefer the Garden tower.I suggest signing up for the New Otani club program, which gets you discounts at the various establishments in the Hotelopolis and the gym, which unfortunately is not free. The hotel can provide walking/jogging maps around the area. I particularly enjoyed walking around the Akasaka palace.Overall, I give this hotel an A.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nice hotel, good service, apparently renovating Tower rooms what was necesssary, the main bulding has confortable rooms with good bathrooms. Good breakfast and good selection of resturants and bar. Maybe sometimes crowed in common areas but still quite.Prices as most of the hotels in Tokoy nowadays a little high

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is well situated in central Tokyo, close to train stations and a good selection of restaurants etc in the Akasaka area. The hotel has large rooms which we found to be comfortable and the service from all staff was impeccable. Lovely Japanese gardens at the hotel provide a small oasis in a bustling city. The hotel occupies a vast area and can be quite challenging getting out and around it. Overall though an excellent choice for us.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel with plenty of amenities. Rooms are very modern and profit plenty of room for the business traveler. The hotel has many restaurants and retail outlets to choose from and is within walking distance to the Akasaka shopping district.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Have stayed at New Otani each year for two weeks over last 25 years and the standard has always been the same -Excellent. If you don't want to go out there is a large number of restaurants to chose from. Location near Akasaka and subways means no problem in travel or eating out.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: For first-timers and others who visit Tokyo, the New Otani is an oasis within the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. The Japanese Garden is definitely a feature attraction with its koi pond, waterfall, walking trail and tea house. The other feature is a breakfast buffet on the 40th floor of the Garden Tower. It has a great overall view of the city. There is also a 360 degree, revolving restaurant, The Sky. I cannot rate the food as I only had drinks at the bar with friends. The only negative point about the hotel is when I ordered the New Otani Club Breakfast Package. Breakfast is included in the various restaurants, except Satsuki restaurant where there is an additional charge of about $17. To me, if you purchase a breakfast package anywhere, then breakfast should be included with no additional charge.I can say that the breakfast selection at Satsuki is good. It has a wide selection of Japanese, western and a few Chinese selections. Fruits, salads and desert are also offered.In summary, I would recommend this hotel to escape a hectic day of touring or busy day of business meetings.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: i last stayed in this vast hotel - more like a small town really - during the 1980s. The intervening years have taken a toll and some at least of the rooms need an overhaul. but what it has lost in lustre, the new otani makes up in charming, attentive service, a lovely japanese garden and a great choice of good food...very japanese in other words

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel is around 10-15min walk from the nearest station. And also the food street called Akasaka. There are many eateries, drug stores, alcohol stores, convenience stores, etc. You can find really cheap Yamazaki and Hakushu there. Safe environment. Quite an old hotel with old-fashioned furniture and interior design. Room is clean, spacious and is well equipped. Iron & ironing board is upon request. Water is replenished daily, 30yen if you want more. Staffs are polite, great customer service. Breakfast is served with the same dishes everyday. Nothing special. Hotel room is priced at a higher end which I wouldn't stay in if I had to pay on my own.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We spent 4 nights here on arrival in Tokyo. We took the executive bus from Narita which was really efficient and comfortable, and dropped us at the door. The hotel staff handled our luggage from the bus and took it to our room.The hotel is immense and rather overwhelming.Check in was efficient and our room was very comfortable on the 34th floor of the Main building - we paid more for this as reviews suggested the Garden tower was still being renovated.The room had everything that we needed - a kettle with tea and coffee, complimentary water, nightshirts, toiletries, tooth and hair brushes etc - you really didn't need to bring anything. There is good free wifi and air conditioning. The only item lacking was an iron.The staff were very attentive and polite. The Japanese gardens were lovely both day and night. Also an attractive rose garden. There is an indoor pool and spa which is expensive and wasn't signposted which was rather strange. The outdoor pool was free if you joined the (free) Otani club by completing a form at reception.There is a huge array of restaurants which are all pricey. We didn't eat at the hotel but chose to eat in Tokyo itself. Also a large number of luxury shops between the two buildings.Yotsuya station is only 5 minutes walk and on the JR line if you have the JR pass. We had breakfast there at Becks Coffee Shop which was ideal for good value coffee and light breakfast - we enjoyed the yoghurt and fruit.So, a lovely hotel to stay, very clean and well equipped, rather impersonal due to its size, and expensive for eating if you are the average traveller. Consider paying extra for a room in the main tower.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is a huge hotel, but throughout our stay it was remarkably calm and serene, including in the restaurants, and the service was very warm and personal.What makes this hotel really special is that the hotel sits in its own grounds which include a Japanese garden, which is beautiful and peaceful - so even though it is very central in a busy city, the feeling is quite different from one that just opens onto the street. It is very conveniently located for Nagatacho subway (2 mins walk from the Garden Tower entrance) and the 'Esplanade Akasaka' (from 3 minutes walk) which has dozens of restaurants and bars to suit every taste and budget.I'd thoroughly recommend staying here for anyone needing a top class hotel in central Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: There are plenty of shopping places within the hotel, as well as places to eat. The front desk staff were well-versed in English so they will be able to guide you if you need assistance, honestly speaking from experience. A friend of mine was injured, and they did their best to assist him, even trying to get him in to see a Doctor they had within a clinic at the hotel itself (so not only does it have 30+ restaurants, it also has multiple doctor's offices). The garden ground itself was beautiful with plenty of koi, and a mini-waterfall for picturesque moments. Hotel was also adequately priced, and a bargain in my opinion for the amount of amenities. Next time might try to stay at the Executive Lounge to see the difference from the 2nd best option (as the hotel is so large there are 3 experiences to choose from).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We recently stayed in this hotel for three nights. We liked its world charm and large rooms with faboulus wiews in the main wing.The hotel is not close to any tourist atraction but the subway station Akasaka Mitsuke with the acces to Marounuchi and Ginza Metro lines is just 400 m away. We enjoyed the breakfast in the Garden Lounge with its nice wiew over the beautiful japanese garden which is situated on the rear side of the hotel. The hotel has also an open air pool which is the biggest hotel pool in Tokyo. We spent a few relaxing hours there. The entrance is free for the guests with the New Otani club card which you can get free for overseas visitors on their WEB site. As the Club members we also got upgraded rooms in the hotel main wing club floors. The staff of the hotel is extremly friendly and helpfull included the staff in the reception. It is definitley one of the best hotels I stayed in and I would recommend this hotel to any future Tokyo visitor.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is located in a quite area about 10 mins walk from the subway or easy to get a cab to local sights and restaurants. The staff are efficient and friendly. The rooms are very comfortable with all the facilities that you would expect for this standard of hotel. They have the most beautiful Japanese garden in the grounds. The garden restaurant has a buffet breakfast available. This restaurant has a beautiful vista over the 400 year old gardens. A room on a high level would give you fanastic views of the city.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Dates of stay: 14 - 16 September 2016 (2 nights) Hotel New Otani is a getaway from the hustle and bustle of the Tokyo city! This was my first business trip to Tokyo and I had some choices of business hotels that I could pick from my list of corporate hotels. I heard some reviews of some places but decided on this one as it seem to be quite a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle from the busy life in Tokyo city! My opinions on this hotel: Location: This hotel is located near the Akasaka-Mitsuke district that was close to Yoyatsu and Akasaka-Mitsuke. I did not have much time to explore this area and took mostly taxi in and out. I do not think the location is very convenient for a shopper as it was tucked away in a "mountain" area. I did notice some shopping area like BIC Camera and Tokyu Plaza nearby but I did not have time to explore this area so I really am not sure how convenient it is to walk down the "hill" to reach these shopping venues. The Hotel: top notch! First class! Entering the concierge was a pleasure. It was 5-star hotel like it should be. Every decoration in this hotel was tastefully done. This hotel was actually quite big, it had a main and a garden wing. As it was located on top of a "hill" so I guess it makes sense for the hotel to have some shops located in this hotel. The Room: Superb! Cosy! I think as a 5-star hotel, it is a nice hotel not only for business associates but also for dating couples to stay. The room was large and spacious. It had a couch that you could sit/lay down. The bed was king size, huge and cosy. They had this special touch whereby you could choose the pillow you like - Tempur, and several other types. I called for room service to ask for a Tempur pillow. The bathroom was great, if not excellent. It came with a bath tub and also Shiseido amenities for men and women, bath salts, etc. The Shiseido amenities smelled superb! I stayed at room 963 that was at the end of the "road" but it was facing a junior suite and I felt safe despite being a solo female traveler. Breakfast: breakfast was served in several locations, but for Otani Club Members, the price was reasonable at estimated 2000 yen. Their buffet spread was the usual standard that every 5-star hotel had and was adequate and tantalizing. Service: excellent. What can I say except that this is truly a 5-star hotel. Sleep quality: excellent! I had quiet, peaceful, tranquil sleep during the 2 nights and undisturbed. The room was cosy and used yellow lights to create a comfortable and tranquil ambience thus making everything feel good. My overall opinion is that this is my home away from home, cosy and comfortable is what makes this stay excellent!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We booked to stay here because The complex is part of the film set used in the James Bond movie you only live twice.Nice hotel, typically smaller rooms which is normal in Tokyo.Odd breakfast options, again normal in Japan for a European.Overall lovely hotel with plenty of facilities...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It is a huge intallation-consistinv of 3 towers that are interconnected via 6th floor corridors.!!! This makes a non obvious entrer/exit from this building. Reception in on the 6th floor of course. Breackfast average with a neutral set up. A plus is the view. PREFER THE GARDEN VIEW RESTAURANT. This is the one you pass near when walking between the two towers. On the 6th floor...of course... We had a room on the 35th floor. Great view!!!!!!! Room.spatious.The free water botle every day..a very welcomed gesture.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Every detail of this top hotel is right. The price is reflective of the quality of the facilities and service. Definitely the best hotel I've stayed in during my visits to Japan.One word of warning: check the price of coffee before you order!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The staff upgraded our reservation to a suite as a "surprise" gift for my brother as the trip was in part to celebrate his 70th birthday! I was also returning to the site of my first date with my future husband...we viewed the city from the Sky Bar. On our last night in Tokyo we enjoyed a wonderful dinner as we circled the city with my son and daughter-in-law who now reside in Japan. The staff was exceptionally cordial and able to answer all our needs. Thank you for being the "icing on the cake" of a multi-purposed trip to the land of the rising sun. We even climbed a section of Mt. Fuji! Domo arigato gosimasu!
user_name:
Janet M
Jacksonville, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel was first class, service was very good, rooms were nice! Very easy access the subway from hotel. Only thing that was disappointing was the outside pool. It seemed out of place for such a great hotel, pool was like for a 3 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Extremely large hotel with 3 different towers. Slightly confusing when trying to get outside to walk or find restaurants. Wonderful daily breakfast buffet with Western and Japanese choices. Beautiful gardens and ponds of koi to calm the weary travelers. Subway access good once you find it. Felt safe and staff was very attentive. Bathrooms have a large step up to enter which is a bit confusing at nighttime. Free bottled water is a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Visited here as part of an escorted tour of Japan. Lovely hotel with immaculate and beautiful Japanese gardens. My room was on the 32nd floor, a good sized room with kingsize bed and views over the city. Bed firm but comfy, with lovely snugly duvet. Bathroom clean with good facilities and hairdryer, all toiletries including shampoo, conditioner, body soap, toothbrush with toothpaste, razor, shower cap, cotton wool pads , folding hair brushes! Toto washlet toilets which are brilliant. Complimentary bottles of spring water, Mobile phone charging point right next to bed, Dressing gowns, slippers. Extra Facilities include in-room massage! Breakfast buffet choice of 3 restaurants in the hotel, one in the tower with a fantastic view. Room service available.Use of the pool costs extra money though which is a shame. They also have a shopping arcade and convenience store. Great breakfast, a lot to choose from. Tried some Japanese specialities. All allergens labelled in English which is perfect. All in all, a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is huge. But it really does have it all. It's in a great location near a train station. The service is impeccable, staff were incredibly helpful and accommodating. There's a zen garden amongst many other facilities but it really does host the most vast and brilliant breakfast, from traditional Japanese cuisine to croissants and eggs on toast. Japan is amazing. Don't hesitate to go, just go. And stay here. You won't regret it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It's hard to answer the taxi driver's question at which entrance to be dropped and even harder to connect when being picked up at the meeting room entrance. To walk to the wonderful restaurant area just a block away, go through the tunnel of shops to the garden tower and. yes, down 6 floors. There are no signs. Like the other Japanese hotels where I've been for meetings, this colossal complex is sparkling clean, staffed by polite staff who speak English and full of creature comforts, but suffers from impersonal monumental architecture and neglect of some practical touches that would make a guest feel more welcome and at home. The room was on the pricey side, but large and attractive. The wifi worked well. I'd come back, but with a better GPS to find my way in and out of the confusing multi-layered complexity.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Beautiful place. Walking distance to shopping areas. Highly recommend going to the top floor for buffet breakfast. The garden is stunning. Staff were friendly. Highly recommended for stay. Taxis are readily available as well. We were staying there as part of our pre booked tour with Trafalgar group doing a 9 day tour of Japan

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Lived in Japan 20 yrs ago. Went back to show my children. Booked New Otani on line and got a decent rate (especially for Tokyo). It was amazing. Beautiful garden, pool, fairly big room, fun toilets, close to subway (totally safe with kids), close to some good restaurants ( ramen, pizza, mcd's).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed there for 4 nights. Location is great as it's close to 3 different subway lines. My room was very good size by Tokyo standard. There are 2 towers and the prosperty is massive. The garden is beautiful with tranquil water falls. Getting a copy of the property would be a great idea as it's so massive. My advice of traveling in Tokyo is to ask front desk staff to write down hotel name and address in Japanese. I find that if you want to take a cab at night, most cab drivers cannot speak English or read English address. I took one star off because the property it due for some upgrading. My room was still very clean but everything was dated. I was actually given a key (not a card) that I needed to return to the front desk. I was a little bit late of the 10 am check out (by 15-20 mins) and they couldn't wait to call my room as I hadn't returned the key.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for business trip, quite expensive but great service. Very attentive staff, even having someone to press the elevator button for you (such a chore normally!). There are many restaurants within the hotel complex but I'd recommend the garden restaurant as the views of the amazing gardens are stunning. Good breakfast with both western and Japanese options.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It was a very expensive stay for an extremely tiny bedroom.The service was lovely, you definitely cannot fault the staff at all, however the price was definitely not worth it.There was a shuttle to the airport but it wasn't free. Considering the amount you pay for a basic room, it was a shame this wasn't included. The location wasn't the greatest either. The property is a bit of a maze. Although the staff were lovely, I probably wouldn't book again as the rooms were too small and the price too much.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: First 3 night accommodation of my 16 day Trafalgar tour of Japan. Realised how big the complex is with different towers for their rooms. Lobby & reception was very impressive and welcoming. I needed a guide to take me to my room as I found it confusing initially. Was given a Garden Tower suite on level 20 and the view looking down to the Japanese garden was impressive including the skyline of the Chiyoda district. There were lots of dining room options and bars including a Tour d'Argent French restaurant. Views from the revolving bar/restaurant was great at night & at breakfast. Good buffet breakfast at Satsuki & great cocktails at Bar Capri. My room was comfortable and quite spacious. I requested a non-smoking room but I can smell hints of tobacco smoke. Room furnishings were dated and needs some major upgrade. Felt very safe in the hotel with security everywhere. If I would be given a proper non-smoking and a refurbished room I will stay again at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Our experience was outstanding. The courtesy of the staff and atention to the minor details ought to be underscored. The quality of the breafast buffet both on the Garden Court and the Tower is comparable to the best we have experienced at top notch hotels such as this one, also the spacious and upscale room we had, gave us the very best feeling in our first visit to Tokyo. Overall a true magnificent experience. The only reason not to rate the hotel as excellent is because of the mess it has created with the swimming pool. Apparently it has been leased to an independent party so as a guest you have to join a club (allegedly free of charge) to use it. When you try to go, then you have to compete to enter and for a spot with a myriad of non guest-local-teenagers who by paying a fee have access to the facility, loud music and a datig spot for locals, it´s truly a mess, the first five star hotel I have found with such unpleasant complications to use the swimming pool.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at the New Otani The Main for best part of a week - not cheap, but it delivered a sense of luxury without being ostentatious. It is a very big hotel, including the Main and the Garden Tower wings. Their is an abundance of good dining options - we only used the hotel for breakfast in the main buffet area on the ground floor overlooking the fantastic Japanese garden - JPY2000 each for full breakfast buffet (subject to joining the New Otani Club - this can be done at check-in). The garden is a real draw, guests usually strolling the gardens after breakfast or before dinner. The hotel was, I am told, originally built for the 1964 Olympic Games and has hosted many heads of state on visits to Tokyo. Great views of the gardens and/or Mount Fuji in the distance. Apart from the hotel's general ambiance, it is a short walk to the metro line at Akasaka Mitsuke, only 4 stops from Shinjuki or Tokyo station in the other direction. Ideal central location - one day we walked to the Royal Palace and on to Ginza - no problem. I know I made the right choice with the New Otani!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is located centrally, 5 minutes walk to an underground station. The concierge and house keeping are really responsive and helpful. There are several nice (therefore quite expensive) restaurants providing several options for all your meals. The room are quite and functional. Free wifi is included with no password is a plus. The only point that I was slightly disappointed about is the bathroom which is functional but looks a bit aged. Overall a very positive experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have been staying at the New Otani since 1993 and it never fails to impress. Service is impeccable and the Japanese Garden makes it unique amongst Central Tokyo hotels. There is also a huge range of in house restaurants.. I cannot recommend it too highly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We travelled here with trail finders and we were not disappointed. What a stunning hotel and the traditional Japanese garden was a delight and a treasure, we walked from the nearest 'tube' station through flowering cherry blossoms to reach a wonderful hotel. We stayed B&B. The breakfasts were sublime, either sitting enjoying miso, curry & rice looking over Tokyo or enjoying American fair over looking the garden. We were very happy here,

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here 8-23 to 8-29th, room was in main tower which we picked based on few reviews we read here.It was a good size room for two adults and two small kids ( 6 and 9 years old). Liked the fact that the bathroom had a bath tub with a shower head and a shower space adjacent to it as well . Which made getting ready in the morning much faster. Lots of counter space as well. Bathroom had a lot of toiletries, such as razors, hair brush, shower cap, loofahs, and of course the usual shampoos, conditioners, and body soap. My wife loved the walk in closet, it made a huge difference due to us staying there six days. We were out by 8am, and back to the hotel by 9 or 10 pm to sleep, so we didn't really require much seevice attention. We did order room service one night, and the food was delicious, good portions, and arrived on the promised time..Liked the attention every time we went downstairs or coming back up that there was a staff member wearing a kimono that would greet us as we approach the elevator. That little touch added a nice feel to our stay.Finally the location was walking distance to the train station. A convenient store close by as well ( famima).. which was good in getting snacks and drinks at the end of our sight seeing day. If never visited one it is worth it so many choices that you can easily spend $30 on stuff, but worth it. Much cheaper than the hotel fridge. Also there was a Starbucks and coffee beans in the same building as the market.I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to family and friends. Great service, the room was on the 8th floor .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is really great. Great location. Very big and clean. But when I went to have a swim in the pool after a long hot day out in the city, I was told to pay an extra ¥2000 per person on top of the almost AU$1000 I had already paid for three nights. This is insane. I have never had to pay to use a pool as a paying guest of a hotel. I had also booked to stay at New Otani in Osaka but will now cancel that booking and find somewhere that has a pool included. We were also offered an upgrade at check-in but for an extra ¥2000 per person per night which we never asked for. It feel like they are money grabbing here and it has left a bad taste in my mouth.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Perfect service, very attentive staff, amazing garden with fish, very tasty food, live music when given the dinner. The only thing was a little bit small double bed and low knowledge of English of support staff, but when the problem occured always well managed by next level management.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Had a family of 2 adults 3 children (8,11,14) stay. Awesome location. Within walking distance from2 train stations. Great restaraunts on site. Local supermarket on site. Huge hotel. Beautiful gardens. Staff friendly and spoke excellent English. No hesitation at all to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nestled in the Financial District of Tokyo this beautiful hotel and its surrounding gardens are yet another reminder of the steep history and culture that Japan has to offer even the casual business traveler.Make sure you take the time to enjoy the surrounding gardens, they are amazing.If you like Japanese

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel with all the amenities - great bars, restaurants (from pizza to high end), spa, pool, shops and the beautiful Japanese garden in site was a real treat! Closely located by metro station gives great access all over the city by public transport. Have to say staff were first class too !But it is tired. My room was beyond disappointing for the category and price. It needed redecorating and a refurbishment - especially the bathroom, which was up an unhelpful step you kept hitting your foot on, and it was tiny! The whole hotel is in need of a revamp and then it may just be perfect!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very slick check in when you find it, plenty of staff on deck to minimise the wait.Comfortable, spacious room with views. Cleanliness is a Japanese forte and we were not disappointed. For breakfast, I would have preferred a greater leaning toward Japanese cuisine (when in Rome etc). Obviously catering for hungry Americans. Restaurant food was more Japanese oriented and very good. The meticulously kept garden, a wonderful place to stroll around. All in a very nice 2 day stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I expected more from a 5 star hotel tbh however it didn't ruin my stay, the location was great especially if you're out late with friends you don't have to worry about how to get back to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would go back however it is a little over my price range and as I mentioned before it was not what you would expect from a 5 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a good, but definitely not great hotel. And definitely not worth the 5 stars that it's got. 5 star hotels around the world in major cities like tokyo provide better accommodation and service. - staff is polite and friendly. - room was ok for size. Overall, very clean but the entire hotel has a dark, a bit worn out look. Carpet everywhere (but this is also found in US big hotels) - the bathroom was very, very small (see picture), and definitely not what may be expected in a 5 star hotel. It was impossible to stand in it without touching the toilet, and being in there with two persons at the same time was out of the question. Equipment was clean, functional, but also not very recent. - the hotel restaurants are' ridicilously expensive (and I like to eat well, and not cheap). The buffet (!) restaurants all had a price of 10.000 yen/person (about 100 USD) just for the buffet, and wine started at 7000 yen (70 USD) for very plain local Japanese white wine. Japanese whisky from 20 USD/glass.. Also, the Italian restaurant was very expensive (about four times what you would pay in Europe). We paid about 180 USD/ person in total in both restaurants. For that price, you could almost eat in the three michelin star restaurants in Tokyo. Even the downscale restaurants like the Ribroom or Trader Vic's, or even the swimming pool resto was too expensive. Across the streed there a big office complex just opened (Tokyo garden terrace) with a dozen restaurants (all kinds of cuisine) that offer better quality for half the price. besides the above, there was are also some annoyances in service - we did the rooftop restaurant buffet once. This had an amazing view and setting (and good food, but too expensive, see above). We entered at 8 PM. The waiter mentioned nothing about opening times, got us to the table, brought the aperitives, and then mentioned that the buffet closed at 9 PM, which we didnt know. This was of course very tight, for a multiple course upscale buffet. Moreover, the waiter brought the bill already at 8.45, so that we couldn't really enjoy the good buffet (didn't even get to the main or dessert). This was very disappointing for a 180 USD/person meal. - the hotel advertises the pool, but admission comes with a fee (which I didnt notice at booking). A ridiculous 150 USD for non-hotel guests (we had friends stopping by) and 20 USD for guests. This is also not very ok. If one pays for a 5¨hotel, some services (basic, like a pool) should be at least included. If one became a member of a club (new otani club), the pool was free, but then of course you will receive years of spam. - When checking in, the hotel put a 300.000 yen (3000 usd) block on my credit card, even though the room charges were only half. When checking out, they paid the bill with a (unnecassary) seperate load on the card, so that the total load from the hotel only was 5500 usd on my card, for a bill of 2300 usd. This caused problems for the rest of the trip...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It's my first visit to Tokyo, so I cannot compare the New Otani with other Hotel in the City, but I could make the comparison with the average in Europe and I don't recommend this hotel. The bulding is not bad, the resturant are almost good but the room (standard double room) are old fashion furnished, with carpet (moquette that I is not good in case of asthma suffering) and the bath room is totally obsolete (the shower curtain was old and the shower head is not easily to fix risking of wetting the whole environment), In one word is a great delusion and I would avoid next time I go to Tokyo

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a very big hotel and that may not be what everyone wants, but the rooms are very nice, the public areas superb and spacious and the pool is an absolute godsend at this time of year (see note below on avoiding high usage charges).The service, as you would expect, is absolutely faultless. akasaka mitsokuke subway station is just 3 mnutes away.Cons - anything in the hotel is very pricey, but this was not a problem as there is a great selection of restaurants by the subway. The pool is also expensive to access. Charges can be avoided by joining the New Otani Club prior to arrival, which includes free use of the pool.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: On a package tour of Japan, this was the best. The rooms were the largest for lowest category we experienced on trip. Cheaper dining available within walking distance including subway. The garden, for a hotel, was a nice touch. Staff was courteous. A hamburger at garden restaurant was $25USD which is not surprising for similar establishments.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is an excellent choice for either business or leisure. It's a nice change from the famous western style business hotels in Tokyo. It's conveniently located near imperial gardens and right on the red-line. While the rooms and building may not make you gasp in their modernity, there are several special reasons the New Otani is still a great hotel. 1. Service. The service throughout the hotel is impeccable. Everyone is always respectful and will recognize when you need help and gladly assist. They are at the same time everywhere and no where. They also dress in shifts thru the day- early morning you will find the elevator staff in traditional Japanese style dress, shifting to smart hotel suits with caps in the afternoon. I've seldom experienced such a great staff anywhere else in the world. 2. The Garden. This garden is spectacular. You can see why so many weddings are held here. You can walk thru it at your leisure , or look down into it from the Garden Lounge room- a restaurant point with a 50m glass wall overlooking the garden. There is also a restaurant in the back with views. 3. Restaurant and shops. The main tower and the garden tower are full of various shops and restaurants. Near main tower there is even a shop that sells antique samurai swords! (A bit expensive). But the I think the food- and the number of options, are special. My favorite is the Shabu Shabu restaurant (although I get the sukyaki every time ), but the steakhouse and the teppanaki restaurant in the garden outside are can't miss. Again, excellent service and great food. Despite its age, this hotel still pulls it off, at a better value than most in Tokyo. Will continue as my goto option.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Busy hotel, centrally located with multiple dining options. My first impression was not too great since they charged a full days rent for 2 hr early check in. Also, being a busy hotel there were queues for morning breakfast on all the days I stayed in, which was a pain when you are in a hurry.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is an old hotel and not part of an international chain. This means that it's great value and although the place is a little faded, that comes across more as charm and pedigree. Service is excellent with helpful staff on hand to guide those uninitiated into Japanese ways or Tokyo itself. We ate well in a hotel cafe when we arrived late. Breakfast buffet in the beautiful (view) garden restaurant was a little disappointing due to poor selection of eggs etc. but then we are in Japan. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Friendly Planet booked us into this hotel as part of a 5 day package from Los Angeles CA to Tokyo. Very nice facility in heart of Tokyo with many restaurant & bar choices. Did not like that pool & exercise facilities cost extra.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very nice hotel room in a great location- didn't like the step up to the bathroom from the dressing room- Modern room- great bed- nice amenities- just stayed overnight. Found the large hotel with two wings and a few convention floors to be a bit confusing to find our way around however. Lovely garden adjoining the property and fun to see it in the midst of a busy town-

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani Tokyo for our last night on our Japan trip. We wished we stayed here longer. What a great full service hotel in the heart of Tokyo. The rooms were all modern and 5 star. The main lobby bar overlooking the most beautiful garden we've ever seen in a hotel! I would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for that North American style 5 star hotel. We will certainly stay here for longer next time!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at New Otani for 7 nights. We absolutely loved this hotel. The room was extremely comfortable as was the bed. The staff is wonderful and were able to answer any questions. It is very close to a few subway lines so very easy to get around. The garden in back is beautiful. I would definitely stay here again when in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Wonderful service, beautiful rooms, amazing breakfast. We stayed in both buildings of the hotel and liked each. The location is very convenient and the gardens are glorious. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at New Otani Tokyo the Main last weekend for three nights and I'll have to say the experience was better than I expected. The room was quite spacious and comfortable, however, the bathroom was a bit cramped. The hotel has a beautiful garden to take a walk around and is located near three different subway stations which would take you about 5-10 min. on foot. I didn't get a chance to have breakfast at the restaurants but had a lunch at a sushi restaurant, "Kyubey" and it was great. Overall, it was a satisfactory stay but honestly, I'm not quite sure if I'd choose this hotel on my next visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for three nights last week on businessGood stuff- staff very helpful- location- garden- teppanyaki very good but also expensive- wireless network- strong hot shower Not so good- bed too hard- TV dated- decor a bit dated- tried both breakfast restaurants and couldnt get any scrambled eggs that were hot!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A mixed trip of business and pleasure we stayed at New Otani Sunday and Monday, travelled to Osaka and back to New Otani Thursday. Tower first time and Main second. The rooms were delightful, not huge but perfectly big enough. What makes hotel so good is excellence of staff and convenience of location. We treated ourselves to Teppanyaki in the garden - it IS expensive and should be regarded as a genuine treat. Everything works. We left a bag when we checked out and it was already in room when we checked back in. Eating on a more modest scale we always visit the Isehiro Yakitori in the basement which is quite casual but extremely tasty. I must confess my bias as I have been staying at this hotel regularly since 1997 and knowing the surroundings so well makes travel around Tokyo much easier

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Affordable hotel in good location of Tokyo. Rooms of descent size, big toilet room, exceptionally clean. Excellent service. Hotel is gigantic and one can nearly loose himself if entering by the wrong door giving a slightly impersonal atmosphere.Three potential breakfast restaurants, all over prized. Bars are ridiculously expensive. Garden Court restaurant awful: bad service, bad food, expensive - like really.So, don't hesitate to take this hotel but eat somewhere else (breakfast across the street at Dean and DeLuca).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel has a location Central, practically in the Down Town, is perfect for explore all the city without problems, you can take a taxi (not it recommend, in Japan are expensive) or go to the excellent metro-system that has Tokyo. Is about 5 minutes walking from the Marunouchi Line which is the close of underground more nearby.The courtesy of the Japanese is legendary, Thanks for it¡

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel itself is very nice with all the amenities. Breakfast very good with selection of restaurants and beautiful Japanese garden. Problem was that we were in old wing. The rooms were small and outdated considering this is a luxurious hotel. Would stay again but definitely check other rooms in garden tower.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I love the ambience. It has a beautiful Japanese garden where you can view from the Garden lounge. A good way to start your day at breakfast. The service is excellent. Most of the restaurant stop taking order after 9pm. It would be great if this can be extended in particular to guests who have just flown in to the city.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We are the couple, frequently travel to Japan for holidays, whenever we arrive Tokyo, we must choose New Otani hotel at Akasaka as we like the hotel environment with gardens & spacious room set-up, convenient for travelling to Shinjuku, Ginza, Harajuku, Shubuya etc. The hotel services is excellent, always exceed our expectation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nicely located hotel and impressive big. I had to change rooms mid way so I can compare. The standard room had a nice size apart from the bathroom which was depressively small. The suite on the other hand had a fabulous bathroom. Both rooms came with the standard amenities. Hotel restaurants are quite expensive although the rotating rooftop restaurant is pretty impressive. There are however a lot of local restaurants in walking distance. The gym is functional but very small considering the size of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just completed my second stay at this hotel, first trip being in September 2015. Stayed for four nights this time.I was delighted with my previous stay; so much so that I very enthusiastically became a member of their New Otani Club (NOC). Didn't quite live up to expectations this time though.Though I booked the same category of hotel as last time, was given a room with a poor view. In fact half the window was blocked by a wall few feet away! Though this time I was staying for second time, and was a NOC member, not only was there no recognition of this, but my room could not be changed.Wifi kept on disappearing every time I returned to hotel. They were quick to send someone to fix it though.Slow and inefficient staff attended to me at check out. He seemed irritated that I wanted to pay partly by card, partly in cash.Noticed this time, rooms do need renovation...particularly the carpet. The room and bathroom size was most satisfactory though.In general, service quality is good. Location is excellent. Quiet area, but less than five minutes to the restaurant and bars area of Akasaka. 10-15 minutes taxi ride to the shopping district of Shinjuku.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were impressed during our 2 week stay. Room amenities include a fresh Yukata daily and Shiseido shower products. Good access to subways and the nearby Asakasa district for small after-hours restaurants and variety stores for inexpensive food items. The hotel has several expensive restaurants serving Western, Chinese and Japanese cuisine, as well as the very expensive Tour D'Argent (main branch Paris). The fitness facility is sparse and limited to treadmills and bikes although guests can access the Golden Spa which has an excellent pool and fitness equipment at an extra charge of between 3000-6000 yen per use. Staff are courteous and attentive- one morning I had discarded a broken umbrella into the trash can, and found it repaired upon my return!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Large hotel complex with a nice garden. But clearly past its heyday. Clean rooms but the toilet had an unpleasant lingering odour. The hotel is quite isolated and some distance away from the Akasaka night life.Staff are generally friendly and helpful. Multiple eating options. Skip the lobby restaurant for breakfast and head to the Tower Buffet with spectacular views from the 40th floor.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I noticed that no one includes photos of their rooms! In 3 visits we've had 3 rooms: huge, large and small. So small that when I opened up 2 suitcases we were stepping around slowly so as not to trip. Bathrooms were tiny, moderate and large. Go figure! Rooms really badic--4 star decor. But beds/pillows were comfortable and a/c works. Breakfast was always extra and quite costly. A buffet at one restaurant was $50 each. Lots to eat but expensive. Breakfast was always a challenge to get seated within 20 minutes! Also if you need to get going early to catch a morning flight home, be prepared to go hungry. Only one restaurant opens at 6 and the staff moves in slow motion! Disappointed that rooms did not have coffeemakers considering what we paid: $350+. Only kettle for instant coffee and only 1 powdered creamer packet! When I tried to get 2 oz. of milk, I was told to call room service and order it: for a charge of course.
