Lastly few of the staff truly speak more English other than a few memorized phrases! Otherwise I agree common areas of hotel are very nice and very close to metro system.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms are ok. A decent size and clean. The grounds and building are dark and dreary. There is nothing warm or welcoming about the staff either. All in all nothing special, and certainly not competitive, especially bearing in mind the location. The outside pool is 'seasonal'. And with a very short season - it is not open in mid-June, despite temperatures of 25-30 degrees for the week we were there. The inside pool is only 15 metres long. And you have to pay AN EXTRA £30 per person per swim! So for two of us, that would have added an extra £60 per day onto our already steep £200+ per night hotel bill. On the bookings sites through which this hotel is available, there are no suggestions of these charges, nor the fact that the outside pool is not open. When we asked staff for clarification on this and pointed out that they were miss-selling, they were very rude. We checked out early.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: If you want to stay in a hotel that is exactly like hotels in the US, this is not the place for you. I am an American and lived in Tokyo for many years. I'm writing from that perspective. The rooms are dated and a bit small, but very clean. The restaurants are quite good; what you'd expect at a nice hotel. The service is impeccable. I particularly like the women in kimono directing traffic at the main elevator. They serve no real purpose, but it makes the hotel seem exotic to a foreigner. The garden is superb. Easy to spend 30 minutes or more walking around. The pool and gym are quite minimal by western standards and only open during business hours. That's my biggest complaint. When I wake up at 3am jet lagged, I'd like to use the gym. I believe it doesn't open until 6 or 7. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to the subway, so it's easy to get around. If you are looking for a nice hotel that is more of a Japanese experience, I recommend the New Otani.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent stay. Friendliest hotel staff, very accommodating and great buffet breakfast. Plan to stay there again at my next trip in March 2017. One suggestion is to have tabs to put on the door to indicate do not disturb.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Here is all you can wish for a convinient stay in Tokyo: The rooms are clean, big and with all necessary items and equipment for feeling good and relaxed. There are many excellent, but somewhat pricy, restaurants in New Otani. Breakfast buffets in 3 different places - all fantatsic and with huge selections of everything for a good start of the day.. Cleaness everywhere. High service level from all staff. Pulsating life in the big common areas - lots of locals from Tokyo come to New Otani to take lunch, afternoon tea or dinner.Possible to stay in the Main or in The Tower. Both places excellent! We were in the Main and had a room on 14th floor with a fine view of Akasaka area,New Otani has also one of the most beautiful japanese gardens in Tokyo, and it is nice to stroll around here and enjoy the plants, the water arrangement with lots of Koi karps and the flowers. There is also a fine Rose garden on a roof.Excellent WiFi system included in the price and functions well everywhere in rooms and in the whole hotel.All in all it is a nice place and worth the money.Very close to Akasak Mitsuke metro station, so it is easy to get around in all Tokyo from here. However, the Akasaka Mitsuke area is anyway very lively and offer lots of shops and restaurants and entertainments.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Perfect location for sight seeings, restaurants and drinks. convenient access to Tokyo's main attraction. Easy access to subway. Good characters of hotel restaurants. Nice Japanese garden. Well trained employee.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: breakfast is a little too expensive but everything else is really nice. I had a room with a great view, water pressure in the shower was excellent, overall I would chose to stay here again for sure.service is exceptional. I understand its cultural but every employee is very polite and courteous. Bar on the 17th floor has a very good view. a very good choice of restaurants on the 1st level.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Can't fault the dining, not cheap but quite acceptable for the quality and the best established names : kaiseki at the Nadaman, Shabu Shabu at Okahan, Kyubei sushi, exquisite Italian at Bella Vista.(We didn't visit the Tour d'Argent this time). The coffee shop, especially the garden coffee shop has stunning views over the stunning ( and rare in Tokyo) gardens, though the food is OK. The pool and gym was tired and the rigamarole of Japanese gym/pool etiquette a little confusing and a little irritating, though enjoyable in a culturally curious way. The staff who attended to me couldn't have been more solicitous(it felt like my first day at school). The extra charge for pool/gym usage is quite normal in Japan( probably to keep tourists at bay.The regular members looked quite pleased with themselves.) However the hotel is going through a revamp, rather than a re-build for the 2020 Olympics, so should gradually perk up. But how does a hotel this size avoid package holidays and massive banqueting events? The members of staff are on the whole brilliant as to be expected in Japan, though one or two were obviously a little jaded. A boutique hotel it isn't, so don't expect it to be.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at New Otani for the 1st part of our Japan trip and it really was impeccable. The staff were simply the sweetest and most helpful at all times and we were made to feel like royalty. We were given an upgrade when we mentioned it was my birthday trip and the staff were kind enough to give us little treats. Air China had lost our luggage on our journey to Japan and the hotel staff were most helpful in giving my children baby toiletries and japanese robes for the whole trip. took plenty pictures in their japanese garden near the beautiful waterfall. lovely buffet spread for breakfast. near metro stations.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It was a return visit to the New Otani Hotel after nearly 30 years and the original impression of a quality venue was proven accurate. Although a very large hotel the New Otani manages to provide personal service at a high level, with professional and welcoming staff. Our room was spacious and provided all the usual creature comforts. The hotel has many restaurants to suit both taste and budget. We tried several and were always satisfied. We particularly enjoyed breakfast on the roof top with fantastic views of Tokyo city. The New Otani also has very attractive gardens to relax in away from the bustle of Tokyo.Within easy walking distance are a labyrinth of shops and restaurants and also access to the Metro and bus services.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Ideally placed for City tours. Very large hotel with Pleasant small garden. Good choice of restaurants on several floors. Buffet meal on top floor offers great views - especially at sunset - but avoid buying French wine with meal at over £65 A bottle!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I booked this hotel through a corporate deal and stayed 3 nights here. The room's very spacious with king bed, kind of classic and nice city skyline view. The bathroom looked a little tired however, a bit out of place with the rest of the room decoration.We took the limo bus straight from the Narita terminal 2 and arrived in front of the hotel. It was really convenient when traveling with kid and with many baggage. It took less than 90 minutes without major traffic (3-5pm). In Narita terminal 2, there were signs asking us to leave the baggage trolley before we went down to the bus terminal with elevator. It did not make sense and a lady told us to ignore it and we did. No one was complaining, even the guard. We took the same bus from the hotel to Narita airport, so baggage were handled all the way from the hotel room to the airport. This hotel is big, it joins with the garden tower and many dining options. Many Japanese came here for breakfast, brunch and afternoon tea. In the evening, there were also live music and also jazz.The garden is really nice and many huge Koi fish on the pond. They have an outdoor pool but it was closed when were there, maybe only for summer. The usage of the pool is not free I think, because I was offered to sign up for the free membership and that gave me access to the pool and late checkout at 1pm. I am not sure if they offer the membership to everyone or just because I was with the corporate they have deal with. The membership also gave me 30% discount on breakfast buffet and priority check-in / check-out.2 blocks from the hotel, there's a long street with restaurants and mini markets on both sides. Any Japanese foods you can think of, you can find it there. There were many expats hanging out there, so you can find other cuisines like Italian, French and Spanish here too. There is a fugu (blowfish) sashimi restaurant there too. We had okonomiyaki at a specialty restaurant called Botejyu on the second floor, which was really good. If you need to walk to the Yotsuya station, once you descend from the new otani hotel, climb the stairs to your left and it is a much better walk path with trees compared to the road side pedestrian walk.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: After almost ten years, I 'd the trip with my families staying in this hotel, is really makes us feel like home, rooms are spacious and clean and neat, well amenities.Breakfast in Tower building is wonderful, choices can satisfy everyone ! Also hotel is considerable for the smoker's guests.Sure I will be back for staying longer period of time to enjoy other facilities of the hotel such as pool, lounge and bars >Good experiences !

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very comfortable hotel, adjacent to metro 4 stops from Ginza. Large peaceful water garden, rooms are large and well-appointed and there are two good rooftop bars, one in the main hotel, one in the tower area. Lots of restaurants and shops in the hotel precinct. Exit from Tower reception leads to 2 busy streets full of bars and varied restaurants

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very large hotel within walking distance of the train station. Rooms are a good size with great veiws over the city. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but we did eat the evening buffet which was lovely although be aware that by 9 o'clock they are ready to pack up so you can feel a little rushed. Drinks as is normal in hotels are rather expensive so we tended to go out. The gardens are well worth a wander but can get quite busy, there is a pool at the hotel but a word of warning you have to pay extra for the use of it which when you are staying at the hotel we did find strange. All in all nice hotel friendly staff but it's very large.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great location. Located in a good area with plenty of restaurants and easy access to the subway. Although a big hotel the rooms are very comfortable with all amenities. Excellent service and attention to detail, although critical of the buffet breakfast in both the garden lounge and the tower restaurant. Was surprised by this.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is a Tokyo institution. It is a very large hotel, and is generally of very good quality. The service is good, if a little soulless. It does have some character, with many restaurants and shops incorporated into the site, and these are often quite pure Japanese. There is a lovely Japanese garden with spectacular water and koi. Some of the rooms have excellent city views - go for a high floor. The beds are comfortable with good linen, and the bathrooms are functional if somewhat basic.The revolving restaurant (17th floor, Main Tower) is well worth it - go early because the buffet shuts down at 9pm sharp (which is a shame - but a feature of this hotel is that it hasn't woken up to international life or the 21st century, and that is also part of its charm). Focus on the tempura bar, the sushi bar and the sweets.Breakfast is a complete shambles. One can easily wait for 20 minutes while the MC collects your tickets and fills out umpteen forms before he can allocate a table. When you finally get a table, if you haven't gone completely mad with the waiting, the breakfast is diverse and excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel is very large and appears to get a lot of wedding banquet interest. Most staff speaks English which is nice for travelers. Front desk staff is very service oriented which gives initial impression of a more luxury hotel but rooms and restaurants quickly show that this is a typical big city hotel. On site gardens are beautiful which is probably one of the draws for weddings.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Are well worth a visit. Simply stunning. Can't make any comment about the hotel as we only visited for a couple of hours to see the gardens. Biggest koi carp I have ever seen...and so many of them.Difficult to get to from nagatcho metro station, not sure if there is a quicker route?m

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: In the middle of this bustling city lies a wonderful refuge. This hotel, beside other ameneties has this magnificent Japanese garden. You can view it from the restaurant above but I recommend you go down one flight of steps and really enjoy it. Perfect for a wedding or honeymoon.
user_name:
Marc M
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here for a long weekend with family. The location was great and central to the subway and to many of the areas we visited in Tokyo. The hotel complex was large with lots of shops (pricey) and restaurants. The outdoor garden was beautiful and great for a stroll. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Friend and I were booked in as a tour group. We were placed in the old tower with small rooms, twin share. Apparently there is a new tower with much bigger and spacious rooms and probably more expensive. It is a very big, grand hotel of the old style. Lots of little boutiques hidden away. So many floors and shops and restaurants on lower levels, did not have time to see everything. The Japanese garden is amazing, spent at least 2 hours walking around and taking photographs. This hotel is not in the centre of the city but a short walk to the railway station and the trains are frequent. There are 2 big breakfast areas with great selections of Japanese and Western food. Treat yourself to this opulent hotel at least once. Lovely and helpful staff also.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My wife and I stayed here as part of a tour of Japan. It was Sikura blossom season and the walk under the cherry trees close to the hotel was just beautiful. Our room was very satisfactory though we didn't have a view of the wonderful gardens which the hotel has. The American style restaurant was lovely from breakfast. Other eateries within the hotel were very pricey, but there were several good restaurants within a few minutes walk. A very pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is huge - is an entire city in one place. So many restaurants and shops to visit. The hotel room was small [expected] but very nice - I had a huge window facing the Japanese garden that I could stare it for hours. Staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very large hotel in a great location. Felt very safe on the 17th floor of the 40 floor tower during two earthquakes. The restaurants were excellent. We were just a block from many restaurants and a very active night scene.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Can't say enough great things about The New Otani. Check in and check out a breeze. Great location to Royal Palace, Tokyo Tower, etc. Hotel has many restaurants and bars with superb views. The hotel garden is not to be missed. Room size more than ample with all the amenities. If you're interested in staying in Central Tokyo, The New Otani is your place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel was the first on my tour of Japan in Sept of 2015. It had several lobbies, wonder stores, and exceptional restaurants. It was built on the remains of a shogun palace so the 300-400 year old Japanese gardens were in tact. SO the views from some the restaurants were of the spectacular waterfall. After breakfast we saw many from our tour enjoying the gardens before we got on the bus.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: it is a big hotel with maze like passageway. once you became familiar of navigating it, its close to many subway stations. the room is small but who cares? you will stay there only to sleep during the night. the staffs can speak english and ABSOLUTELY helpful that you can trust your being to them on getting through tokyo. great organization and coordination by the staffs. you will think you are a visiting statesman. great hotel, great staffs, great location, and a must for Tokyo tourists and locals alike!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My experience has been very good over the 40 years I have stayed in this hotel. This hotel has all the amneties you need and I especially enjoy the beautifull Japanese garden.I tend to walk thru the garden every morning. Breakfast is good and also the buffet in the rotating restaurant on the 17th floor is excellent. I can recommend this hotel strongly to everybody.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is a great hotel, in size and in amenities. It is located very close to a metro station and in a major part of Tokyo. Our room was on the 4th floor, view wasn't that superior, how ever, it had every thing we needed. Free WiFi with good reception, Safe, mini bar, 2 complimentary bottles of water, the toilet and bathroom was large and there was enough room for our 2 very large suitcases. Staff were very friendly, polite and quick on the job. The concierge was very helpful in every aspect in helping us with our need if it was an umbrella we forgot in the room, or taking care of a package till our return in late evening from sight seeing. The only drawback I could find, and this has been stated by other reviewers, is the very long queue in the Satsuki dining room. On the average it took 15 minutes to wait till a table was cleared to serve us breakfast. And the meals? Divine. The buffet was diverse with Japanese style breakfast portions and European style. I tried everything they had to offer and enjoyed each morsel. In short, if I return to Tokyo, which I hope to some day, it'll be at the "New Otani". Thanks.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We returned to the New Otani after 10 years to new discoveries (Pierre Herme) and cherished favorites (the breath taking garden). By Tokyo standards, the guest rooms are spacious and we had a "real" king-size bed, not two twins pushed together. The service is polished, professional and unobtrusive. One morning we had a fast breakfast downstairs and when we returned, our room had been serviced. Bed and pillows were comfortable, room was quiet and had a partial view of the garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel is magnificent and offers every amenity. There are two towers with hundreds of rooms. The rooms are kept spotless by, almost, invisible house-keepers who visit each day and make them up.Each room is airy and bright with tremendous views from the upper floors.A very lovely place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This would be one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The rooms were very big (for Tokyo especially) . The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. The hotel itself is huge but the staff were able to treat each guest as special and were very friendly and welcoming. The highlight of the hotel is its garden. It was designed in the 17th century and when the hotel was built the design incorporated the established garden. It was an oasis of calm in the city and we walked in the garden each day. The garden is large enough to avoid anyone else, a luxury in such a busy city. The location of the hotel is superb, the nearest subway station is five minutes walk and has all of the main subway lines. It was nice to be in a relatively quiet neighbourhood but so accessible to anywhere in the city. There are lots of great local restaurants just past the subway station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Otani is a very large hotel with multiple receptions. Stayed in a good room, but not huge by western standards, on the 44th floor which had an express lift. Typical Japanese wetlav toilet which was fun. Limited tea/coffee facility in room. Tried the Garden Room overlooking the very pretty Japanese garden and waterfall for breakfast which was our preferred location and more relaxing than the Skybar restaurant. Food was good but neither opened until 7 am and with tours leaving the hotel at 8 am you needed to be in the queue by 6.45 am. Could get some snacks in the Garden Room in the evening but were a little on the expensive side. Same can be said for the Skybar, but you did get a great view of Tokyo at night. Hotel is a short walk from metro at Akasaka and two adjacent streets with plenty of good restaurants with English menus. Staff were all helpful and polite as you would expect. Good choice by our tour operator.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here for a short business trip to Tokyo. It is a good peaceful location with a wonderful serene Japanese garden. The hotel seems to cater mainly for large groups, and there is a big conferencing centre. This results in a long queue for the breakfast, and a bit of an impersonal feel. However the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the staff friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani has everything for the traveler: good rooms with comfortable beds, multiple restaurants, many shops including a convenience store, and a location close to the subway and the Akasaka restaurant area. Four restaurants have breakfast buffets and we found the Satsuki to be one of the best we ever tried. The business center has several computers available to hotel patrons. Be sure to spend some time in the beautiful Japanese gardens.Service was very good although English skills varied among the staff. The only glitch we found was that we had booked a room on our own and the next day were joining a tour staying for three nights. We not only had to change rooms but were supposed to check out of one at 12 and not into the other until 2. We finally got the time factor smoothed out but some other people did not. We probably should have arranged that when we checked in.Nevertheless I would strongly recommend the New Otani to the Tokyo traveler.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Went to Tokyo for our friend's wedding. Otani hotel was a good choice for 1st time traveller to Japan and wanna have a relatively central location and pampering service:) close to metro, close to an 'active' street called akasaka, having 2 alternative breakfast lounges within the hotel complex, especially one has a stunning japanese garden view. Very good support service, as almost a must have in Japan:)

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Was in Tokyo for business with large group. The New Otani is a beautiful hotel. Although it is older, it has a classic feel. The rooms were not large, but well-appointed with refrigerator and great amenities. The hotel staff are incredibly polite and pleasant. It's not often that hotels actually have elevator assistants! Speaking of the elevators, they were the fast and incredibly quiet. The location was perfect also -- great location to take a morning run. Also close to charming location with various restaurants and bars. Food at the breakfast buffets was amazing also.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It is a very big hotel ( really there are three in the same premises) . The room was quite good but there were problems at breakfast time. .At some moments there was a queue to take breakfast of more than 20 persons.It was not easy to have coffee or tea served to your table.The hotel must redefine the allocated space ( more rooms for it) and the staff for breakfast. Wonderful gardens

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Some people like hotels just for its location and only spend time there as a "home base" and little else. New Otani Hotel, the Main, is a place that has beautiful facilities, restaurants, and grounds.I spent four days there with family. Every day my daughter and I would walk the gardens. I even spent time walking around the neighborhood. It's not a place to shop, but decent in terms of outside restaurants to eat at when you don't want to be in the hotel. The main seems to be more exclusive than the garden tower. The services and concierge are top notch. The food -- we at breakfast every day while there -- was unbelievably expansive in its selection. The room was huge. We had a King bed and an additional bed for our child. The King Bed could easily have slept 3 adults or 2 adults+2 children. It was huge. The view was nice, though we were on the back side of the hotel.Only on the last night did we venture up to the 360 degree rotating restaurant. If only we saw it earlier. We were spending every night out eating fantastic dinners, but would have liked to have eaten there. Instead, we just went for drinks and the lovely ambiance.If you want a hotel that allows you the leisure to remain on the premises, this is the place for you.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in New Otani Hotel in the main lobby for 3 nights during our trip to Japan in April of 2016.the room was in the 4th floor. The room was very spacious,furnishing was very functional but aesthetic and pleasant.The bathroom was spacious and had Shisedo toiletries.The staff everywhere was just wonderful! Always helpful.pleasant and with a nice smile.if we had a lot of shopping, they would run right to us and take the bags to our room.we ate dinner twice in the Japanese and in the Chinese restaurant. The Japanese food was wonderful with 5 star service and great plum wines. The Chinese restaurant on the 16 th floor had a wonderful view of the nighttime Tokyu illumination, however the food was average. the patisserie shop by Pierre Hermes was just out of the world! Must try the melon cake( from melons grown in the hot springs with Abril of 14).everyone was just so helpful.when we return to Tokyo, we will definitely stay in New Otani again. Thanks to everyone in New Otani for the wonderful Stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is very well located, comfortable. A sort of classic place to stay in Tokyo, not very likely to have a bad stay here. I have visited at least 3 times over the years and it is always a go-to place unless, I need to stay in a different part of town.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my first visit to Tokyo and fell in love with the place instantly. The hotel is massive with multiple sections and maybe around 15 restaurants. Huge spread at the buffet breakfast. Their Japanese garden is amazing and at breakfast be sure to grab a window table overlooking the garden.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is large and there are various accommodation areas which at first is confusing. We were in the Garden Tower. The room was very good with all you would expect, clean and tidied every day with a great view of the City. There are many restaurants in the hotel but we used only the Garden Tea room which did an excellent breakfast and stylish afternoon tea. It is very easy to walk from the hotel to a multitude of restaurants nearby, great fun and to the Akasakamitsuke Metro.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Easy access to all parts of the city - excellentt buffet breakfast - good jogging close by - and comfortably sized rooms for family vacation. Definitely recommend. And review wants 200 characters but not much else to say but does have outdoor pool also if there in the summertime - now maybe at 200!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is Japanese Omotenashi Service at its best. The New Otani has always been one of my favorite hotels to stay in Tokyo for its great location and easy access. Its popularity is evidenced by the large crowd of customers. Still, the staff at the New Otani manage to provide personal attention and service unmatched by other more expensive properties. The highlight of our trip was when the bell lady helped us with our bags to the taxi and ran back in to grab two umbrellas because of the rain. We were already happy with our stay but this attention to detail to the very last step out of the hotel is what makes us happy to return to the New Otani each time we return to Tokyo. Wonderful!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights as our base for exploring Tokyo with my partner and 2 boys, aged 4 and 6. The location is perfect, the very easy to use, tourist friendly Metro line is a short walk from the hotel to Akasakamitsuke. (As a note for fellow travellers it doesn't really matter where you stay in Tokyo as long as it's close to a Metro station as it's super efficient and safe).The hotel is enormous, a top class international (soulless) hotel. Could have been anywhere in the world, apart from the amazing outside gardens. Everything from the check in to the concierge to the room was as you would expect from a 5 star international hotel. Professional, super efficient. Not very personal. Perfect if you're a business traveller on expenses as the incredible choice of restaurants were very expensive (Tour d'Argent, Trader Vics etc). One of the main reason I booked the hotel though was so my boys could have a swim in the mornings/ early evenings. To be informed the swimming pool is not for Under 18's and with a hefty charge for adults to use the pool to me is scandalous. Every 5 star hotel I have ever stayed in includes fee use of a swimming pool for all ages at no extra cost. The facilities to gain 5 star status is that it has a pool right?? Well not if you're under 18 at the Hotel New Otani.So I leave the hotel feeling I've been misled and disappointed. My rating of average is based on feeling misled and my boys not being able to have a swim. The hotel and its staff would otherwise get a 4 star, very good rating.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a fabulous hotel with multiple shops and restaurants on offer. The staff and service were excellent. The only negative is the additional charge to use the gym and pool, the rate is charged per person per use which worked out around £25/30. Overall we had a wonderful time and would most likely stay here again

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We loved our stay at the New Otani Hotel. It is a very big hotel with many buildings situated in the heart of the city. The rooms were decent sized and very well furnished with great views. We loved the 'Shishiedo' toilet accessories and the design of the toilet where WC was separate from the shower. They had some amazing restaurants and room service that we tried. The roof top bar is also awesome for a drink. Would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and I very much enjoyed it. While the room is pretty much standard, nothing fancy, the room size is big enough and equipped with what is needed. You have 4 choices of restaurant for breakfast according to your taste and various choices for lunch / dinner. Had dinner at the Teppanyaki restaurant inside the Japanese garden - it was gorgeous !Highly recommendable hotel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Had a room overlooking the garden which was great, altho we were offered a better room for a fee on arrival. We had 2 nights and our room gave us everything we wanted. Staff were excellent throughout.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed 3 nights at the New Otani, Tokyo. It is a remarkable facility, with a dazzling array of shopping and dining options. Close to the city centre and train stations, it's has acres of stunningly beautiful gardens within the hotel precinct. However, this is an expensive hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We loved the spacious and very comfortable room for our family, it is big by Japanese standards, with modern decor and furniture. We stayed in the Main hotel.The service provided by their staff (check-in,cleaning, concierge, in-room dining) was top of the line and we felt comfortable and welcomed throughout our stay. I especially loved the Shiseido bath products which were a perfect luxurious touch.The location worked out very well, we used Akasaka-mitsuke metro station - a 3-5 minute walk from the Hotel to the entrance to the station. From there, it was 4 stops to Tokyo station, where one can catch connecting Shinkansens on the JR. Don't miss the 'Sandwiches and Sweets' buffet at the Garden Lounge Restaurant in the hotel. The exquisiteness, quality and variety of the selection available will satisfy anyone! You cannot make a reservation and guests start lining up to get the tables with the best view of the beautiful garden from 11am - the buffet starts at 11:30am. We got there at 11:25am and we were provided the high table - one of the last few seats in the restaurant. The garden/ park of the Hotel is beautiful, serene and an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo - it has been in existence in one form or another since 1600s. it is worth a wander and you may spot a bridal couple having their pictures taken.We would certainly stay at the New Otani Tokyo when we make another trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel is really large but well organised and efficient . All Staff we encountered were really pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. We had a room in the Garden Tower. It was a good sized room ,very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The view from our room was of Tokyo tower.We had a meal in one of the many restaurants ,which was quite expensive but good quality and very enjoyable. It is well worth a walk in the Hotels Japanese garden , it is very beautiful, peaceful and serene.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I started travelling to Asia for business back 2003. My first hotel I ever stayed at in Tokyo was the New Otani. Recently I had the pleasure of returning. For an old hotel it is still provides a pleasurable stay. It's a large hotel and can be difficult to navigate when heading outside yet the location is fantastic. Short walk to several shops in Akasaka not to mention all the various places to eat/entertainment. Take your jogging shoes, you'll be running around the Imperial Palace in under 10 minutes.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Enormous room with excellent city views. Loved the massive bathroom and walk in wardrobes. Huge, comfortable bed. Friendly service. My only complaint is that many of the restaurants in the complex closed very early (8.30pm). Excellent location close to two subway stations.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Amazing Japanese Garden. Stayed here with a few friends and everyone loved the place. Very clean rooms, staff very helpful and polite. Coffee in the hotel very expensive ($12 for espresso) but I guess you get that with a lot of hotels. All in all a great stay!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We arrived at this hotel at about 10:00 am, expecting that our room would not be ready since our check-in time was at 2:00 pm. We were very pleased to find that a room was available for us; and that we would not need to wait around till 2:00 pm!The room was excellent, rather spacious for Tokyo standards. Very comfortable, sufficient space, and all amenities / inclusions were of a high quality. The staff at the front desk, and the travel desk were very helpful and polite, and they assisted us with making our bookings for day trips around Tokyo. The breakfast buffet was slightly above average; and the only negative in a perfect stay. The service at the breakfast restaurant was top-notch; but the range of food was a bit limited. Location-wise, this is a short 5 min walk to two subway stations; and in the center of the city.For people who may want to eat-in, the hotel had about 8 or 10 restaurants on the premises. Plus a great Japanese garden view from the breakfast area.If in Tokyo again, I would definitely consider staying here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the New Otani. The rooms were a good size for being in Tokyo. The bed was comfortable and the amenities (restaurant, shops, gardens, etc.) were very nice. In my opinion, the best part of the hotel is its location. It is very close to two subway lines and fairly centrally located. It was a breeze to jump on and get anywhere in Tokyo in a matter of minutes.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is amazing. The staff is very courteous and professional. There are different room sizes and I have stayed in three different sizes. I have had no issues with any of the rooms or the service within the hotel. It's within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and bars. Walking distance to the subway entrance.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Its a truly pleasant hotel , also a huge hotel with two distinct parts to it and over 10 restaurants. Trying the garden cafe is a must. Breakfast in main restaurant. Service is great, fast and efficient, and offcourse as common in japan very cordial. Its has a spa and pool but didnt try them out.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Clean comfortable convenient matched all my expectations. A great place to stay when we travelled all over Japan on a conducted tour with Riviera Travels. As a large group of friends couples and singles, middle aged and elderly, we were very well looked after. The usual Japanese courtesy and smiles are standard and noticeable. Food was excellent as there were several varieties to choose and the restaurant catered to palates from all over the world. We had vegetarians amongst us and we were equally happy.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I don't remember exact day of my stay in this hotel but probably 4-5 years ago... With my business partners we stayed in this hotel for a week and had a great time there.. Very close to streets with many cafes and restaurants and social places, and there is a beautiful garden within hotel territory... in short its a great place to stay for business or family stay!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel, nice and hospitality staffs. Very clean and spacious room. The hotel is huge comprise of 3 main sections. We stay in the Main Section. The walk to the nearest subway station is about 10mins walk, however the scenery is nice.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is located in Akasaka, within the range from Akasaka/ Roppongi where you could easily go sightseeing or play all night. The hotel is located within magnificent garden once owned by Samurai Lord. What I suggest is to take a walk in this garden, have great cuisine from variety of Japanese, Chinese or notorious French Restaurant　(La Tour d'Argent). My wife liked cake and bread of SATSUKI. I stayed in the room at Tower, but it seems that The Main is more elegant, has more spacious rooms. People were rather formal than friendly.赤坂や六本木へのアクセスの良さもありますが、それ以上にホテル内で楽しめることも多いと思います。かつて加藤清正の屋敷跡だった庭園の散歩や、トゥールダルジャンをはじめ各レストランも充実。最近はSATSUKIのケーキやパンも評価が高いようで、妻は食べる価値があったと喜んでいました。今回タワーのお部屋でしたが、メインの方が落ち着きがあり、部屋も広めとお聞きしました。スタッフの方はどちらかといえばフォーマルで、フレンドリーな方は少ない感じでした。

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in Tokyo and I would say that the hotel was very clean and service was good. We had the buffet breakfast which was very good. The garden is lovely, and it is close to the Subway. I am not sure it was the closest to the tourist area's but once you are on the Subway you can go anywhere. We were a family of 4, and needed rooms beside one another, check in service was great - and facilities were also excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very good hotel in an excellent location. Only 15-20 minutes from Haneda airport by cab. Limousine bus service is also available during daytime hours. I've stayed here a few times mow and found the service very consistent on each visit. All staff members are very helpful if needed. The rooms are a good size and spotlessly clean. This is a huge hotel with an attached shopping plaza which also includes a grocery store, convenience store, pretty much anything you need. The grounds are beautiful, nice just to wander the Japanese garden and de-stress after a long day of meetings. The business center is second to none. I lost my business card case and had to get new cards in a hurry. One hour later I was good to go with a perfect replica of my cards.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Bit of a late review, stayed for a week a year ok & loved it. Our room was huge & we found the location itself was great for exploring. Very close to subway and easy to get to wherever you need to go. Hotel is a little outdated but we found it very clean & the staff were fantastic. We loved the yakatori restaurant. Will be back to stay soon.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Famed for its beautiful Japanese garden at the base of the original tower, this hotel is classic. Big rooms, exceptional service and a great breakfast service in the iconic round dining room saucer shaped room at the top. You can see all of Tokyo central from here. Great memories here. Expensive and a bit dated but worth it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Fab rooms which were a good size which is rare in Japan. We were upgraded to a deluxe twin so it was even larger. Very clean. Huge hotel you can get lost in which I did at one point. Full of shops and restaurants. I was here for business and leisure. Near station so easy to get around and to airport (3mins to station). Would stay here again. Very friendly and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is located at the convenience place with spacious environment, staff are always providing a high-level Japanese cultural manners, they are very friendly and willing to help. The food served in each restaurant is at high quality & tasteful. We have enjoyed our stay in this hotel, this is the only hotel for our stay whenever we are in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I could not find any fault with this. Location is great and they do have many restaurant within the building itself that cater to different types of food. Breakfast voucher even allows you to choose from 3 different restaurant or you can use them for lunch as well.Room are speck and clean, beds and pillow to my liking.And needless to say, I receive excellent services from the staffs there.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed there for 4 nights and surely book it again for my next stay there. A central location, has access to many metro stations and 5-10 minutes walk to the main Akasaka streets where plenty of restaurants, shops and other places can be found. The room was excellent, stayed on the 7th floor and it was an upgraded room with extra space, very nicely decorated and styled with great amenities.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I visited Tokyo, Japan in the second week of December 2015, and stayed in this hotel. This hotel is located at Akasaka area and is 10 minutes away from the nearest Subway. About 200m of the walk from the hotel to the subway is not sheltered, so you will have seek shelter and wait for the rain to stop, as it did rain twice during my stay there. The hotel is famed for its gardens, which were part of an Edo era mansion. This garden was preserved and integrated into the hotel development. It opened in 1962 and hosted its first guests who came for the Tokyo Olympic Games.The hotel is huge with an old wing and new wing. I stayed in the old wing. Room-wise, its spacious. We had 3 single beds, as we went as a family. Room décor-wise, it’s a little dated, with peach colored wallpapers and flowery carpets. However the room is clean and well-maintained. My hotel room has a big window which afforded us a good view of the garden. Just beyond the hotel property is a huge property reserved for the Japanese Imperial family’s use.They have several restaurants, some on the 5th floor, some at the top of the hotel, which overlook the gardens. As it was winter, the leaves were yellow and red and when the winds blew, the leaves were blown off the branches and it was a beautiful sight.Nearby are two long streets that have many eateries so you can pop into for a meal. There is also an electronics store – Best Denki nearby. My only peeve is the lack of a proper supermarket to browse and get daily necessities.A nostalgic hotel to stay in.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a great place to stay. Room has generous space and very comfortable. Staff are friendly and always helpful.Restaurants have good options and more than enough to satisfy one's appetite.Please visit the beautiful Japanese garden and stay awhile to feel nature. With waterfall, koi fish swimming, birds chirping and fresh smell of nature ...it's a sanctuary.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I regularly stay at the New Otani because the location is conveniently central for business meeting, yet it is surrounded by lovely green spaces, especially the 400 year-old garden with waterfall easily seen from the main dining room. Comfortable rooms, too.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent 7 nights staying at the New Otani, on the 6th floor of The Main.My room was not tired nor dated like some other reviewers, but relatively rather sleek and modern. My king size bed was wider than it was long (great for me, as my feet usually hang off the end!). Room was very spacious and comfortable.The breakfast was varied - I ate in two different locations during my stay, with both having some similar offerings and some different.The one area of disappointment I found was the exercise facilities. Being unwilling to stump up the large charge for the in-house spa, the 'workout room' was woefully inadequate. In The Main tower it consisted of a treadmill or two, couple of bikes, a cross trainer and some sort of leg machine. There was another in the Garden Tower that I didn't look at, though a friend advised it was equipped much the same. As this was my first time in a hotel in Asia, I don't know if this is the norm, however in Scandinavia where I travel regularly I have had no problem in locating hotels that also provide access to local and very well-equipped gyms (if they don't already have one themself).Service was very good - probably about what I expected, but I was surprised at how visible the service actually was...not sure a hotel in Europe would bother with so many people standing around waiting for something to do!All told, pretty good, but the ability to train well while I'm travelling is rather important to me. I'd look for alternatives that provide better facilities in that regard if travelling to Tokyo again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. I loved the Japanese garden. The variety and number of restaurants was amazing. The hotel provided cotton sleeping kimonos for use as a guest. The room was very clean and comfortable. I ate most of my meals in the various restaurants- all were good.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very very large characterless hotel with tired décor and dim lighting which made it feel a bit depressing. It badly needs updating. It was quite hard to find where the various restaurants were and quite a long walk between them. The hotel incorporates many shops and function rooms and so is used for business meetings a lot. The room was quiet and the bed and pillows comfortable. Good free WiFi and a power socket in the bedside table. There was varied choice at the breakfast buffets but the food was barely warm and the bread and croissants were stale the second day I had breakfast (and the croissants cut in half). There is a Japanese Garden which is very pleasant to have a walk through. The Airport Limousine (at least to Narita) picks up from the hotel and takes just over an hour for the journey which is handy. The best bit about the hotel was the staff, they were unfailingly helpful and polite.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my first hotel on my first visit to Japan in late October 015 [ part of Riviera Tour ]The New Otani is probably the largest hotel I've ever stayed in. Built originally for the 64 Olympics . it was extended via the addition of the Garden Tower which initially makes finding your way around not the easiest.The quality of the hotel soon asserts itself ,with lush carpets and very helpful staff . Rooms are spacious , nicely decorated with comfortable beds , Good sized bathrooms with a high tec loo which warranted a photo.4 restaurants avilable , dinner quite expensive but an excillent breakfast [ included ] in huge restaurant overlooking the hotels 400 year old garden , a true rarity in the city.The hotel is well located [ 45 mins from Haneda Airport ] and close to subway station and many shops , restaurants/bars.TIP,,, Always use Garden Tower nentrance if on foot for local faclities NOT the car park entrance .....a very long way round.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great service, beautiful gardens - hotel a little dated but immaculately clean and the breakfast was fantastic! The hotel staff were extremely helpful - managing to locate my daughter's missing glove during our stay and also kept a set of headphones for us which we left in the room after check out! Good location near the subway.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is my first trip to Japan and this hotel is amazing. The staff is friendly and helpful, the property is well maintained and beautiful. There is so much to do here at the hotel I am sure I won't experience it all. The (comp) breakfast this morning was delicious. the view of Mt Fuji out my window is a nice touch. Really great choice if your coming to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani Hotel, while large is quite easy to get around. We were on the 7th floor and had a lovely view. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The staff was quite friendly and helpful with every request we made. We ate on the top floor buffet in the tower for each breakfast and some dinners and the food was some of the best we have ever had. Dinner was a little pricey but well worth the money.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 days , i like this hotel because near the train , nice breakfast ( try the 40 floor and garden view ) , very clean hotel , the room is big enough and there are some store ( drug store , clothes , etc )Very recommended hotel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We go back to the New Otani mainly because of the gorgeous Japanese garden and views (including the 40th floor buffet breakfast restaurant). The location is central, service excellent, rooms are quiet and price is competitive. We enjoy the fact that it is a big hotel, spread over 2 towers, with a lot of activity -- a real part of Tokyo life.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms are very big and the beds are comfortable. Staffs are friendly. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast has a lot of choices! Very nice! However, the heater is too hot for our standard. I can't adjust the temperature to the one I want. I felt hot and couldn't sleep well for the entire night.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: As with most things in Japan the service is perfect. Gym was very clean and well stocked with towels and water. Staff were good and helpfull. only bad point would be the room are not the biggest I've had in Japan.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Big hotel, lots of people. We stayed here as my family always came to this hotel whenever they visited Japan. Beautiful garden. Staffs were helpful.Breakfast is really too expensive even with the 20% discount, so we didn't take it.The room was clean and comfortable. good amenities. Hotel located within walking distance from subway station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Amazingly beautiful several-hundred-year old garden makes this a destination. The hotel is large and busy, and can be confusing to the first time visitor, but the staff are incredibly helpful. The restaurants in the garden serving steak, foie gras and seafood are worth the experience. The daily breakfast buffet at the Satsuki has a great variety with plenty of Western, Japanese and even Chinese food options.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my third stay at the New Otani, for 7 nights as part of a business trip. Both stays have been previously reviewed here. This third stay was a mixed bag: the room booked was a Main Deluxe like our last stay, but the room proved less upscale, although there was also a slight difference in price (lower). This would suggest some variability within a given room type, which is consistent with the different web site pictures, yet also makes booking a bit of a random exercise. The Hotel would not accept charging to a Travel Agent's credit card, which is frankly annoying: most hotels in Tokyo accept this (e.g. Cerulean), and the last time it happened to me was with a very modest business hotel in Nagoya, and quite some time ago. Again check-in policy was rather inflexible, a bit difficult to fathom for a Hotel of that size. Otherwise good service throughout, Japanese (high) standards. As stated above, the room was not as upscale as other Deluxe rooms, but still equivalent to a Junior suite in many hotels, with a small seating area and sofa. However, in that configuration it was almost impossible to watch TV whilst lying in bed, a bit unfriendly to the jet lagged traveller. Spacious bathroom, with bathtub as well as shower cubicle, and Shiseido toiletries. Free wi-fi and in-room safe. There are several fitness options, but only one is free and has a very limited choice of weight machines (actually only one leg machine!). We used dry cleaning, which strangely declined some items due to them containing silk.Good location, with Akasaka restaurants within walking distance (this does not change of course).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I got a deal on this hotel from Jetsetter.com - but the room looked nothing like the ones that are posted. The hotel seemed more run down than the pictures revealed. It's close to a main metro line and was easy to get to Shinjuku and other districts. The gardens and Koi pond were pretty to walk around in but I wouldn't make it a destination.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The service is very good in every area, porters, concierge, and the waiting staff in each restaurant. We ate in six - there's about 12 in all. The food was exceptional and a good reason for choosing to stay here. Another good reason is the very easy access to the metro. However, you pay a lot extra to use the spa and swimming pool (a lot!) And some areas could do with freshening up.
user_name:
Alison B
East Midlands, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The only disappointment is that we didn't book with breakfast. Expedia doesn't offer room inclusive of breakfast.Breakfast is really too expensive ( 3920 JPY for an adult , around 33$).But if you're foreigner, you can register their membership for free and access to breakfast for 50% of the price. That's good but only for foreigner The room was great and accommodate 4 people ( 2 adults and 2 kids).A pity that we could hear our neighbor.Hotel located 3 min walk from subway station. Marounouchi Line. Once you get used of Tokyo Subway, it is an excellent solution to visit Tokyo.Taxi are unaffordable to visit Tokyo.....Plenty of restaurants in a busy nightlife area around 5 minutes walk. Very good restaurants and really good price.As usual, you feel safe in Japan.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was in a business trip to Japan, new Otani is one of the biggest hotels you can visit ever with high level of quality, hospitality and facilities. It is a true modern Japanese experience, where technology mixed with modern architecture and natural touch. they have one of the most wonderful Japanese gardens you well ever see. Facilities and amenities in the room are amazing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani Hotel in Tokyo has one of the most spectacular garden in Tokyo. Excellent stay for both business & vacation. In addition, the room are very big in Tokyo term & very clean. Hi speed Wifi & newspaper are available free of charge. Lots of hotel restaurant & coffee/tea places for your need. Definitely give it an excellent recommendation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Only had a few days here sadly but with it being in fall the leaves were changing, the weather was near perfect, the food was fantastic, the hospitality was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Did I mention the food, the breakfast buffet was excellent and a splurge at the garden grill (literally in the middle of the garden) for a Kobe Steak dinner was absolutely worth it, can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My stay at the New Otani was a very good one. The hotel is very well located allowing for easy access to the Metro. The staff are all very polite and service orientated and have a good command of English.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It would be difficult to find another hotel in Tokyo that offers so much for a reasonable accomodation price. We stayed more than 7 nights and booked the extended stay rate - really worthwhile. Also worth joining New Otani club if staying less than 7 nights (don't get much for longer stays). Breakfast and restaurants can be pricey but this is Tokyo!Overall really enjoyed our stay in a Main Deluxe Room.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Although this is a reputable hotel, attention to detail is limited. The pillows needed updating along with other small details. The staff were attentive. Gardens were very pretty but the confusion caused by the many entrances of the hotel is a little irritating to say the least. The Otani in Osaka is much higher quality and much more modern in decor.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very good hotel.I am only critical for 2 things: the pillows are like bricks.and there is only a bathtub,no shower.Well maybe one small detail-bathtowels are very small.Staff very polite and speaks excellent english.I recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My partner and I stayed at new hotel otani Tokyo for 6 nights and it was lovely - beautiful gardens, staff were so polite. Room was nice but a little dated compared to others I have seen within the premises. Great location with the station a short walk away and a buzzing strip of great eateries and bars nearby. It was not clarified to me that a withholding charge would be taken, which was more than an our actual stay plus additional charges! I had to call and find out what was going on, which I wasn't too impressed about. In future it would be nice to be informed of the holding charge since there's nearly $3,000 frozen (that's a sizable sum!)Otherwise loved our stay and would return!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is very well run with immaculate service all round. This time, rather unusually, I stayed in the Main building and was a little disappointed with the room size. Other than that everything was again, as one would expect.... excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have been staying this hotel since 1983 although I stay at other hotels in Tokyo. Since I was born in Japan, I feel that I am back to Japan in comparison with other Western hotels such as Hyatt and Four Seasons.Since they renovated the upper floors for Zen, I stay more frequently than before. The room is clean and new. Bed is very comfortable. The lounge is convenient.....There are more than 20 restaurants inside the hotel, Western, Japanese and Chinese. I do not need to go out for dinner. They have the post office, barber, bank ATM, pharmacy, convenience store, etc.They provides me with great services.
user_name:
M M
Los Altos Hills, California

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Clean and spacious rooms. Free WiFi was fast. We had a good view of the adjacent Japanese garden from our room. The staff is knowledgeable and helped us with our sightseeing.The breakfast buffet has a wide variety of both Japanese as well as international cuisine. We preferred the Satsuki restaurant though we could use our breakfast vouchers in other restaurants as well.Walking distance from Yotsuya station on the JR trains and Akasaka mitsuke station on the metro line.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: First stay at New Otani in TokyoClean and stylish roomExcellent breakfast with the most tasty croissant Very humble and service minded staffGood location near the emperor palaceMany restaurants to chooseDid not have time to exploit the beautiful garden

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: As with most Japanese hotels the staff are very helpful and can't do enough for you ,the rooms are very spacious and modern my only complaint is that most rooms smell of smoke as smoking is still big in Japan.This hotel is really big which you might not realise if you come in at the lower level there is a whole parade of shops on the lobby level.Slightly disappointed that the sky bar shuts at 11:00pm I can't understand why such a great place like that would close so early.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Clean and comfortable Room, very good High Speed Internet available everywhere, excellent staff.A walk in the Japanese Garden is very relaxingBreakfast Buffet very good and delicious. Bar in The Main is quite good; in Garden Tower I would recommand some Renovation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: There is a airport limousine bus running from Narita to the hotel. The location is convenient but not a shopping area. On the Zen floor, there are different snacks and drinks available at different time, very quiet and nice view. Rooms are comfortable and I like the tap of the bath tub that can fill up the water quickly for bathing. As a guest of the Zen floor, can choose to have breakfast in different restaurants of the hotel and enjoy the Golden Spa facilities without extra charge.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Prior to visiting Tokyo, I contacted ten hotels in the price range of AUD 250-400 about securing a ticket for the sold-out sumo grand final. Only four hotels responded and of those four, only the Otani was able to provide the desired ticket. Service is what sets hotels apart and the Otani outshone their 'competition' in that regard. In addition, the Otani concierge staff were exceedingly patient and helpful in advising me where I could view Fugu being prepared, access excellent restaurants, embrace Japanese culture and most importantly, navigate the Tokyo public transport systems, both of which were within easy walking distance.All staff were exceedingly polite and the hotel and my room were spotless. The reception and concierge staff spoke English, so I'm uncertain who other reviewers were speaking to.I do have two small complaints, especially given the room price. First, there was only one English channel, with channels such as BBC News and CNN dubbed over in Japanese. Second, although the shower had curtain hooks, it had no curtain.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: An exceptional hotel complex conveniently located close to the main attractions in Tokyo and a two minute walk to the Akaska-mitsuke subway line. The hotel has a beautiful Japanese Garden complete with a large waterfall. Extraordinary! It has numerous restaurants all serving great buffet breakfasts, including a mixture of Western and Japanese. We tried three of the breakfast locations, Satsuki, Top, and Garden Lounge. Satsuki provided the broadest choices and the Top is an exceptional location on a clear morning; however, we liked the Garden best as it overlooked their extraordinary garden. The location can be confusing at first as it is a large complex with three towers and is situated on a slope, so they have two lobbies and neither are on the ground floor. There are also several shopping floors below the towers, so lots to do and many restaurants. The restaurants within the hotel complex are quite expensive compared to the restaurants just a five minute walk away south of the subway station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is placed within a shopping and office complex and unless you arrive by car or taxi it can be a bit difficult to actually find the lobby. It seems that hotel is mostly use by japanese and there can be a language barrier with the staff, but they are as all japanese very very helpfull and service minded. The hotel have rooms facing a beautiful garden, but we got one on the other side. These rooms face a parking lot so you'll most likely never pull the curtains away. On the top floor there is a circular restaurant that turn to views from all sides. There is also a bar within the circle, but this doesn't turn. There should be a pool within the hotel, but the hotel felt more like a shopping or congress center so we never spent any time there appart from sleeping (we might have with better views, so if you can get the views it will be a different experience). The next time I go to Tokyo I will find a hotel in another part of the city and make sure it have better views, but if you like to be a bit away from everything and can get a room with a view I think this hote would be nice.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my first visit to japan. My visiting dates were from 10th october till the 15th. I stayed in the deluxe room in hotel new otani. My room was in the main wing. The service of the hotel staff was exquisite. The staff was very helpful in guiding me in every way they could about the where abouts. Although the hotel is pricey but it was absolutely worth it. The hotel garden is something to die for. Try getting a room with the view of the garden. The breakfast The rooms were very comfortable and the bathrooms were excellent. All in all, I would love to come back here whenever i get the opportunity to do so.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: One of the most comfortable hotels we stayed in. Great service, great staff and great organisation skills. We will visit again. Especially as the art and shops around are fascinating and very inspiring. The staff who cleaned our room - exceptional!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I spent few night in Tokyo for business and I found this hotel a good solution. Very nice rotating restaurant on the top, a little bit outdated keys to access the rooms, that are owe ear very nice and spacious.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a free upgrade to a junior suite, the staff were always very polite and helpful. The views were stunning. The bars were a bit overpriced, but the revolving restaurant at the top of the main tower is worth a glass of champagne as a treat. Overall it was not a cheap stay and probably for 3 nights we did not have time to make the most of the facilities and the grounds, but location was good, convenient to get to multiple subway stations. I would not hesitate to book again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Was recommended this hotel from a friend. After travelling for 26 hours we were shown to our room for 3 people by a lovely man. However, room was very dated and small- I was disappointed so decided to complain. After being told they were fully booked was given a suite 1 floor down from our original room- did wait 1 hour but it felt like we were in a different hotel. This was kind of them but the beds are very hard and we didn't sleep for the 3 nights we were there!! 400 year old garden is lovely as well as the staff. It's a traditional hotel but I wouldn't stay again because of the beds!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a nice hotel in Tokyo, but the rooms are quite dated. The bed was comfortable, and the toilet seat was quite nice. There was WiFi included in the price of the room and I reserved the option that included continental breakfast. The breakfast was very good, but if you want to get in anytime soon, you need to get up there at least 15 minutes before they open. Otherwise, you're going to be waiting a good 30 - 45 minutes before you get a seat. Great views of downtown Tokyo and the Imperial Palace.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I am a Brit born in Tokyo and returning over 30 years later I stayed in the Hotel New Otani. I can only say that the staff and service of the New Otani was nothing less than welcoming. The Japanese garden with its water features made a romantic setting for a traditional Japanese wedding during my stay and this was a beautiful experience. The hotel is central to all travel routes and the whole of the city and a great base for visiting the temples/palaces of the city. Thank you to the Hotel for our great stay and I hope to return soon . Thank you

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my second stay at the New Otani. The rooms are very nice, and the staff are excellent. The hotel is conveniently located in central Tokyo, making it easy to get to and from all major neighborhoods. The breakfast was excellent! Also, the Narita Airport Limousine bus stops at this hotel, making it convenient to get to and from the airport.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at this hotel quite some time back during my business trip. Had a very big bathtub and the room is very very big. Of course the price was also quite expensive. I remembered that during that time, i paid about 24000 yen for 1 room. It was selected because it was about 5 mins walk to my Tokyo office. Nonetheless, the area is also near to Yotsuya station where you can find lots of convenience stores and restaurants. =)

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights. Originally booked the garden tower but we're shocked with how old and smelly the rooms were, ended up upgrading to the main for 7000 yen per night extra. The hotel is an old, glamorous combination of a Japanese hotel, Las Vegas resort and Wes Anderson's "grand Budapest hotel", so it's both strange and bigger than life.. Hard to explain. Don't think we will be returning but this was defiantly an old world stylish and classy experience to take part in. If you're up for it, then the hotel is recommended, just make sure not to stay in the old garden tower that has not been renovated for over 30 years

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Welcome @ check-in is ok. Standard rooms have a very nice large bay window, the size of the entire room, which is really nice. Even on the Yotsuya side (parking), you have a nice view. Room size is comfortable.Headlamps in the room were stained, which is quite disappointing.Breakfast was offered at several restaurants throughout the complex. Went to the one on the lobby floor "Satsuki". Food is good, but service is essentially made by trainee, or not that-friendly staff.Location is great, with 4 stations around, and the Akasaka area just nearby.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great facilities, great service, and ideal location in Tokyo! Food and Restaurants are amazing along with the views. Loved walking through the Japanese garden and the poolside setup was ideal. Will definitely come again!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I am presently staying at the hotel and i am very disappointed.Before i rant i have to say the hotel is beautiful. The room is well equipped and facilities great. Now the down side. The place is massive and this causes problems. Yesterday it took me 7 minutes 12 seconds to wait for a lift. This is not a one off. This morning we waited 15 minutes to be seated for breakfast even though there were lots of tables available. I put this down to short staffing in the restaurant. As this was a special trip we upgraded to the Zen executive facilites, one of which is the lounge for cocktails and canapés. Last night they had run out of items by 6.30 when the room is open to 8.The most annoying issue. They have the Sky view restaurant. On there website the menu is 8000 yen, in the room brochure it is advertised as 8000 yen, however they wanted to charge us 13000 yen. This is because it is special holiday in Japan this week. I complained to the manager who "couldn't " do anything. Even though it is still advertised everywhere as 8000 yen.It has been a disappointing and stressful stay.They're are better place. We really enjoyed the Hilton Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani is a grand place in the middle of Akasaka area of Tokyo. Beautiful gardens surround the hotel. Decoration inside the hotel is superb, and my room was very comfortable. Exquisite breakfast. Meeting areas and the shopping areas are well maintained. Staff was very helpful in recommending local restaurants and providing direction. I'd stay here again on the next trip.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Otani Main is a bit dated but it is made up for by the garden view, large king size bed, two minute walk to the train station and the large complex full of shops and restaurants.The breakfast is overpriced compared to the restaurants in the neighbourhood, but Western cuisine is authentic so worth it if you feel like pancakes, waffles etc. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Staff were fantastic! Very friendly and helpfull. Excellently presented hotel with great facilities. Short walk to the Metro to gain access to anywhere in Toyko. Highly recommendedBeds were a little in the firm side and the restaurants were a little expensive for our tastes but the quality and service was excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just completed a five day business stay at The Main wing of this hotel. Simply outstanding!Its a very large complex with several restaurants. My room was spacious with walk in closet, well appointed workspace and a decent size bright bathroom. Room had large windows overlooking the wonderful grounds and the city.From check in to concierge to restaurants, everybody was ever so friendly and helpful. Everybody I encountered seem to go out of their way to help.The hotel is conveniently located, 15 minutes taxi ride to Ginza and Shinjuku, the two major shopping districts. A thriving restaurants, bars and entertainment area is just five or six minutes walk. Finding a taxi to or from this hotel was never a problem. Its well over an hour's taxi ride from Narita airport though.I had a wonderful experience. Would strongly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a lovely hotel with good restaurants, shopping and a 10 acre Japanese garden to wander through. The pool is also a good size. The rooms are clean, well apportioned and quiet. The King bed is a real king, which for my 6'4" tall husband was a pleasure compared to our usual experience of small beds in Japan. The hotel staff are efficient and quick to help. The breakfast buffet has eggs prepared many ways, bacon and fresh fruit along with the Japanese and Chinese offerings. There is an exercise room with a couple of well maintained modern bikes and treadmills and an elliptical. There are mats to stretch out but it would have been nice to have some free weights too. Overall we had an excellent stay and would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was my fifth stay in Tokyo and my first time at New Otani. I will be back again. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is very clean and the rooms were quite large for a Japanese hotel. Wifi speed was very good. The hotel is quite large and has a couple different towers. There are couples, families on holiday, and business folks alike. I was there on business with a colleague but never felt like I was at a resort hotel for family vacationers. I will be back again.Outside there is a beautiful Japanese garden with a large, scenic waterfall under the the "garden view" breakfast area. There are also many gorgeous koi in the several ponds, and many small areas scattered about to sit and read a book. The garden was my favorite part of the hotel. The surrounding trees were so tall that it blocked out all but the highest floors of the other skyscrapers. It was nice to just walk around in there after a long day. It is a place of peace hidden in a city that can be overwhelming to the senses.There is also a nice outdoor pool area next to the garden but it was very busy and we weren't interested in a pool on this trip.There are several restaurants scattered about the different areas. I only ate at two of them: the yakitori place and the tonkatsu place. Both were above averate for being in a hotel and I was able to charge them to my room. I recommend the short walk to Akasaka for food. There has to be 400 restaurants in that small area.There are two different areas for breakfast.
