If you want an amazing view and less of a selection then the garden view breakfast area is nice. They have a really good selection of bread, fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs with cream, etc. If you do the garden view breakfast then I suggest getting there when they open at 7am so you can get a window seat. I personally prefered the epic breakfast buffet that was near the check in desk and main entrance. It cost ~2,800 yen, but in my opinion it was worth it to have that much variety. They had everything from smoked meats, gourmet cheeses, chinese noodle dishes, eggs over easy, bacon, sausage, fried fish, and everything else you would need to get your day started. Access to the hotel from Narita was simple. We took a train when we arrived, then a short 10 minute cab ride. When we departed we chose to use a shuttle bus that was quite cheap. I want to say around 3,100 yen one way. The front desk can arrange the shuttle for you.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Although among my various stays in New Otani this may not be my best experience, as this time the hotel seems to be quite fully occupied, this is hotel is still my favourite in Tokyo. It has more character than the other international 5-star hotels, the 40+ restaurants offer high quality food experience & excellent services (maybe except one very rude waiter I came across at Aux Bacchanales), spacious accommodation and convenient location. I just love it's 200+ years old Japanese Garden and its waterfall!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at new otani the main from August 21st to 28th and it was a good stay. The hotel is huge and there are a lot of resturants and shops. The staff are friendly and helpful especially the concierge. There are two metro stations nearby (Akasaka Mitsuke) and (nagatacho).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a perfect place for the business traveler. The staff are very helpful and speak English. The rooms are very nice. The accommodations are great. Mostly is was the supportive staff that helped to accommodate in any way they could. I will only stay there when it comes to doing business in Japan. I have stayed at other hotels and had the opposite experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Our room had beautiful views and we were able to have a connecting room with our kids. The bed was very comfy too. The service was very friendly and facilities were great. The gardens were just breath taking and so meticulously looked after. Would definitely go back to the New Otani. Tokyo is the best!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We booked a hotel on Hotwire where it does not tell you which hotel you get until after you pay and we ended up at the New Otani. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel! Our reservation said we would be in the main building but when we got there we asked if we could have a room with two beds instead of a full and they happily changed our room and put us in the garden hotel. I remember reading reviews saying the garden part was very outdated but I guess I didn't realize that's where our new room was until we got there. It was the most outdated hotel room I have ever seen in my life and I was actually terrified I would have to sleep there for 8 days (although the view from the room was gorgeous overlooking the gardens). We quickly called the front desk again and asked to be put back in the main building in our original room with one bed and they once again happily moved us and sent someone right away to bring us to our new room. This room in the main building was much much better! Had a king bed that was very comfy and a very clean bathroom (with the best water pressure of all time).The hotel itself is massive and very close to two different metro stations. It was a very convenient location and we were able to figure out where we were going very easily without knowing a word of Japanese. The wifi was very fast and worked in the room and the lobby! We ate at the yakitori restaurant for dinner one night and it was amazing! We also tried breakfast in the garden lobby one day which was extremely overpriced, a coffee was equivalent to about $9 American money. Luckily there are lots of coffee shops around Tokyo to grab a quick breakfast. Overall we were very happy with this hotel! I would gladly stay here again if my travels ever take me back to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at New Otani for business - not my choice, but went with the flow. The service is friendly, but the hotel is really outdated - guest rooms need a good remodel, as do the shops and restaurants. They charge $30 USD for an upgraded gym or you can go to the free gym which features three treadmills, one elliptical and a couple bikes situated in what felt like a hallway with no airflow.Gardens are beautiful, but three nights is torture when you are used to Starwood and Marriott luxuries (I am Platinum at both). Simply put: For amount you pay per night, there are far better options in the area for business and pleasure.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: went to the New Otani last year. This hotel is super amazing. The room is super comfy and wide, the restaurant offers many kind of tasty food too. The staffs speak English and very nice and helpful. They have a very large Zen garden that has koi pond in it, it is very calming, you need to check the Zen garden! Would definitely come back to New Otani for my Japan trips :)

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I'm a regular guest in the Hotel New Otani in Tokyo, because it offers a reliably great combination of (a) the room types, amenities, and level of services you expect from a grand hotel, (b) a great location, and (c) a reasonable price (for this class of hotel). Several choices for breakfast buffet, but do note that they all get crowded. My visit on 8/20 -22 was completely up to the standards I expect. The bell service is about the best you'll find anywhere.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is my 3rd time in Tokyo ( stayed previously at the peninsula & Hilton shinjuku) , and I must say that Hotel new Otani the main is the best in terms of room size , location ( access to two metro stations within a walking distance that connects to all major Tokyo attractions) and punctuality & helpfulness of concierge service. The only restaurant I tried in the hotel is the Tepanyakki at the Garden , and it's one of the best in Tokyo. I haven't tried the breakfast , as Tokyo has a great selection of outstanding breakfast restaurants like Bills, Clinton baking street & Le Pain Quotidien. While the hotel still has the 80's feel, the rooms are renovated. The workout room is small with only few cardio equipment , but there is good jogging track around Akasaka Palace.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed five nights in the New Otani Hotel for our first time visit to Tokyo. It was a very good choice to discover Tokyo, as everything was easily reachable by the subway system or taxis. Rooms, service and restaurants were excellent! However, make sure you are early for breakfast in the very popular 40th floor Garden Tower restaurant or be prepared to wait in a queue...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Very large hotel, nice stay & view. Went for a wedding for just a day, but definitely satisfied with the services/rooms/garden and certainly food. It is very central located, easy to access on everything. however, too big that you might get lost. :P

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani Hotel is a lovely and very big hotel with numerous shops and restaurants on the premises. It is like a city within a city. There is a gorgeous Japanese Garden outside of the Garden Cafe near the ground floor. It is one of the most beautiful gardens I had the pleasure of seeing while in Japan. There are restaurants on the top floor which have wonderful views. A friend and I stayed at the New Otani on the nights of June 18 and 19 while traveling with a tour group. (This was my favorite hotel on the trip.) I believe we were on the 27th floor of the Garden Tower. Our room had a city view. The hotel staff was professional and helpful. I really enjoyed this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani has been one of the Top 3 luxury hotels, with Imperial and Okura, in Tokyo until 1980's. Then, many luxury hotels of international brands have been built in Tokyo. However, still many National Guests and Royal Families from around the world stay at this hotel, and everytime I stay here, I also enjoy the beauty and the elegance of Otani, from clean spacious rooms, comfy beds, great restaurants, wonderful Japanese garden, to helpful staffs. This is still the best Japanese-style hotel that I can highly recommend to my foreign friends !!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani maintains a service culture one rarely sees these days -- elegant, classy, efficient, but not showy or glitzy. The "hotel" is really its own world of great restaurants, lovely shops, a couple excellent bars, and the extraordinary gardens.
user_name:
GRTKF
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I've been going to Tokyo for work for at least 20-25 years and I've only stayed at the New Otani and enjoy it. I like to traditional rooms and the choice of restaurants is amazing along with the prices for the food. There is a direct co-relation to the price of the food and the floor at which the restaurant is located. We love the sushi in any of the restaurants and the yakitori and on an expense budget the kobe steak and the kyoto tofu. The legendary service one sees starts at the entrance and at the service desk to the people who bow when you enter and exit the elevator. Love the rooms and their traditional decor. Over the years, have noticed that the rooms need to be redone but hey at times I feel a tradition is a traditonAkasaka mitsuke on the Ginza line is my fav station and it takes me to my work place. Love the Otani and love Tokyp and love the culture, the food and the people in JapanThe whisky -- well too much of something is not good is it ? Wink Wink

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: the room was relatively small and bit outdated. avoid room 1084 which we refused to move in....dark and small. the rooms with view over the park and the city are much better. we had a non/partially renovated room with a very small bathroom probably form the 60ies.the hotel is very well locate with access to several main metro lines.we would come back but only if we moved into a renovated room.staff and services excellent!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here two nights during a business trip, at the peak of Sakura season. I flew into Narita, took the train to Tokyo, and then a subway to the hotel. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the subway station. This avoids the sometimes dense Tokyo traffic. The hotel has a beautiful zen garden outdoors, and in cherry blossom season it was spectacular. My room, high up in the building, had great views of Tokyo. The room was generous size for Tokyo, with typical bathroom. Many restaurants in the hotel, but I didn't try them. There is a bar on the top floor for late night expensive drinks and city lights views. I would happily stay here again. The staff were helpful but not intrusive, the place is in great shape.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Everytime we visit Tokyo, we dont consider staying in any other hotel except for Hotel New Otani. My family and I love everything about this hotel - the room, service, location, amenities and the GARDEN! It is always a wonderful experience every morning while having breakfast to have an overlooking view of the wonderful Zen garden. It's so calm and serene- very relaxing indeed.In fact, my family will be spending our New Year's eve in this hotel. We are looking forward to another memorable stay in New Otani Tokyo ( Main Wing).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel has lost part of its old shine but is still a comfortable and clean accomodation in Tokyo. The location is not the best, however it is not far from both Shinjuku and Ginza, you can reach both by Metro in 20 min.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stay at The Main in first week of July. It is a really big hotel with two tower, The Main and Garden tower. View from my deluxe room is amazing. Japan Garden is really enjoyable for crowed mega city. You can find many good restaurants and shops between two towers. Close to busiest street with food stalls and shops. But what I miss is friendly atmosphere. If you want to use Gym, there is only free workout room with just four or five track mills and three mats that all. For real gym, you have to visit Spa and give extra 5000 Yen. for breakfast , you have to Q and wait 5 or 10 minutes. You can not use visa or master card at most of the shops in hotel and need to pay in cash. Language is another problem. Everyone smile but not friendly. I decided to select small but more friendly hotel next visit to Tokyo.
user_name:
YHT567
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I've stayed here on 5 different times. It doesn't matter if it's your first time in Japan, it will surely make you feel comfortable. It has a lot of western cuisine restaurants, as well as traditional ones. The zen garden is breathtaking. It has its own supermarket so you can buy snacks and beverages at the spot. Located on a friendly neighbourhood, you can travel by train, taxi or subway to the main views of Tokyo. I also found this hotel not so expensive, and a truly unique way to experience the city, without booking on major american hotel chains. The rooms are clean, the staff as friendly as any japanese, and the view of the city is on a whole other level.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A really big hotel! I stayed in the main wing and the rooms are really decent and bigger than most Tokyo hotels. The toilet was a little small and dated but overall it's still pretty good. Location is good too, short taxi rides to Shibuya and Harajuku and luckily not too expensive. Subway and train stations were also nearby but because the hotel is really big, it is quite a walk from the main wing to the garden wing and finally to the subway.Hotel New Otani has lots of restaurants! Tried the food in a few of the restaurants and they were really yummy! I really enjoyed the buffet breakfast and the teppanyaki.Will I return? Yes I will :)

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first stay at the New Otani Hotel Tokyo and we stayed here for two nights in April. The rooms were very comfortable and the hotel staff and concierge was very helpful in directing us to places we wanted to get to. We caught a taxi everywhere we went and the hotels location was very convenient. Breakfast was included for our stay and asian and american breakfasts were served. However, it does get crowded and there was a line waiting to get in. There were a lot of foreign guests at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is an excellent hotel, great place to stay especially if its your first time in Tokyo. It has a good room and bathroom, many good restaurants (with great buffet breakfasts) and a very helpful staff. Also, there's a metro station steps away from the hotel and the hop-on hop-off bus stops in this hotel. I stayed on the Main Buiding, but the Garden building seems a good option, it is entirely connected to the Main building and a bit less expensive. You can't go wrong.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed at the New Otani twice this year for work travel. Each time I discover something else I like about this hotel. It's main draw back is its very large size, although staying in the main part of the hotel still feels friendly and service is always very helpful, staff are impeccable and genial although service is not particularly personal. Room rates are reasonable for Tokyo. Everyone speaks at least some English, there's an ATM ( hard to find sometimes in Tokyo), a pharmacy, a convenience store, a gourmet food shops and many good restaurants, Japanese as well as Italian, French and American either in the hotel or nearby. The Garden Court wing seems busiest and not as well maintained as the rest of the property. the hotel is close to several subway lines and acab or train ride from all of the main Tokyo districts. The lovely Japanese garden is a fantastic antidote to jet lag, and it's gorgeous day or night.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Staying at Tokyo's New Otani, in the main building, is like slipping into a pair is sensible, much-loved shoes: reliable, comfortable, but not wildly exciting. Great location close to several train lines, very good rooms, lots of basic English speaking ability among the staff. Truly beautiful Japanese gardens. But not overly exciting.The bathrooms in the hotel rooms could use an update, the restaurants could provide more flexibility on early morning takeaway and more variety on the breakfast service. I stayed more than a week, and, while I enjoyed it greatly, but did think the hotel felt slightly grandmotherly at times. The outdoor pool was not open in early June. Though it was 30 degrees outside, and often sunny, I was told that "it was not yet summer season". The indoor pool costs extra, which is a shocker, and has far too many rules to make a visit there relaxing. DO join their New Otani Club for extra special attention, discounts on some things, free breakfast, and frequent flier points. But...If you want jazz, pizazz, hip and trendy, it's probably not the place!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani was, for a decade, my home-away-from-home while doing my company's international business. My wife and I recently returned to visit friends/family and the same gracious and welcoming sense of being there continues unabated.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Choose the Tower at the top floorsFantastic View of TokyoVery Well locatedFantastic serviceVisit the Japanese gardenThere is a restaurant at the top of the tower 40 floor wrere in some days is possible to see the Fuji.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The location of The New Otani is ideal for business or pleasure. Excellent access to the subway system for business (Marunouchi, Yurakucho, Otemachi, Shinjuku, Shibuya, etc..) and for shopping/sightseeing (Ginza, Shibuya, Shinjuku, Asakusa, Ueno, etc..). The rooms are very comfortable, amenities are excellent and the different restaurants offer a wide variety of cuisine to choose from. Also ideal for conferences, conventions and business meetings.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at Garden Tower before but this time there was no room for grandkids to stay with parents. Most single beds in Japan are too narrow by U.S. standards so even adding two singles together, it is difficult for the parents and one child to sleep together. Also, adding extra bed at garden tower is not as easy. At the main hotel, we were able to do so with King Bed available and by adding extra cot, all four could sleep comfortably. This is still possible if kids are small yet.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed three nights in this hotel in May and experienced earthquake twice!!My room was spacious for a single person also very clean. Bathroom was average.In spite of being a huge hotel my room was very quiet with a very comfortable bed.Apparently this hotel has multiple restaurants , I had buffet breakfast in the main building which was good but very busy.One night I had dinner at Japanese garden restaurant which was also good .Hotel has many shops including a small pharmacy in the lobby level and the basement.There is a Japanese garden which is average looking, considering that during my sixteen days trip in Japan I saw many Japanese gardens.Hotel staff was plenty , very professional and friendly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at this hotel a couple of nights in May 2015. No complaints whatsoever except that it was hard to choose which of the 30+ restaurants to choose from. The garden there is BEAUTIFUL and worth a trip just to see. The staff is awesome. Stay here for business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The room at the Hotel New Otani was very compact, but really beautifully designed. We particularly liked the set up of the bathroom, which seems to be a typical Japanese style with single wet room for the stand up shower and bathtub. The shower area had a great rough floor and every variation of shower head position in two stands that you could think of. The (king) bed was extremely comfortable. Our room looked over the Hotel's garden, so even though we were in the middle of Tokyo, it was very, very quiet. We loved the service from everyone in the hotel -- from the bell hops to the Concierge to the front desk staff. The most competent and friendly staff that you could hope for. We lingered at the breakfast buffet most mornings we were there, and the staff kept pouring us coffee very cheerfully throughout. The Wifi worked well in the room, but they did not have an option of wifi in the lobby, so was not possible to read email or the paper over breakfast, which was a bit inconvenient. The exercise room in the Main was the only disappointing part of the hotel. It had only cardio equipment in it (and one leg weight apparatus) and some mornings had no cold water or towels. There clearly had been a leak in one section of the room, and there was a hole punched out in the ceiling, but not note about upcoming repairs -- so it just seemed neglected -- very unlike the rest of the hotel.
user_name:
AvaS125
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A beautiful hotel in all respects. We stayed for a week. Amazing large Japanese garden is part of the hotel grounds. Staff very professional and friendly. About 5 minutes walk to underground passageway to Akasaka Mitsuke Metro station and another 5 minutes to the station itself. Bus for Narita leaves from the main hotel entrance a number of times daily. 36 restaurants/bars to choose from, ranging from quite cheap to very expensive. Excellent breakfast with huge number of food choices. Lovely views of part of the city from the rooms. Close to Akasaka area for convenience stores and restaurants. 3 interesting shrines and temples within 10 minutes walk from the hotel which are not crowded with tourists (just get the local map from the concierge which shows the locations). Tons of shops in the basement or main floor including a bookstore. Free wifi in the rooms.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights on business. The hotel staff were very helpful from the moment I arrived, getting me checked in early to my room. And there are plenty of staff... The room itself was very comfy, well equipped and clean, with fast in room WiFi. The lifts were a bit slow, and I often had to wait for one, but I think this is due to ongoing updating, with 2 lifts shut for a rebuild.Breakfast is a good buffet, but be warned you may have to queue for 10-15 minutes at peak times, but the staff were very helpful, and were doing what they could to get everyone in as fast as possible... There were 4 possible restaurants for breakfast, all were busy!The hotel is huge... pretty much a whole block, so pay attention to where things are!I didn't have time to use the facilities, so can't comment on them.But a great location in that the city center is 10 minutes, and a great area of restaurants just a short walk away.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent room. Service was superb, per usual. Breakfast was great. I was very happy to be reminded of the Bond film "you only live twice" that was filmed at the Main. The garden was beautiful, as per Mr. Otani's goal in building the hotel, I was able to see Mt. Fuji in the morning.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani is huge and by staying there, you could have a glimpse of old-schooled Japanese western charm. Their cafe at the Garden Tower is very popular not only among the hotel guests but locals too. It overlooks their beautiful Japanese garden. Staff was extremely helpful to answer our inquiry & help us with restaurant bookings. They were so efficient and friendly even prior to our arrival. We were so touched that we brought some shortbread from Fortnum & mason for the Executive Zen team! In-room Japanese breakfast was a must to try. One night we realised the main switch for lots of lights in the room wasnt working. After being informed, they got the problem fixed quickly and left us a letter apologising to us for the inconvenience caused. One evening we got so lost in Ginza and were terribly late for a dinner reservation (we read it's definitely a no-no behaviour in Japan). Tried to call the hotel so they could inform the restaurant accordingly and help us locate the restaurant over the phone. The staff was trying his best to help us though due to a bit of language barrier and our lack of sense of directions in Ginza (trust me, its rather complicated!) , we had a bit of difficult time trying to make our points across both ways. The staff sounded a bit frustrated and guess his tone was a bit strong. We later went to the concierge to thank for their help but the staff on duty didnt seem to understand fully what we were talking about. If even more staff could speak as good English (or close to) as the manager during the day, that would be even more perfect! There are quite a lot of shops inside the hotel (we only had time to check out only a few) but the old bookstore close to the lobby at the main tower caught my eye - I guess it must have been there for ages. They do have books in JApanese and English, Japanese magazines (quite a few about kimonos), stationery, etc etc!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It is an enormous hotel with all facilities. You could live here and never have to go outside the hotel grounds. The garden is a particular attraction. Well located close to a useful station on Tokyo's excellent underground system. Good restaurants in walking distance. The Concierge service was excellent and the staff service and general cleanliness immaculate.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This huge hotel is one of the classic 1960's hotels in Tokyo. It is so large that I get lost in it. The staff are very professional and you might be forgiven for thinking that they hark back to the 1960's too with their traditional bell-captain attire. The rooms are very large and comfortable by Tokyo standards. There are numerous very good restaurants and bars within the hotel and it's beautiful Japanese gardens. It is also located a very short walk away from the buzzing shopping / restaurant / club district of Akasaka. You would never be short of entertainment here. I highly recommend that you try the Japanese breakfast in the Japanese restaurant instead of settling for the rather average Western breakfast. This hotel is only a five minute walk to Akasaka-Mitsukae station on the Ginza metro line. You therefore have very easy access from here to anywhere else in Tokyo by metro.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: As a non-Japanese speaking visitor, everyone made an effort to help and the staff made my time in Tokyo extra special. Rooms are great and there is a great selection of restaurants and shops within the hotel complex. Easy walk to major subway lines and great bus service to the airports

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a suite overlooking the gardens & waterfall on the 18th floor. Top accessories (Bulgari etc). Service was excellent & location very functional with 2 train stations within a 10 minute walk. The set breakfast will cover most western needs & there are plenty of different bars to keep you interested at night.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: When I come to Tokyo I always book Hotel New Otani. From my point of view it is the best hotel in Tokyo. It has very convenient location - in Akasaka. There are many traditional and wetern restourants in walking distance. It takes 20 min walk to reach Midtown where we enjoyed Louvre exhibition as well as Rene Magritte exhibition. Nightlife in Akasaka and neighbour Roppongi is bright.Hotel staff is very well skilled and kind. Rooms are very comfortable. Breakfasts are diversified. Hotel garden is magnificant every season.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed here for 5 nights on business, and had a lovely stay. The hotel is clean and staff are efficient. There are a stack of shops within the hotel if you fancy some retail therapy, but the best part of staying here is the wonderful Japanese gardens that you can freely wander around.The outdoor swimming pool looked lovely, but was only opening up for the summer season just as I was leaving.Breakfast at the Garden Lounge was good, although the queues to get seated in the mornings are a little long for my liking.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: An oasis in busy world of Tokyo at great value - Still retains a bit of old Japanese style and much better value than the Palace, Peninsula, park Hyatt, etc. Everything you need in Tokyo, conveniently located!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Room was spacious. Several breakfast options with fantastic views of Japanese gardens or the city from 40 stories. Service was awesome and I got everything I needed.Also a great central location.I will surely come back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed here four nights with our daughter. Three beds in one room made for tight quarters but it was larger than any other room we stayed in. The bathroom was great with a shower and big soaking tub. We stayed in the main tower on the 15th floor (which I thought was great). Until I hear the thumping of the waiters in the restaurant above us. Don't stay on the 15th floor (the exec rooms are lower). Otherwise the room was quiet. Ditto on the breakfast wait time - was long with tour groups all lining up. Gardens are nice. Only one lower priced restaurant on the premises which I thought was strange since there are supposedly 30 on site. We ate a lot of pizza and salads there lol.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The comfort and location of the hotel are excellent. The organization for breakfast could be improved as wait times are sometimes 30 minutes. I wish they could improve the fitness room as the size and extent of equipment does not befit a hotel of this size and reputation.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Both my wife and I were quite impressed with this hotel. Lovely property and very friendly staff who spoke very good english. Location was good as well. Food in the hotel was very good. Breakfast spread was huge.Loved our stay here and highly recommended,\.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The cleaning staff didn't do a good job. Dust all over the surface of furnitures. Floor didn't get vacum cleaned. Forget to dump the trash and left behind dirty rag in the bathtub after cleaning. Turn out these cleaning ladies are Chinese!!!!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: really happy with the hotel ,espicially love the nice garden and all facilities . One thing that upset us is ,at Satsuki restaurant. We ordered a bowl of rice with grilled beef which was clear that we asked for medium well cook. The beef came quite rare so we asked for more cook but waiter said he couldnt do that. We tried to ask for a second time with another waiter and he said ok. Waiting for about 15 mins and the food was back that look exactly the same (doneness). The best hotel in town that won our sastifaction should not been ruin by this kind of service from this particular restaurant.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Well situated near several subway stations, the New Otani offers both elegance and convenience. The service in this hotel is excellent. From our room, we could see Mt Fuji. Our rate included breakfast, which is bountiful and delicious. It is our first choice for hotels in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: New Otani Hotel has become my HOME AWAY FROM HOME for me and my wife whenever we visit Japan for business. We stay at the New Otani , because the rooms ( at the main) are nice , comfortable , the service is perfect ( Japanese , off course) the location is very comfortable and the surrounding is very pleasant.One important remark: for a frequent guest like us , one expect the hotel management to do something extra, give special attention, send to the room , some token of gratitude, do an upgrade from time to time.... nothing ( we have been at the hotel tenth of times
user_name:
Elchanan H
Hod HaSharon, HaMerkaz, Israel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We only spent one night at the Otani, but we were impressed by our room which included absolutely everything one could need: little flashlights in night tables, toothbrushes and toothpaste, hair brush, water bottles, etc. Unlike southern European bathrooms which always have bidets, our bathroom had a combination toilet/bidet, and the toilet seat was warm! The efficiency of whoever appointed the room was duly appreciated.The hotel has a number of wings, and restaurants, and lovely shops. I looked down on the serene garden from the picture window of one of the restaurants, and I was charmed.I would stay here again if we were to return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed four nights at the New Otani. While there's not a whole lot in the immediate area, the taxis are reasonably priced and perfectly safe to use. There is a nice garden on the grounds. The room was comfortable and while I couldn't see Mt Fuji from my room, it can be seen from the upper restaurant. The wifi was free and fast in the room. There was also a kettle, bar fridge, robe and bathroom amenities. My only gripe was the extremely expensive food in the restaurant. I went down for a bite and spent $13 for a few slices of tomato. There are some restaurants across the river that are more reasonable. Other than that, it's a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My wife and me stayed some days in the Main.Comfortable, fiendly staff, we enjoyed the CLUB MEMBER status of THE NEW OTANI CLUB.stayed on 11th floor with a great view.Rooms are clean and have enough space, friendly staff

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We were picking up a cruise ship in Tokyo and decided on a three day pre cruise stay in Tokyo. The choice of hotel was out of our hands as it was part of a package but we were not disappointed and were very pleased with The New Otani.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: An amazing place with an amazing garden. The restaurant Satsuki could be cheaper for the quality of food served. Not impressed by the food or the service, but by the pricey bill. Waiters were distracted and hard to get even for a glass of water.Hotel staff is superb, second to none.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My wife and I stayed here in the Garden Tower room for one night in November 2014, as we couldn't get a room at our preferred hotel, but we did not regret staying here at all. The check in and other hotel services were very efficient, and the hotel is very well located.The room seemed a little old and tired, particularly in comparison to other modern hotels, but was clean and efficient. We had the buffet lunch at the hotel, which was excellent for the price that we paid. Overall good stay and value for money.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Chose this hotel on then basis of the late check out available (3pm) to New Otani Club members. As it turned out, they could only offer a 2 pm checkout, having initially said they could not offer anything beyond the standard 12pm I understand they were busy, but this was very disappointing.We had a Quality King room in The Main. Room was shabby, with chipped furniture and pre fab bathroom. Room size was good. The whole place feels like a 1970s casino, with brown carpets and faded 60s glitz. In hotel dining is shockingly expensive, and there aren't many options close by. Inconvenient location generally, although handy to lovely cherry blossom walks in the season.Have stayed at Metropolitan Marunouchi and Mitsui Garden Ginza recently and would rate both significantly higher than here, in terms of quality and location.Without guaranteed late check out, would not consider here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Other things being equal, everytime i walk to and from the akasakamitsuke station, i wonder why i did not book the Gardens instead. After reaching the gardens, the main is another 200 meters down the hallway. On a normal day its fine. But after having pounded the streets for a whole day of shopping, that 200m could end up as the killer. Not a new hotel but the view of the garden is very nice. Very good size compared to other Japan hotels. Even comes with bathtub.Cleanliness is an issue. I can find wrappers i dropped 3 days ago on the day of checkout. I find dust on the telephone and the tissue boxes.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Tokyo is not a cheap place to travel, especially if you stay in the more tourist known areas. This place is actually a fair deal for what you get, by Tokyo price standards. Large rooms with all the amenities, some I never did figure out how to work. The buffet breakfast is expensive at $60 U.S. each but you will literally find every breakfast food known to man on the buffet. You could spend all day in there and still only sample 10% of what is laid out.Service was great, and like all of Japan cleanliness borders on obsessive.Also love the honesty of the Japanese. I fully believe you could leave your wallet on the table and it would be there undisturbed 24 hours later, unless someone turned it in to lost and found. The Japanese won't even take stuff home they find on the ground. It is why the end of every block has a large collection of lost gloves, hats, scarves, and umbrellas draped on the hand rails.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was here for one night and it was just what I needed - quiet, comfortable, and good options for food and drink. I wish I could have stayed longer; I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Only a 2 day stay but staff excellent, room spacious and comfortable, choice of eating locations all one could ask and gardens superb. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Tokyo. Convenient for Tokyo metro and thus anywhere in central Tokyo. Excellent shuttle to airport.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A great place to stay if you know you will need a really good night of sleep in Tokyo. In a city where most hotel rooms are incredibly small, New Otani offers extremely comfortable rooms at a fair price.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Weeks before I was trying to find the best way to get to the hotel from the airport. The website wasn't user friendly and the English version wasn't working well. Arrived at the airport around 3pm and wanted to take a bus to the hotel. Airport staff said the buses have stopped for the day. Wow. So took a taxi insteadArrived at the hotel and it's perhaps ironical it's called the New Otani, since it's very old and old looking. They use a real key instead of key cards, so it's a sign of old things to comeThere are 2 towers, main and garden. From the tripadvisor ranking, it appears main is slightly better, and my reservation is here. Got a lowish floor on 5th, so was already disappointed. View was expectedly bad, of the hotel power generators, so had my curtains closed most of the time. Room is smallish and old, with the dangerous bathtub instead of a shower stall. Tv channels are few and mostly Japanese, like most 3-4 star Japanese hotels. Worse, they had CNN dubbed in Japanese, so it was painful to watch. The only bright spark for the room is the shiseido toiletries. FancyGym was small and bad, and thus desertedWith the 2 towers combined, this hotel has a staggering 15-20 restaurants, so that's not too bad, although I think none have michelin stars . Wrote separate reviews hereThe metro/JR station is a bit of a walk away, so not entirely convenient . I just took taxis most of the timeService is great like all hotels and places in japan, probably the only other saving graceOverall 3 stars, add 1 for service

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A wonderful tropical Japanese hotel in Tokyo...service minded, quiet, nice and clean plus uniquely!!! I'm sure if I come back to visit Tokyo again I'll be here, believe me you will like and love this hotel as me , specially the garden....check it out!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel was extremely large, but felt well-run with a bit of luxury. They are extremely used to tourists, and are very helpful in any questions you may have. We ordered room service when we got in on an early flight, which arrived promptly. Rooms and bathroom are very clean, they provided lovely robes, and were a large size. I would recommend! They also have a beautiful garden and on a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent service, good room but getting 'tired'. Gym in The Main needs to be expanded/updated. There aren't enough machines to satisfy demand at peak times, and the room is tiny relative to the size of the hotel. Good selection of dining and convenient to most of central Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I book room with double bed thru internet, it came out with one king. When checking in i asked for double bed. The reception asked for additional 5000 yen per night plus tax. Times 3 night. Joined the new otani club, but feel it's useless since on my second stay try to check in 1.30 pm. The reception at the club simply reply with her sour face that the hotel policy check in is 2 pm

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel, best food, nice room, good location... Me n my son really enjoy my stay over there.The staffs very helpful to us.I recommended the hotel. For sure I will stay there when I'm back to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Nice friendly staff, plenty of restaurants with delicious food, good housekeeping, beautiful Japanese garden in the heart of Tokyo, breathtaking view from the Top. Breakfast was rich with fresh fruits and vegetables, I like that I could choose the restaurant I'd like to go on breakfast or change it to lunch. I felt like I was a special guest and everything went fine!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spending a week in this hotel (the Main section, there are other sections as well, it is a huge hotel), I was able to have a good look. First: hotel is smack dab in the center of Tokyo. From the hotel lobby it is at minimum a 10 min walk to the metro. So not really close by, unfortunately. The entree of the hotel is very large, check-in/out efficient with friendly staff. At peak times there's staff helping with elevators also. Luggage service fine. Coming back from the city i could hand my bag to the staff working on the taxis and it was delivered to the room while I left again. Very pleasant and safe. The room itself was relatively small with oldfashioned furniture. this also applied to the bathroom/shower. Functional abd clean but not very attractive. In that sense the word 'new' can be deleted from the Hotel name. The walls are very thin, connecting doors makes sure one can hear the neighbours without any problem. Hope that your neigbours are of the quiet type and do not play the tv all the time. Also sounds from the hallway come into the room as if the door is not there. That is a serious drawback.The organization of services is impeccable. Limousine bus reservations (to both Haneda and/or Narita airport) are easily made and explanations on visits are exact for example. In the morning there's a free shuttle bus taking you to a few stops in the Asaka business district. You could also walk (20-30 min) but if on business this is a good option.Eating can be pricey. For simpler dishes go to the banquet level: there are several smaller restaurants that serve (especially for lunch) good food at low prices. Dinners typically become much more expensive in Japan. Also, if you want to eat a burger later in the evening (but it closes at 22.00!) go to the coffeeshop connecting the Main with the Garden.Also take some time to walk through the japanese gardens of the hotel. It is pleasant. Nicely lit after dark. Breakfast is excellent but not cheap and if the hotel is booked, make sure to avoid rush hour (07.30-08.30), you may have to wait in line due to groups coming at once.Laundry: not expensive: i had 4 shirts, pressed only, for 2000 yen. Beats doing it yourself coming tired from a flight.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hotel New Otani and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The room was very homely and the views of the garden and Tokyo were brilliant. The staff are extremely helpful and pleasant making you feel very special. It's also very convenient being close to various shops, restaurants, etc making the whole Tokyo stay an easy one.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This one is my favourite. Have stayed here more than two dozen times, but am writing the first time about it. Old world charm with courteous hospitality at its best. Large well appointed rooms. Close to main shopping area. Has a huge and pulsating parallel buzz with shops and eating places on its lower floors. The side street of the hotel gets you to see cherry blossom, during season. Awesome sushi restaurant. Even others are worth eating in. Its an experiential island all by itself.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: 3rd time at the New Otani. For reasons outlined in my (and others) earlier reviews - still consistent etc. It really is a great location to base yourself, with all that Tokyo has to offer just a walk or subway stop or two away.The one thing that hit us between the eyes, and really put a (temporary) damper on this one night stay, was the front desk clerk in the Garden wing who, when we arrived at 12:30pm and said we're staying the night tonight, promptly and without preamble announced that 'Check in time is 3pm'. We hadn't asked to check in, and in fact would have been happy to strictly store our bags until the right time. There was no 'Welcome to the New Otani'. Interestingly, she still proceeded to check if our room was ready (which it was) and we were escorted to our lovely room without further ado. It simply wasn't a moment which started everything off in a good direction ...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I've stayed in this hotel several times since 2003. It's really an island unto itself, in a chic area of Tokyo. It has a very Japanese style, the hangout of old, rich Japanese people. People watching on the weekends is good, as it caters to a large local wedding crowd wearing elegant kimonos. Compared to the Grand Hyatt in Roppongi, the rooms in the Main are slightly bigger, but not nearly as modern. Beds are very comfortable. The view is nice and the garden is nice, but no one walks in the garden in winter. I found the room service food only fair - very limited choice after 9PM. The staff are always helpful and kind. The Golden Spa gym is also a gym for senior citizens, but it's nice and has an excellent sauna and hot tubs. The outdoor pool is great in summer, probably the only reason I'd stay here again. All in all not a bad value for money, but not really an exciting place to stay except for a first visit to Japan to plunge into the atmosphere of the place.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I like this hotel - reasonable price for standard room which was clean, comfortable and quiet; a short walk to the subway for easy access to all areas of Tokyo; a range of cafes and restaurants onsite; and the beautiful garden, so serene in the midst of this busy city. I first stayed here for 2 nights in 2012 in the Garden Tower in a room on a high level with a terrific view. The room itself was big enough for me as I was travelling alone. It was clean and quiet, nice bathroom, with older style furniture which was in good order and quite adequate. For my second visit to Tokyo I was accompanied by my husband, and decided that we would take a room in the Main building as the standard rooms there were a bit larger and more modern. The room was on the 10th floor, overlooking the front entrance to the hotel. So, no great view, but with an open aspect which was pleasant, especially with all the fairy lights at night lining the driveway. The room was well laid out, with the bathroom and dressing area private from the bedroom area, a separate makeup desk and mirror, small table and two chairs, and study desk. Comfortable bed, quiet and clean - can't ask for much more, and stayed 5 nights. We arrived in mid-morning after an overnight flight, but couldn't check in until 2pm. This is what I like about the Otani - we were then able to have brunch at the cafe overlooking the garden, go for a walk along the lower level shopping arcades, note the various restaurants, and have a very relaxing stroll in the garden. To be able to do all that and not actually leave the hotel when you are rather tired was a bonus. We were then ready to get into the hustle and bustle of Tokyo the next day.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It was a truly heartbreaking experience, I have read about the reviews and how this hotel is one of the three best hotels in Tokyo along with Okura and Imperial Hotel.We arrived late at night and booked two rooms and they "tricked" us and moved us to the garden tower room which were cheaper and older instead of our booking in the main building and they insisted it was because we wanted two close rooms together (well, should have told us that the garden tower was older and has worse quality); after an hour of complaining the next day they told us that they are so "kind" that they will discount us 50% for the supposed upgrade which I do not appreciate as I have already very disappointed with them lying to us and I do not want an upgrade, what I want was the Main Building Room not an upgrade.The reception staffs and duty manager were rude except the bellboy and we had to haggle for what is our right to have the main building as booked. Nobody smiles and they were talking behind my back, thinking that I don't understand Japanese.Quality of Rooms (Garden) = 1 (VERY OLD and some of the furniture were changed but it looks like it was bought from IKEA)Quality of Rooms (Main) = 3 (Rooms were quite large)Room Amenities = Standard, mineral water is free although there is a strict rule that we are only can have one bottle per one guest per night and they charge you for extra.Facilities = WE HAD TO PAY TO USE THE GYM, there are two gyms, the basic one were free although it was abysmal and the better one, we had to pay. Swimming pool is also not free for guests. The Garden is quite nice, although it is not worth it to just stay for the garden and I do not know why they are not also charging for the gardens since they are charging for every little things.Food Quality (Breakfast) = Standard.. Very StandardService = Rude and Poor except the bellboyLocation = It is kind of far from the hustle of Tokyo, I had to take the train everywhere.Value for Money = Bad, for the service and facilities.ProsWifi is fast and available throughoutRooms were quite good in the mainStayed during 30 Dec 2014-3 Jan 2015Tips : Do not stay in the garden tower

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I've now stayed at the executive floor 3 times and am still very pleased with it.The rooms are elegant and efficient. The lounge is wonderful and a nice spot for a small healthy breakfast.The staff is very friendly and helpful.I will return again on my next visit.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for almost a week and was really enjoying it. No major complaints. Service was good, housekeeping was clean. Just a bit far from main attractions, but it's close to a subway station, so no trouble.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It was a pleasure to come back here yet again. The hotel (The Main section) is in better shape than ever. This is Japan so the standard rooms are not very large but clean, quiet, well equipped and well serviced. The location is in a quiet but nonetheless central part of Tokyo. This is not a western style hotel, but Japanese at heart, not boasting a luxury profile. But nonetheless it is a hotel that fulfills any need of its guests when asked. If you are into fine dining, keep in mind that the Paris top restaurant La tour d'Argent has its only subsidiary at this very hotel. More affordable is the Trader Vic's which is a must - great drinks! Finally also keep in mind the French bistro around the corner, the "Aux Bacchanales" .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I had a very pleasant stay at the New Otani. The room was spacious by Tokyo standards, very clean, the service was excellent and the price was quite reasonable. The location in Akasaka is ideal, steps away from the subway and many good places to eat. I had no wait for check in or out. I stayed in the "Main" section of this massive hotel. The rooms are dated and you won't find a huge number of free non-news cable chanels but again, given the price, cleanliness, excellent service and location I felt it was an very good value and I'll stay there again. Another plus are the gardens that on the property and the fact that the hotel kind of stand on its own. You don't have that claustrophobic feeling that you sometimes get in Tokiyo. i visit Tokiyo frequently and in this price range you will usually get a cracker box or pay hundreds of dollars more for something of similar size albeit more modern. Lastly, the Wifi was free and worked just fine.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This was our first stop in our three week holiday of Japan and I really can't fault it. The staff were excellent, spoke English perfectly, and our stay went off without a hitch. We actually got into Tokyo a day late due to airline problems and they didn't charge us for first night of our booking!I haven't stayed in other hotels in Tokyo but from what I saw on the net the room was huge by comparison. Plenty of room for both suitcases, as well as a desk and chair. Good size bathroom. Immensely happy with the location. The airport limousine from Narita dropped us right at the front door (highly recommend) and it was a short 5 min walk to Akasaka-Mitsuke where there were heaps of restaurants and a subway station that linked to several different lines. This made it easy to get around! A decent walk from the nearest JR station but we mainly used the subway, and transferred at Tokyo station to catch the Shinkansen. This hotel was massive. We actually got lost the first two times we tried to leave! There are plenty of restaurants etc here - they were a bit pricey so we didn't eat at any. Did have a drink at the sky bar though, great view, and if you eat there there is a revolving bit so you get a 365 degree view of Tokyo from 17 stories.High,y recommend.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed one night in the New Otani on our last night of a two week Japanese trip. The room we had was spacious and accommodated three of us easily. We had spent the day traveling and it was very relaxing to stay for one final night in the luxury of the Otani. We had a delicious dinner in the Italian restaurant and a very good breakfast in the Garden Court overlooking the garden. As others have mentioned please take the time to walk through the gardens , they're exquisite. Service was excellent throughout the hotel. Join the Otani club. The dining discounts make it worthwhile. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The room was dated. The bathroom small. The service however was excellent. The location was not great. The gardens were very beautiful. Don't miss them. The hotel was huge. Felt like a convention hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The room and amenities was very nice (summer and winter robes, slippers) - large room.The employee service was excellent - gratious and helpfull.Location is conveniently near Akasaka with nearby subway access.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was lucky enough to stay here on my first visit to Japan. The room was nice, service excellent and the 10-acre, 16th century garden adjacent to the hotel was sublime. We dined in several in-house restaurants, but the highlight was the yakitori restaurant, Isehiro, deep in the bowels of the hotel. It felt like we were in a small town, enjoying yakitori and beer on a hardwood grill.Breakfast buffet in the Garden Court was nice and we had my 62nd birthday dinner at Bella Vista on the 40th floor of the Garden Tower. Great view and good food.The hotel is located close by the Akasaka neighbourhood which is loaded with great shopping and restaurants. Also a convenient subway stop for access to the entire Tokyo subway system and Japan Rail trains.Another, more personal, highlight. The deep soaker tub and fully featured Toto toilet seat complete with heater and various spritzing options!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent in every respect. No complaints at all. Attentive yet unobtrusive service. Restaurants are expensive but reasonably so given the type of hotel. There are cheaper places to eat very close by near Akasaka-mitsuke metro station.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I was traveling on business and ended up in the economy room. It was small but still nice (although not worth the price). The breakfast was great and the gardens were beautiful. The hotel is close to the metro (Maranouchi and Ginza lines), so I had easy access to the city. The concierge was immensely helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Since japan is such a tiny country, everything is tiny.. and coming from someone who lives in the the hospitality capital like Las vegas it is hard to find an amazing room for a good price, with that being said this place wasn't huge but the western style rooms were very clean and comfortable. My husband is 6 ft tall so having some room to relax was a big deal. The service was outstanding everywhere we went and I am always impressed with how polite everyone in japan is. This hotel from start to finish was very professional and exceeded all my customer service expectations. Its walking distance to many things in the city so that made going out easy and the train stops are just right around the corner. Make sure to sign up for the new otani members card because you get a discount on breakfast and you also get some other other hotel perks.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I enjoyed a couple of nights in the main wing of the New Otani hotel. The rooms were small but comfortable, at least compared to Western style hotels. The breakfast buffet was a nice experience especially combined with a brief tour of the gardens and koi ponds on site. Location was helpful for my business trip and dinner could be conveniently found in the Ayakusa district nearby.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed on the 34th floor of the garden tower. Amazing views of the city and very good service throughout. The decor is a bit dated and it's not a trendy hotel but the restaurants are high class and the price is reasonable. It was very quiet in my room.Location is very handy for central areas and the subway stop is very close. Loads of choices to eat within the hotel but some are fairly expensive. There are one or two cheaper options on site which were fine but most mornings I took the 5 minute walk to Akasaka area and had breakfast in Starbucks or a local coffee chain for a few dollars. Room service menu is good.The Japanese is garden is beautiful. I'd certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Despite the recent upgrade the hotel still reeks of 1970's Tokyo. It's relatively inexpensive if that's what you are looking for and the gardens are remarkable. But i would recommend not staying here but dropping in for the yakitori at Isehiro and then strolling the gardens for 20minutes. Or even having dinner at the teppanyaki restaurants in the garden. I see other reviewers like to rave about the service but I find it average and typical of Japanese hotels so nothing to rave about. Get a better room elsewhere and avoid the quaint old features of the New Otani

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in the Main Wing, very good service from check in to check out .It is a very big and busy hotel, but that does not effect the service, like giving you a seat while waiting for breakfast if busy .Every one is so helpful, but that is Japan .I would certainly recommend it .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed for 5 nights at the Main Wing of Hotel New Otani. The hotel is a Tokyo landmark and was built during the Olympic Games. The week that I stayed in Tokyo was particularly busy due to a conference in the city so the hotel was very busy and that could have impacted the service. The hotel is huge so if you are looking for a cozy spot you should avoid it. the access from Haneda airport from by Taxi takes 30 mins.1. Poor Sleep Quality: The room walls are very thin and I had the misfortune of staying in a room where my neighbour would start talking at from 12am to 4am. Despite several complaints there was not change in the behavior and I had to finally change my room.2. Long queues at breakfast: I have to wait upto 30 mins to get breakfast and gave up on most days due to the wait and had to eat outside the hotel.Despite spending $300 per night I missed out on breakfast and a good night's sleep. Thereofore, I will not be coming back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I had a truly wonderful three-night stay at Hotel New Otani Tokyo. I admit being apprehensive at first because the hotel dates back to the 1964 Tokyo Olympics and the New Otani is anything but "new." After walking into its grand lobby and being greeted warmly by the staff, all my worries were silly and unfounded. I was upgraded to an Executive Floor because the month of stay happened to be my birthday month. More than that, service was extraordinary in every sense. Everyone from the Executive Floor Lounge to the doormen were pleasant and helpful. I did not even have to push the elevator button myself as an attendant usually did it remotely for me when he saw I was walking toward one. Wow.The facilities were not dated at all and many parts of the hotel must have been refurbished several times. Everything looked well maintained and in top condition. I love the complete carpeting in all sections and the soft mood lighting along the hallways.The restaurants were superb and I will leave reviews in the restaurants section of TA. Special mention must be made of the stunning 400-year-old garden on the grounds. Waterfall, carps and shrubbery made photos absolutely professional.The location of the hotel was convenient to a few metro stations and for short business trips downtown. It was also near the Imperial Palace and many other attractions.Overall, the New Otani is a true classic that is fabulous value for money and that demands repeat stays. I look forward to them.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The original hotel, now the Main building was built for the Tokyo Olympics in 1964 & was the tallest building in Tokyo at the time. Two more blocks have since been built. We stayed in the Garden Tower. The Garden Court consists mainly of offices & conference rooms.There are about 38 restaurants/bars! I heard Trader Vic's is good as is the revolving restaurant.We had a choice of 4 restaurants for breakfast. My favourite was the one on the 40th floor in the Garden Tower block especially when Mt Fuji was clear.Staff are all very professional, helpful & polite. However I stayed here a couple of times on business & being so big it is impersonal.There are exclusive shops along the main corridor & on the lower floors plus a handy supermarket, post office & an ATM inside the post office which accepts foreign cards.The gardens are 40 years old being part of the original gardens belonging to the Emperor. A popular spot with wedding couples having their photographs taken. Weddings are also held in the hotel. Definitely worth having a stroll around the grounds.Never used the outdoor pool plus there is an indoor pool but costs 5000Y to use???Rooms are generally bigger than most Japanese rooms. Try & request a high room overlooking the garden & facing towards Mt Fuji which is sometimes clear plus when the skyscrapers of Shinjuku are lit up at night the view is very impressive. I didn't use the a/c but there was a constant buzzing sound in my room which did effect my sleep. Never got round to reporting it!There is a handy airport bus costing 3100 Y & takes between 1.5/2hrs depending upon traffic!The nearest metro station is handy for travelling around the city plus the Imperial Palace area is within walking distance if you don't get lost!
user_name:
IslandMichele007
Isle of Wight, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel is very convenient, the rooms are beautiful with Japanese culture flare and ambiance, gorgeous historical garden in the backyard, beautiful and peaceful walk, the hotel is quiet and the staff is extremely professional.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed four nights in a triple room suite - which had a separate living room - in the Garden Tower. The rooms were fairly large and well furnished, and we had a nice city view of the high rise buildings in Akasaka. The beds were pretty hard - typical of Japan. We booked through Expedia for $277 a night.Arrival from Narita airport was a snap on the Airport Limo bus - it takes you directly to the hotel. We bought a roundtrip bus ticket at the airport and got three-day subway passes for free.We had breakfast a few times at the casual restaurant overlooking the garden. They had a couple different buffets there each morning. The food was fair but the garden view was delightful. With so many restaurant options in the city, we did not utilize any of the other restaurants at the hotel.The hotel's location was perfect - with easy access to the city. A hundred yards to the south were two subway stations with lines that could take you anywhere in the city. Just beyond that is the Aksaka neighborhood with many restaurant options.Needing to buy train tickets for later in the week, I stopped by the concierge to ask which JR station to go to make the purchase. They suggested I use the IACE travel office in the lobby at the hotel. What a find! Linda Pepin, the rep there, was wonderful. She fully explained the different train options, found us the best seats, gave me a map of the train station with my details highlighted, and even called the Airport Limo bus company to book our return to Narita.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I went in this hotel and the service is outstanding, the people works there is from another planet, they are always smiling like in Disneyland, their actitud make the differnce, the room is perfect and the wi-fi is so fast, I'll recommend this hotel to anybody and the food is also excellent, it has a very good location because the subway is a walking distance, you sholud go there is the HOTEL.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a standard double room with a view of the garden. The room is spacious with a big comfortable king size bed. The bathroom has brand amenities. I did not know Salvatore Ferragamo went beyond fashion into toiletries. The lounge offers light snacks and drinks. The service is friendly. Checking in and out are done here. I recommend staying in the Executive House rather than the main hotel or Tower for the personal attention and away from the public that uses this hotel for conferences and weddings. It is a huge complex. It is famous for the beautiful garden and waterfall. The only thing I do not like about the hotel is the location. Relative to similar hotels in the same category as this one,it is not easily accessible to subways. In addition, I found it strange that there is only one trash can in the room (and that is in the bathroom). The bathtub was a bit small.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This location is tough to beat if you are having a conference in Tokyo. It is enormous and has fantastic facilities to host any sort of a conference. The rooms are all clean and comfortable. There are multiple restaurants to pick from with a variety of cuisines and prices. There are also some beautiful gardens on the property that you can explore or just sit and enjoy while eating. There are not a lot of activities that are within walking distance. However, free wifi and a convenient connection to Narita make this a great stay.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at the Hotel New Otani Main for 6 days on business. This is a huge hotel! My first room was a smoking room and the smoke odor was very strong. I spent the first night in this room and asked for a non smoking room as the smell really bothered me. They quickly accommodated my request. The second room was much better-albeit smaller. I had a great view of Mt Fuji and the Japanese garden. Service at this hotel is beyond wonderful. The property is beautiful and well located near the Imperial Palace. I even caught a glimpse of the Imperial family (the Princess and Prince at least,-they apparently are seen at the hotel on a frequent basis). Jogging trail maps are available at the front desk. The staff is quite friendly and polite and the free WiFi and water is a nice touch. The restaurants are varied and there is plenty to choose from. In all staying here reminded me of being on a cruise ship. This was my first trip to Japan, so I cannot compare to other Japanese hotel properties, but this was a fine international hotel that takes good care of its guests.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Be aware there are TWO parts to this hotel.TOWER block is run separately, and should in theory be cheaper than the MAIN block. They are linked, as both places are huge.The main block, has rooms with views of Mt Fuji. Ironically the best (highest) floors are smoking floors, which left me stunned, but then I was reminded most Japanese executives smoke, and their money counts. That's sad, as the best views for getting a potential view of Mt Fuji are going to be the smokers' floors. I took a gamble, and took a smoking room with a view of Mt Fuji - and the room didn't smell. But that could have been luck that the previous occupant didn't smoke either.Tower block has NO views of Mt Fuji and is considered to be on the back, and that may reflect why depending on the seasons, its rates are cheaper than the Main block, so just be aware which part of the hotel you're booking into. My colleagues had the Tower block and it was a huge issue to try and move to the Main block, without a substantial increase in the rate (difference) and availability.Attention to detail, staff friendliness never fades here. English is limited amongst the staff, so if you can speak some Japanese or make an effort, it will go a long way. Service is old school politeness - nothing appears to be too much trouble.Thankfully wifi is free as it should be in a business hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani has been a Tokyo institution and landmark for 50 years and is still a deluxe experience. It's a huge complex consisting of 3 buildings situated on 10 acres of prime Tokyo real estate including the original 1964 tower built for the 64 Tokyo Olympics now called The Main plus a newer 40 storey hotel the Garden Tower and a 35 storey office tower all surrounded by a beautiful Japanese garden. The Main where we stayed has been beautifully maintained and recently renovated, rooms have views out over the garden, hard to believe you're in the middle of a city of 15 million. If you have New Otani Club card you may get some nice perks like restaurant discounts. Great location, abt 5 min walk to Akasaka metro station and easy taxi to Shinjuku or Tokyo stations. But note they are quite strict about check in times and will not usually check you in until 2pm. The hotel has numerous helpful and attentive hostesses who always do their best to help you with anything.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Checking in was a breeze! Hotel staff are at your beck and call! So many restaurants to choose from, do not miss the ricotta pancakes at the Satsuki restaurant, they are sheer bliss! The Breakfast buffet was always an adventure, many choices, try them all! Our Garden Tower room was clean and quiet. The bed was large but a little too hard for me! Very close to the subway system. Getting around was a breeze! Hotel staff are very happy to help with excursion reservations or subway direction. We stayed for 5 nights and would go back again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A group of 8 women from different countries stayed in Hotel New Otani to attend the WAW Conference (September 2014). We enjoyed all the facilities especially the beautiful garden, slept well and enjoyed the variety of restaurants. We felt well looked after by staff and found the hotel convenient for metro travel to other parts of Tokyo. Val Devenish, Pretoria, South Africa.
user_name:
Val D
Pretoria, Gauteng, South Africa

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main has always been my 2nd home whenever I visit Tokyo since year 1999. I am lucky to be able to enjoy the special promotion rate for the 50th anniversary of the hotel during my recent vacation trip to visit my friends in Tokyo. I enjoyed the free breakfast @ Nadaman and Satsuki and the free wifi during my stay. I like the comfy and bigger rooms in The Main which are always kept tidy and clean throughout my stay. Location is convenient for getting to anywhere in Tokyo which saves me a lot of travel time during a short trip. The access to Narita Airport via airport limousine is extremely helpful ! In addition, I took a walk in the Japanese Garden which is really refreshing with a waterfall offering free negative ions !!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We had a very enjoyable and relaxing stay at this hotel. We stayed in the Zen section, which are levels 11 and 12 of the main building. The service was excellent. The rooms were modern and had a great feeling. We had breakfast each day in the Garden View cafe, overlooking a beautiful waterfall and bridge. The hotel is located near three subway stations. We walked in the evening to an area north west of Yotsuya Station for good local restaurants, where all the patrons were locals. The hotel had a great selection of restaurants too. I can't say whether the non-zen rooms are off the same high standard.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Unless you must stay here, don't. It is incredibly overpriced and not really convenient but by train. The adjacent St. Sophia University does not otherwise create a college town area. The hotel rooms are also exceedingly small, having been constructed in 1964 for the Olympics. It has been updated but still feels like old Las Vegas. Since both the Metro and the JR station are just minutes away, you can stay elsewhere and walk.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I agreed with the recent poster who described this hotel said "old and tired". I don't believe this hotel is worth much of my time in terms of writing a detailed report but I will advise my key points after a recent stay.I have stayed here dozens of times over the past two decades but only when it was due to convenience of location.The New Otani has a wonderful centuries old garden on site and a good location but this does not overcome the failure to update the rooms with current high level standards of competitors.A showcase hotel for the 1964 Olympics, without an updating, this hotel will be an "also ran" property for the 2020 Olympics. The hotel now caters to large tour groups that create choke points in lobbies and in restaurants.The business traveler to the general area would be better served by the Imperial, the Okura or the Peninsula. I have have stayed each of these hotels and would rank all of them above the current state of the New Otani. If your tour group books you there it will be ok for a night or two but while I keep waiting for improvements, my hopes have only been met with disappointment.The gym is VERY limited but the area is good for running. The internet is fair.A dated offering for the traveler with high standards.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The room I had was clean and spacious. I also had great views over the garden - I was on the 14th floor. The breakfasts were great too - I would go for breakfast near the main entrance of the hotel. The gardens were very well kept and steeped with history. I would stay again for my next business trip. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. I understand that you may have to pay extra to use the pool. However - if you join the hotels club (which is free) the pool is free. I didn't eat there in the evening - but I did have a few drinks in their revolving restaurant. I would recommend a visit there - it's at the top of the main. There are also good views at the restaurant at the top of the Tower too. You can have breakfast up there too - which I would recommend to soak up the views - however the other restaurant has more choices for breakfast - for the same price. By the way to join the hotel club - just go on line.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: i have been here a dozen of times, always for work. The location works great for me... but the place needs a refresh, to say the least.
