My request for a late check-out, due to a midnight flight, was turned down immediately without any effort to accommodate.Though i have started looking at other hotel options, I may return to the New Otani in future out of habit and for its location, which I'm used to from four years I spent living in the area in the 1990s. But it could be managed so much better and realize a much higher potential. Chotto zannen desu ne....

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located very close to a busy metro station. The hotel rooms are a nice size and offer amenities like free wi-fi and Shisheido bath products. The breakfast buffet is a little expensive but a good value for the price. The staff at the hotel are very helpful, always polite and pleasant.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The rooms in this hotel were nothing to write home about, but the Japanese gardens on the property were beautiful. The location was also ideal, being close to many restaurants and the metro. Their breakfast was terrible though. I was so glad when we left that I did not have to have their breakfast again. I would also stay away from their "in room" Japanese style massage. It was the worst that I have ever had. All in all, it was not horrible, but there were definitely things that needed work.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Whatever you are in Tokyo for, this location would be right! Business, shopping, travel, you name it...Great staff... extremely helpful. I had several concerns since it was my first time to this hotel...but had no challenges AT ALL. Everything went absolutely seamlessly... More than adequate options for food...no concern there as well...Surprised (a bit disappointed) though with their membership program!!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is located at a most ideal and convenience place, with easy access to major stores, a wide range of good restaurants and metro stations. The facilities are also excellent, and there are a number of high-quality restaurants inside. However, the services provided at the concierge were rather disappointing, as the representatives at the desk had the tendency of providing the requested information at the absolute minimum, and I had to often ask follow-up questions to get the information that I needed. I was also terribly disappointed when I could not find the room key and asked for a replacement. They could not automatically cancel the key (it was not a card key), and due to security reasons (anybody can use and go up to guest rooms), they asked me to change a room. As it was around 11 p.m. when they asked me to do so, and I was totally exhausted after a long day, I was not at all happy. I was hoping that they could come up with better solutions to help me. For the price that I paid, I thought that the customer services were not adequate.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights on business but through a weekend. Rooms are good and spacious with good amenities. Breakfast is a US style buffet and fine. Staff are very helpful and knowledgable. Good location easy to metro and CBD. Restaurants and bars are all a bit outdated and traditional. We tried to go to the sky bar and were fairly rudely turned away as it was full at 8pm on Sunday night! For business I recommend it as it all functions well and is well located.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is a truely beautiful hotel with its own manicured Japanese garden. The Executive room was huge, decorated in a nice modern Japanese style, with all amenities, very nice and elegant bathroom with lots of towels and branded cosmetics. The mattress is actually quite hard - some people may not like that but i didnt mind.The view from 12th floor was stunning - including the Tokyo Tower and even Mount Fuji! The hotel garden is beautiful and quite large. It boasts a waterfall, large fish population, numerous places of worship and of culinary delight. The restaurant on the top floor of the Main is also something else - the dining part rotating 360 degrees round a numer of bufets to chose from. Very nice both for the view by night and for the variety of food. The food itself was good but not extraordinary.The staff is very attentive and speaks good English. Altogether a great stay, pity it was only 2 nights!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My husband and I recently enjoyed two stays at the New Otani. We had a large room that included a generous breakfast buffet. Service here is excellent and the hotel is centrally located with subway stops nearby. Being members of the Otani club, we were able to have a late check out. We will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed for 8 nights in the Main building. Lovely big room with great service that could not be faulted. However the resturants and bars are seriously overpriced. 2 glasses of wine at one of the bars on the ground floor $38 AUD !!! and that included a service fee !! Also the smell of Cigarettes in the lobby and hallways was nauseating. We had a non smoking room which was great. The location is great, right next door to the train line and many many resturants and shops.. The staff were fantastic, and nothing was too much trouble.Would stay again, just for the location...

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed at the New Otani twice now. Generally it is a great hotel. Very well maintained in art deco style with well trained polite staff. The rooms are clean and the linen is good. Bathrooms are very small however and generally in need of an update. The location is excellent and the breakfast is OK. Nothing great with a mix of western and Japanese items on buffet.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Amazing experience! Rooms are well equipped with excellent services. Breakfast at the revolving restaurant gave us superb view of the city. The garden is a must see! On the whole, it was a memorable experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I first stayed here over 20 years ago and then it was lovely. today it is just as formal and badly needs updating. The room in the Main was a good size and the bed comfortable but the bathroom was very dated. The shower is in the bath. the free wifi was nice.  I like the options for at least some sort of less outrageously expensive restaurants. Breakfast was included in the room rate. The breakfast buffet was ok but not great. Lacked cereal such as granola or muesli and very limited selection of fresh fruit.There is a gym in the Main and one in the Tower. They are both small and for such an expensive hotel rather inadequate. the one in the main has no free weights and neither gym has any weight machines. I have lovely memories of this hotel from a prior era and it saddens me that they have not updated it.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel New Otani offers great central location in a park setting complete with koy pond, waterfalls, and peaceful surroundings. Stayed in 1999 in the Garden Tower, revisited in 2013 in The Main, and rooms great both times, overlooking the Crown Prince's Royal Palace. Great rooftop breakfast. Overall impeccable service, with perfectly polite staff very capable in Japanese and English.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Fantastic hotel. Great location. Friendly staff. Delicious breakfast. Only thing that I wish were different: that the staff spoke better English. It can be frustrating. I walked into a Marriott and the staff there were more fluent in English - I think New Otani can get there if they make it a priority. Arigato!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed here a few times and have found it to be your typical Japanese style grand hotel with excellent service but very aged rooms. Perhaps grand in the 1980s/1990s but now cannot compare to the newer chains in Tokyo. Unfortunately, the price does not necessarily reflect this.Rooms were comfortable but not amazing. Everything just felt in need of a refresh.Service was good (and room service was tasty and good value). Location can be good depending what your purpose is in Tokyo.I would suggest avoiding the garden wing which feels inferior.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is luxurious but a bit dated and stuffy. The gardens are beautiful. The restaurants and shops are very expensive. However, then nearby Akasaka neighborhood is full of good places to eat. Because it is so large and set back from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo, The New Otani is a good place to ease into the city.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great staff and service and excellent location for getting around by foot or taxi or metro. Food at the hotel is first rate with a wide variety of food types. Also many good restaurants in the area. Rooms are good size and have all the amenities. The breakfast buffet is good and the view of the garden is wonderful. I have stayed in at least six other fine hotels in Tokyo but this one is the best.
user_name:
John D
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel is near the train station Akasaka, very close to business area. Many lines connected to Akasaka station. The hotel provided very good service, the room is small, smilar as other tokyo hotel, but the hotel is quite big. BTW, the mileage program is good.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Great hotel very close to the Akasaka metro station.Very friendly staff & very high quality restaurants, The view from the rotating 40th floor restaurant is amazing, and the buffetis fresh & inviting.Breakfast is superior; both Japanese & Western dishes; fresh and prepared to your order.<magnificent view from hotel room; standard size is 26 m2 which is small to European standard, but this is Tokyo:) Incredible view of the Mt. Fuji is breathtaking.Wonderful Japanese garden with fantastic Kobe-meat restaurant.Only negative is that dust accumulated in rooms (typically on tables); otherwise very clean rooms & bathrooms.ATM-machine in basement does not accept foreign credit cards; a small hazzle to find ATMs that did; the best tip is Citibank, 10 min on foot from hotel.Lots of small bars & sushi places near the Akasaka station; all reasonable prized.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Good services, location and restaurants. it has western style with Japanese authentic trad atmosphere. very elegant. Absolutely no complains, but i wanted just little something more. it has pretty Japanese garden too.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is the first hotel I ever stayed at in Japan, it is huge.. The grounds are beautiful and the service is outstanding. Many of the staff speak English so you can get around easy there. It seemed like I walked a half mile to get to my room when I checked in. It was really a great experience staying there and would do it again in a minute. This is great, when I was there I was traveling to and from several different cities. I had checked out and was gone for about a week and was returning at the New Otani for a few days before I left to go back to the states. When I was there the last time I left a few personal items travel clock, flash light etc. I figured they were gone. But I called the front desk at like 2:00 a.m. in the morning just to see if there were any chance they might still have them. This is the truth, in less than two minutes someone was at my door with a paper bag with my name on it with all my stuff in it. I was amazed, so amazed I tipped the guy $20. You have to love the Japanese.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Big hotel with a nice view of garden, resto and shop around the hotel. The room is typical of japanese small n low ceiling. Very nice and friendly staff around. Breakfast dont have much variety. Convenient place, i think hotel area is in the mid of the city. The price is quite expensive. Near to akasaka ( so many resto n shop around) carefull with the aggressive girl around there. Lol.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The new Otani Hotel is a great hotel to stay. It is about 300 meters from Nagatacho Station and easy to find.Check in was quick, courteous and efficient, rooms were clean, fresh, pleasant.The hotel is fairly big, has a pool, various shops and restaurants.I must say that it is an expensive hotel, but great. I can certainly recommend it if you are not on a budget.What I can't recommend however is the Bella Vista Restaurant in the Hotel. The service is 'OK' (but OK in Tokyo is still very good compared to other places) but the quality of the food I found disappointing to say the least. It is an expensive restaurant and I expected better service and nbetter tasting food.Don get me wrong, both the service and the food were not horrible, but definitely subpar for Tokyo and subpar for that price. Venture out of the hotel to eat, there is better to find

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel standard is fantastic! The rooms are excellent large in size and well maintained! The staff are fantastic and the service is exceptional! The hotel shops have most things any tourist / business traveler would need.The restaurants are fantastic for breakfast lunch or evening meals. I could recommend this hotel to anyone wishing nice rooms, food and fantastic service.. One thing to remember is he size of he hotel. If you are In the tower it can take 15-20 mins to get to front door or reception.It's only a five minute walk to the merest tube station and dozens of nice cheap (for Tokyo) restaurants.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times but this was the first time at their Zen Floor in the Main. The service and room are fabulous. To name a few, big room, bath products from Salvatore Ferragamo, beautiful view and a lounge which offers during the whole day snacks or drinks.The restaurants at the hotel are worth a visit, they are pricey but have a special setting. The hotel is situated near Akasaka and you have easy access to all parts of this wonderful city. Will stay next again at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed in the New Otani Garden Tower last year and we repeated this August in The Main. Both stays were absolutely great, comfortable, convenient and as we expected. We specially appreciated the staff of the hotel, that made great effort to make our stay a great one. We will surely stay here again if we ever visit Tokyo again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Perfect location right by the metro and the famous ramen noodle street. Staff were reasonably helpful and the garden is absolutely beautiful to walk through. There are many restaurants at the hotel, we wanted to go for the sky lounge but got there 5 minutes before they were meant to close and they had already closed so missed out.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was large, comfortable, with all modern amenities. All of the service was warm and helpful. Breakfast overlooking the gardens was a real treat and being able to walk through them afterwards was fantastic. In addition, although not a Japanese experience,, having dinner on the 40th floor of the Garden Tower, at an excellent Italian restaurant, Bella Vista, overlooking Tokyo at night, made 2 Italophiles very happy.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Even though the hotel is centrally located in Tokyo, it is surrounded by beautiful greenery, including a nice Japanese garden for nice walks. My room was spacious and comfortable and had a gorgeous view (see picture), but others do face the ugly paved parking lot in front of the hotel. The pillows were horrendously hard, but I called housekeeping and they brought me a very comfortable Tempurapedic pillow. I had problems with the TV a couple of times during my stay and housekeeping had to send someone to repair it each time. The gym is very small and poorly equipped. They don't even have bottles of water, which seems cheap for a hotel of this category. The one elliptical machine that they had was broken (see picture), and it all seemed in need of a refresh. This was disappointing to me.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani has a great location and the main building has relatively spacious rooms with all the amenities. A wonderful place for breakfast or lunch, too, is the Garden Cafe, overlooking the garden waterfall. Take some time to wander through the gardens! They're over 400 years old....

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is probably the biggest hotel I've ever been two and it is one of Tokyo's posh hotels. It consists of several buildings with lots of nice restaurants and shops. The hotel is conveniently located close to a metro station, and the metro is very easy to navigate. The hotel's Japanese garden is just beautiful. I din't get a non smoking room upon arrival, something that worried me. However, the so called deodorizing actually worked satisfactory. Room was nice enough, but bathroom slightly outdated. Service is always good in Japan. Breakfast is very nice, but not all breakfast venues were open early in the morning, which was a bit unpractical. Would defininitely want to stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Close to restaurants and convenience stores. Central location within a quick walk to the Akasakamitsuke Station made it easy to access the extensive subway system. Also found the Yotsuya Station convenient when using our Japan Rail Pass to travel on the local JR trains in Tokyo metro.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I always stay at the New Otani and have done now for several years. The tower is a little dated, but the rooms in the Main are comfortable and well-equipped. Service here is always excellent and breakfast in the Satsuki restaurant is one of the best I have had anywhere. My only gripe this stay is that I came down at 6.15 am for my breakfast as I was catching a flight home, but I had to stand in line for a very long time - over 30 mins, consequently I had to really rush. I think a group was checking out, but when I got seated I noticed tables were available but that there were not enough staff to clear and rest them quickly. The hotel needs to look at this as two more staff would have made the situation much better. The daimyo's garden and carp ponds around which the hotel is built is a real treat and a retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. Another big plus at the New Otani is its pricing - it compares very favourably to other hotels of this class. Disagreeing with a previous poster, the subway is conveniently near with access to several subway lines. Perfect for me.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel is lovely, with well kept grounds and near several useful subway lines, and the service is excellent. For the tourist (as I was), the location is central, but the hotel itself is not really very near anything very interesting - it's in a business district. So one has to take the subway to go most places. That's probably true for most hotels though.
user_name:
pyreflies
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here on business trip, the hotel complex is huge ans confusing, pricey. Room was dated and tired looking. quite a hike to the nearest subway. the high point of my stay was the Mt Fuji view from my window on a clear day. also visible from the upstairs breakfast lounge. very nice!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spent 4 days at the New Otani with my family. Met my very high expactations. While busier than I had imagined - - they do a lot of weddings - - it was never crowded or harried. The service was impeccable. The gardens were beautiful. The overall location was central and convenient. While not cheap, it was excellent value. Given that I wanted my family to experience Japan, it was ideal - - better than staying in a US-branded hotel. I would recommend it highly.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have spent much time in Japan over the last 20 years on business related issues . Much of this time spent in Tokyo . Over this time I have stayed in a number of hotels in Tokyo - some good , some not so good . None of them however particularly memorable - with the exception of the New Otani . In a world where every hotel looks like the last the New Otani stands out as offering the client a substantially different environment . It retains it's old world charm and consistently supplies first class service . It's position is also ideal logistically . Is one of the few hotels I look forward to staying in . The last visit no different to any other - consistently good service in a unique environment . Don't change .

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the New Otani Hotel - The Main from June 6, 2013 to June 9, 2013. I wasn't sure what to expect as it seemed like two hotels in one. However, the service was excellent. The staff was super polite and very helpful. The room on the 10th floor was spacious and very comfortable for both of us. Attention to detail is everywhere. The breakfast buffet is quite large and satisfying. We had dinner once at the hotel as we didn't feel like going out. It was ok. The hotel's location is great. The Imperial Palace is about a 30 minutes walk from the hotel if you don't mind walking. There are various train/subway stations within walking distance too. We used the Akasaka-Mitsuke station to move around. Between the Garden Tower and The Main there is a nice looking Japanese Garden with a waterfall. A good place to relax, meditate, or contemplate. Another advantage of staying here is that the limousine bus from Narita Airport will drop you off at the hotel. It takes at least about an hour to get to the hotel. The cost is 3,000 yen one way. The hotel complex is huge as there are many retail stores between the two buildings (Garden Tower and The Main). We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: One of the most well appointed hotels in Tokyo in the Akasaka area, well connected with trains and subways. This hotel has a wonderful Japanese garden which itself is a fantastic tourist attraction. With large lobby and a wonderful Tower and Main wing, this hotel truly delivers to the expectation of a 5 star property. The staff is as usual very very helpful and the breakfast is well spread.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We got a few good nights' sleep here and didn't pay too much (thanks, devalued yen!). But what I remember most about the New Otani is what a sad, dated hotel complex this is. The "Main" Tower was built in 1964 and I LOVE that time period architecturally. I think this place was a stunner back then. It's been selectively updated, but mostly neglected. As in, wildly. This chain isn't very current in Japan, and I don't think they can or really want to bring the hotel back to its former glory. I don't regret staying here, but would NEVER ever do it again.We reserved a room in the "Main" part of the hotel... which is the original 17-story tower dating back to 1964 (with three wings spreading from an elevator bank. Very Vegas, pre-Vegas). The exterior has been recently re-clad in new, soundproofed glass (it really works), so from the exterior, the tower looks fresher than it really is. The car entrance/lobby area has been remodeled, too, as have the hallways and elevator banks. The rooms, however, are only semi redone. Ours featured new carpeting and drapes, half new/half old furniture, surprisingly hard mattresses, an old gilded mirrored dressing area and a tiny, FUNKY, circa 80's pink-tiled bathroom with a raised floor that's up 2 inches off the bedroom floor (for drainage, I presume?). Let's just say the room looks WAY better in pictures.When we checked in very late on a Saturday during "Golden Week"... kind of like Japanese Spring Break... our initial encounter with a front desk clerk was very pleasant and he was really nice and formal in that wonderful Japanese way. However, when we came down to switch rooms for a better view (turns out we couldn't that night), the next clerk was a total jerk (I would have got his name, but I was too tired... he did wear glasses). He really didn't want to help us until the original clerk came over to see what was up. I wasn't expecting that in Japan. And quite frankly, it was the only time during our whole stay we encountered anyone even vaguely rude. The best part of Japan is how considerate and polite people are when you deal with them. (I wouldn't want to live there because of how regimented it is, but it's great for a visit).Thought we booked a deluxe room, we settled for a downgrade (unbeknownst to us) to a "standard" room that we actually liked a lot better. It was the width of two rooms with floor to glass windows. Stunning, really. Best part of the hotel by far. Most rooms are single width in a typical railroad car design. We spent a lot of time having cocktails while admiring the view of Shinjuku.We went to great lengths to get that view (turns out it's the one they feature in their ads and website). We originally asked for a Japanese Garden view... we didn't get one anyway. Not many of the hotel rooms look out on Shinjuku, but the higher ones in the wing facing the parking lot and car entrance do. A parking lot view sounds bad, but go for it. You'll get a really nice park/Shinjuku skyline/sunset vista. I could see even see Mount Fuji when I squeezed against one wall and pushed my face to the glass (I obviously didn't see it a lot as a result). Still, it was all covered in snow and quite beautiful.The main problem with our stay was the "Main" hotel is connected to its "newer" tower, dubbed the "Garden Tower" for no reason. It is beyond dated. (It's listed on TA as a separate hotel. It's a separate world, full of bus tour guests). There's NO excuse for not remodeling it since 1983. Seriously, it hasn't been touched in 30 years. (Or, if it has, they've only done little tweaks that make it look sadder and cheaper). The shopping "mall" that connects the two is really antiquated, too... with horrible sparkly $20 T-shirt shops and oddly pricey jewelry stores, manned by the original owners from 1964. They look really tired, as does the mall. You just cannot believe how ugly the carpeting between the towers is. And the light fixtures. And the weird stucco arches. And the weird green granite seating areas along the corridor. The main restaurant overlooking the Japanese garden features a bright burgundy and, again, green decor. It is just so unbelievably depressing to walk past it every day. It's like you're stuck in a really ugly time warp.The exterior around the garden is falling apart. The garden itself is pretty and well-maintained, but once you've taken a walk through it, you're done. The fitness center is a joke. Tiny. No weights. The business center next door, however, has free internet connection on PCs. The very nice women running it will charge you about 40 cents to print your boarding pass, however.This hotel, courtesy of its large ballroom, meeting spaces and vast parking lot, still gets a lot of high-end events. It's oddly fun to watch the huge entrance in action when there's a big shindig going on. It reminded me of the Beverly Hilton in BH.The New Otani was built as a city unto itself right before the Tokyo Olympics in '64... so it's not close to ANYTHING new, charming or interesting. If you venture from the hotel to the subway, though the Akasake-Mitsuke station is closer, it's in a less appealing area (though by no means even remotely dangerous). I'd recommend heading north to Yotsuya station instead. It's on the same line, it's a nicer stroll and in a way better-looking residential/commercial area. There is a good McDonald's and Starbucks right by the Akasake-Mitsuke station, however, which is where we had breakfast every day. Wifi at the hotel was free in the lobby. Less convenient than in the room, but nevertheless, free. Just ask for the ID and password at the front desk. We never bothered with the restaurants or bars in the hotel, or with room service. They were pricey and honestly, I'm not sure what the quality would be. There is a Tour D'Argent (the only branch outside Paris) in the mall... a sign of the hotel's original status, no doubt. However, I'm not sure why you'd want to eat there.Ultimately, this is just an old workhorse hotel that's been paid off forever and is too big to make really good. I suppose they're trying, but it's too little and much too late. Our experience wasn't bad as much as depressing. The rest of Tokyo is so bright and shiny and incredibly up-to-date, we were bummed about our choice of hotel here.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We stayed at the Executive Floor. Room is decent size with small bathroom and basic facilities. the floor has been recently renovated. The price is VERY high for what you get. The executive lounge is small and you have to pay to bring any guest. they serve only pistachio and potato chips. for one hour per day they can stretch one small mozzarella or 2 shrimps to prepare a dish of finger food. so stingy i have never seen before. You have to pay to use the pool. you have to pay extra to use the kids playground (60 dollars). Restaurant close early and you cannot bring kids after dark. Once you get to the ground lobby is like going out from a time machine! You find yourself in the 70'. everything looks decent but really not cool. Garden is decent but after you have seen it you are not going to go back. not suitable for kids. To go to the metro you have to go through a looooong corridor and it really takes a long walk and few elevators to get actually out of the hotel. from the exit the metro is 10 minutes walk. There is nothing to see in walking distance.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past 20 years and it combines excellent location, beautiful gardens, wide array of restaurants and excellent service. The rooms, however, in both the main building and the Garden Court building are a bit small and a little dated would be my only complaint. Still, it is an oasis in a vast city and the service is so good as is the location to major points of interest and business in Tokyo (with a major subway stop just a block away). I recommend applying in advance for a New Ortani Club card if you come to Japan with frequency (no cost) as it gives you additional benefits including a discount on meals at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have stayed at the New Otani for years and this was a nice stay. I'm a member of the New Otani Club and suggest those who visit frequently to join for a faster check in and other benefits. The Main was a great stay. Great room and great Shiseido bathroom amenities. If you love to work out, well, welcome to Japan. The so called gym is pitiful, BUT if you love to run like me you can get a running map and do some great running loops. Breakfast at the Japanese restaurant in the Main is amazing if you love sushi and Asian style breakfast. Eating dinner at the hotel is ridiculously expensive and not recommended. If you know how to work this hotel, its a great place to stay in Japan.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Seriously in need of a refurbishment ~ seems there have been no changes since the days of Tiger Tanaka. Stayed in the garden tower which is newer apparently. The room was a good size and the bed was great. However the bathroom still had that plastic Japanese hotel kit feel about it and the carpet had seen much better days. Plus the Tv channels available are rubbish unless you really like watching local tv. Which I can tell you is absolute rubbish. No WiFi unless you come to the lobby which is ridiculous for a 5 star hotel. On the plus side the location is great as it is right beside Akasaka. Easy to get to most places you are likely to need or want to go to. The service is great ~ the staff are excellent. Especially Itoh San at reception..... Wow!And the gardens are fantastic. If you stay definitely go and take a look.Overall a good value hotel compared to the likes of the Hyatt and Ritz Carlton but they really do need to spend some cash brining it into the 21 century.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel when we were all in Tokyo and were very pleased. We live in the USA and travelled with our three kids (5, 8 and 11 yrs old). Toshi, the very polite manager, noted that we were booked to stay in the hotel for seven nights. He took the initiative and contacted us, and asked us if we would like to upgrade. He told us the room was in the smoking section. We went to investigate (he was kind enough to let us go and see what we thought) and the room was spotless and smelled great. Instead of two beds, we now had three. One single and two doubles. We also had an incredible view and a very useful desk (which my husband, who really was in Tokyo for work, was grateful for! The kids and I were tagging along). The hotel has many wonderful features. 1. It is right next to the subway-which we used every single day! 2. It has gorgeous gardens 3. The staff is courteous and very helpful 4. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants but it does have a store within the hotel that was so helpful. We could buy fresh fruit and snacks there for the kids. After walking around all day that was a blessing. Additionally, near the subway there is a cute street with tons of restaurants. Ranging from Japanese food to a Subway and McDonalds. In short, this hotel was convenient, comfortable and very clean. It is maybe not the most trendy hotel out there, but it is very pretty, esp bec of the lovely gardens. I highly recommend for families that need enough room for sleeping, suitcases, and to even have a nice couch to stretch out on at the end of the day!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: i stayed in Main bulding property is old, however rooms are well maintained and considered how much I paid and their value is excellent.I love their location, easy access to JR and subway stations.i had a package included daily breakfast, New Otani Tokyo offers variety of venue so that I didn't have to eat at same restaurant for my 5 nights stay there.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: My third time staying at New Otani. Staff are very friendly and helpful hotel has a a lrge choice of eating places and bars. Eating is not cheap by any means but after a long flight with jet lag you dont need to go outside of the hotel. Stay in the Main nice bedroom with king size bed, tooth brush, slippers and hair brush all there. Great view fron 14th floor over Tokyo. Check out the gardens and restaurant in the gardens.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A very big hotel but well kept with an outstanding service (as almost everywhere in Japan).A special remark about the position which is the simply perfect: very central and close to many attractions like restaurants and bars, but at the same time very quiet thanks to the beutiful garden surrounding the Hotel.Dont miss to pay a visit to the traditional japanese garden, inside the hotel's park

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani is not dripping with over-the-top luxurious appointments, but you'll be more than comfortable in the spare, relatively large (for Japan) well-thought out rooms. Its hard to describe, but the fixtures, lighting, deep bathtubs are perfect for recovering from a long flight or day of business. With lots of competition in Tokyo, the New Otani especially excels at service. From the fabulous welcome on arrival, to very present management and helpful staff in all of the public areas, the New Otani is an easy place for newbies to Japan from which to explore. No matter what you need, want to know more about - in English or Japanese - New Otani staff go all out to help you. The main hotel restaurant has some Western style food - and despite our initial sticker shock at menu prices is a relatively good deal compared to other restaurants in Tokyo. With all that Tokyo has to offer, I wouldnt recommend eating there regularly but breakfast is good and the main restaurant is perfect when you've just arrived after a long flight and need to eat and then sleep.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I hope the title does not offend. We had an excellend stay at the New Otani Tokyo, as part of our 12 day trip to Japan. As an American (standing at 6'4"), I was really worried about the accomodations, and it was especially important as we were travelling with an elderly and an infant. We wanted adjoining, and smoke free rooms were a must. The location is great, I am not really sure about some of the comments saying it is "not convenient". I am sure the definition is fairly subjective, but the subway is about a 5 minute walk, and to the JR line is about 10 mins - you are not going to find too much better, or if you do, you are certainly going to pay. Some recommendaitons are: to have better work out facilities (and not at the $40 USD charge (I did not use, I chose to run outside instead), and to have more "English" channels. Other than that, you are not going to find too many other comparable hotels. Service was excellent. Oh, and if you are in the US, use their NYC office to communicate - they are very helpful!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Excellent service, room is not big, but easy for working.it charged if you work out in gym and use the pool. breakfast was excellent in 40th floor. nearby lots of sakura in Apr. transportation is good near Akasaka if you'd like to take train. many stores in the hotel but very expensive. Family Mart near the hotel

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This is my first time staying at New Otani. Services provided by the staff was excellent. But location was not too convenient, it's quite a walk to subway and JR line especially if you were carrying a lot of stuff. The only problem I had was with the courier counter there, it was quite busy and I was in a rush, so it took a long time for my stuff to get sent. The concierge was very helpful in directing me around my business meetings. Overall it was a very pleasant experience.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed in this hotel with my family for a vacation for 1 week. The hotel is very clean and comfortable with large rooms( compared to other Japanese hotels) and has a very beautiful garden. It is located not far from subway station. The main disadvantages of the hotel are the followings: 1- It is extreamly expensive for the value. You shoud pay over 300 Euros per night and you are still to pay for breakfast and internet as extra charges!. 2-Some debit and credit cards like Maestro is not accepted!. So at the check in , I am surprized and rather disappointed when I am asked to give two times of total price of my stay as cash for deposit!. And it was 7 millition Yen! due to a miscalculation of the reception desk!. 3-Poor english speaking ability of the staff is another disadvantage of the hotel. I asked for the internet in the room and at the lobby and I am told that it is only by payment and is not free, while after few days I noted that it is free at the lobby and I got user name and password from another guest.4-Compared to other hotels in the world, the breakfast has very limited food variety and if you join the New Otani club you will get about 5US$ discount and it is still >17 US$!. If you like to have Egg you should pay extra!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just how good a stay one has at the New Otani really depends on the room one gets, and to some extent, the time of year one stays there. At it's best, this is an exceptionally good hotel; at worst, the experience is average.For a recent visit to Tokyo, I stayed at the New Otani for the first time in several years. Prior to that previous visit, I had occasion to stay at the New Otani perhaps 30 times over a 20 year period. Most previous stays were during business trips, but this last came at the end of a long trip of a personal nature. In most previous stays, I made very specific instructions regarding my rooms, but on this trip the booking was made with a view to obtaining a good room rate. The result, predictably, was a twin room on a lower floor of the garden tower that was in serious need of updating. Rooms in the garden tower can be a bit cramped, and this feeling is magnified by the layout of the twin rooms. Also, rooms between the 21st and 27th floors tend to leave one spending a great deal of time waiting for elevators, especially in the morning when there is a rush of people trying to get to the restaurant on the top floor for breakfast.My stay this time was adversely affected by a couple of other factors. First, it was the beginning of Spring Break in Japan, and the hotel was quite crowded. Second, the hotel management had decided that this would be a good time to rebuild some of the elevators. On the morning I checked out, it took over 30 minutes before I could get an elevator from the 22nd floor, by which time a small crowd of guests piled into an elevator going up, so we would at least be part of the pack in the lift going down.All this said, there is still much to recommend about the New Otani Tokyo. It is an enormous hotel with rooms in the Main and in the Garden Tower. There is a long concourse connecting the two and each has its own reception. It does take a few minutes to walk from one end to the other. There are a large number of shops, bars and restaurants in the New Otani complex, and the Garden Tower end is only a few minutes walk from the Akasaka entertainment district. The nearby Akasaka Mitsuke subway station is served by 4 or 5 of Tokyo's subway lines, and it is a 1500 or 1600 yen taxi ride from Tokyo Station for those who do not want to drag their bags onto the subway. In short, few hotels are better located, whether for business or pleasure.Service at the New Otani is impeccable. I will give it 4 out of 5 for the current visit only because of the situation with the elevators. The staff are about as well trained as they come. An example: a few years ago, I stayed at the Four Seasons Shanghai; by the time I reached the reception counter at check in, the woman at the counter had my registration sheet ready, and greeted me by name with a smile and a bow. It turns out she had previously worked at the New Otani and remembered me.The breakfast buffet in the Tower Restaurant and in the Garden Buffet were always as good as they come. I did not avail myself of it this time, in part because the cost of the buffet was not included in my room rate and it is rather pricey. Still, on walking by the Garden Restaurant in the morning, it appeared that the spread has lost none of its excellence.Internet is free, but rooms in the tower only allow access by LAN cable which is a problem if your computer does not take a LAN cable (such as the MacAir). Wifi is available in the lobby.I will happily stay at the New Otani on future visits, but I will remember to be more specific about the room requirements.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: What a beautiful hotel! We stayed here two nights and enjoyed the gardens and one of the restaurants onsite, which had teppanyaki made by your own personal chef in front of you. The staff were friendly and helpful. The other tower has a lot of shops and several places to eat. The size of the hotel and shops almost caused me to get a bit lost, but the staff were always helpful.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Main reason to stay here is the historical Japanese garden. Actually you don't need any other reason, but I can also add very good logistics for Tokyo; close to business and entertainment centers and to subway. Unbelievably good service for such a huge hotel. Good restaurant selection. Rooms are comfortable but bathrooms not so much. Make sure you eat your breakfasts at the Garden Lounge.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The best of the hotel was the good location - if you want to go from there in all the directions / parts of Tokio. What I did't liked was that the spa was not included in the roomprice. So I haven't seen the spa. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive, but there is a coffee shop, where we got our coffee in the morning.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed at the New Otani Main for 11 nights on a business trip. This is a good hotel for a business trip but if I were paying the bill, I'd look elsewhere. The room was much larger than expected and quite nice, although I didn't do much more than sleep and shower there. I was quite impressed with the hotel staff, all were extremely helpful for check in and whenever I needed assistance. The location was very convenient to the Asakasa area and the Tokyo subway system, which was just a couple of minutes outside the doors of the New Otani Garden Tower. Even though I wasn't footing the bill, the cost of all of the restaurants and bars was so high, even by Tokyo standards, that I didn't eat or drink there once. I was also very disappointed in the "gym" available in either the Main or the Garden Tower. For a huge hotel catering to many business travelers, you would think they could invest a few dollars on a decent selection of equipment. I've seen better facilities at very modest hotels in the U.S. At least there are some decent running routes nearby. Overall, a nice hotel but I may not return due to the expense of the hotel restaurants and the lack of exercise facilities.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed at this hotel from 9th Feb 2013 to 10th Feb 2013.I picked this place because of the location and the price.I tried to book global hotel brands such as Hilton, Hyatt, Mandarin Oriental, Shangrila and etc., however, the price was beyond my budget so I had to pick here.The hotel is very old inside and outside. I stayed at Main bldg but not the renovated deluxe room.standard twin had enough room for 2 adults and 1 child, 9 yrs old. I wanted the room with garden view but the hotel had too many guests. I guess it's because of Mitsukoshi Dept. sale in the hotel so I had to stay with the view of parking lots. A little disappointment.Staffs were very friendly though the uniform was really out of fashion and style.They have staff who can speak English very well, probably the best I've ever seen in my three visits to Japan. And there even was a staff who can understand and speak Korean as well. I bet she's a Korean but I didn't have time to ask or look at her name tag.The garden was not that big but everything you look for. The restaurants, fishes, pond, waterfalls, sand-garden and etc. We could even see a rainbow at the waterfall.Overall, a great hotel that can take you down to memory lane in Japanese mood.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Every -thing from the check-in to the check-out was beyond our expectation.Location, services ,comfort and food were excellent. A small example to highlight my comment.We stayed here for 4 nights . It was 2+2 i.e. we stayed 2 nights then checked out for 1 night in Kyoto and checked in again. We had left our luggage in the hotel . Even before we checked in again it was sent to our room. This speaks of the efficiency.Once again ,to enjoy Tokyo it is worth staying here.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Definitively the 50's. coming from a 5* hotel in Hong Kong this property was a real let down. Rooms are small, bathrooms tiny done in pink tile, a shower curtain, not even a glass enclosure. Storage space was limited. Room was not made up until late in the afternoon. There was a promotional price in effect so it was an ok value but were that not the case I would be unhappy. Breakfast buffet was just ok. On the plus side the omelette chef was an artist. Prices in the restaurants are quite high, but the view of Mt. Fuji couldn't be beat. Will definitely try something else the next time I'm in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed for 3 nights; it's an interesting, large, rambling place with an olde world feel and charm. There are heaps of restaurants (including at least one where there is a piano player/other musicians) and some good shops that are part of the hotel complex, and it's very close to Akasaka-mitsuke subway station which about five different lines run through. Taking the wrong exit from the station one evening I found a very vibrant night life area with bars and open air cafes etc. My room in the main building had great city and parkland views with Mt Fuji in the distance and also overlooking the hotel's own garden (400 year history). The staff were polite and attentive. The room was average size with the desk area a little small. The only real downside was having to pay for internet access, with a limited choice of 10 minutes, 24 hours or a week (whereas 1-2 hours per night would have suited my needs better).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for second time now. It has an excellent location with great view for the rooms. The hotel staff is very courteous and polite. Further, the hotel is very large as it has two buildings - The Main and Garden Tower, it offers various options for different restaurants and cuisines. The rooms might be little small but it is worth the location and service.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The view from the front desk and it's Koi Garden says it all about what to expect with the rooms that they havesimplly exclusive with room service given via small private door near the enterence of my room as not to disturb the peace of the tenanteven with the channels that i couldnt understand, who needs it if i can Laze about at the 4000 square feet of koi pond with HUGE fish to gaze upon(my room sre garden viiew) :Proom servece are presicehouse keeping are prompt breatfast : are refine ... 5 STAR

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: First of all, make sureyou are booked into the MAIN tower buildung, not at the garden tower. This building has not been renovated and its guest roosm are rather an impertimence to a visitor then a relaxing place to be! The rooms in the main buildung however are really nice and newly renovated and the size is ok for the rate!Both hoteltracks (main and garden tower) merge a large shopping and reception zone on the first floor, also what is convenient are the 4 more or less conected subway stations around the New Otani zone. In the middle of the hotel lies a beautufully shaped Japanees garden, worth a visit!Don't spend your money at the hotelbar for a drink! Its just exorbitantly expensive, not worth the cocktail or beer!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Used to be one of the best in Tokyo no longer though. Rooms can be small, desks too small to work on and staff in restaurant speaks limited English or none at all but very clean and staff polite Housekeeping is excellent. And large choice of restaurants in good location with subway lines very near
user_name:
andrewshka1121
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A functional hotel in a good location. It isn't cheap for what you get and it has a bit of a 1970's feel. The garden is very nice but the hotel itself is a little tired. The local area is quite good so I would rate the location of the hotel quite high. The breakfast was quite average but the staff are polite and efficient as you would expect.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: For the amount I paid, I wasn't particularly thrilled with this hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, and having a room at a high floor, I had a decent view. All in all, I've stayed at much nicer places for less, and I was surprised at the little things.Pro: Internet was free in my room via cable connection.Con: Wifi in my room wasn't free, and didn't work well in my room, so I wasn't able to connect my mobile device.Pro: Very comfortable bed.Con: You have to pay to use an ironing board and iron, and you can only have them in your room for an hour. I found this to be very strange frankly, and illogical if you hope to attract business travelers.There was a breakfast buffet that, while not that expensive and of reasonable quality, was extremely limited in it's selection, and offered no hot food options, so it felt a little disappointing.In general, I might look for other hotels in the area next time, but there was nothing about my stay that would cause me to avoid this place in the future.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: After travelling across Japan we stayed a last night in Tok¥o and chose the New Otani Hotel. A very bad choice! Check-in was fast- only arriving in the room we realised that they put us in a smoking room - even tough we wrote in the reservation that we needed a non smoking room. Going back to the reception, the lady was (unusal for Japan) very unfriendly. Stared for minutes into the screen then proposed us either to take a twin bed room or to pay extra for a non smoking double room!!! We were not very happy about this - and chose to take the twin room- with a view to the parking lot. The room was ok, but very small and the toilet standing in front of the bath tub- and no extra shower. All very worn out and out of date looking like from the 70ties. The hotel has only free WIFI in the Lobby. So lots of people were hanging around in the lobby to use free internet. Looked a bit cheap and like a camping area. As we stayed only one night and had to leave early in the morning I cant tell about the surroundings. It seems that the park and the jogging path are nice. When leaving the hotel, no concierge or bell boy helped us to get a taxi. This hotel won't see us again. We stayed for the same price in much better hotels in Tokyo with professional service and nice staff.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: After trying to find adjoining rooms in local/non-chain hotels in Tokyo, we finally turned to the New Otani. Although it was very large and hosted tour groups, airline crew and weddings, the location and service was very good and the multi-lingual staff made the stay easy. The many restaurants within the New Otani were tasty but very expensive. Decor was a little outdated but it was very convenient on all fronts.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Pros:- Incredible views from both towers (Sky Bar is turning while you eat, buffet overpriced though)- Hotel garden is one of the best gardens in Tokyo (popular wedding spot)- A "grand" hotel with shops, overnight laundry etc. - Good beds- Totally quiet - Japanese toilet seats with spray etc.- 30+ restaurants within the one hotel!!! Try the kobe meat at grill in the garden!- Friendly and professional staffCons: - Feels dated- No safe in the room- Rooms relatively basic, no thrills- Given a smoking room, despite asking for a non-smoking- No "do not disturb" sign to put on the door- Wifi rather expensive- Rooms very expensive - beyond value for money, and not the luxury that you would expect from the price tag- A rather long walk to the metro stations, nothing interesting in walking distance.Conclusion: Staid at New Otani for the last time. Will book something else next time with correlation between price and feel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A tad dated and musty, but a very attentive staff and fairly good room accomodations. A sprawling complex, with many dining choices, albeit subpar. Satuarted with small boutiques throughout the complex that fail to draw any noticeable customer traffic.While a capital spend on freshining up the hotel is overdue, it would not deter me from future bookings..
user_name:
URNYCritic
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Spent a week here at the main building. The room was comfortable and spacious though the bathroom was tiny. There are a lot of dining options here and a beautiful zen garden to unwind. It is close the stations and cabs are plentiful It's good for a business hotel and sufficiently central for one to explore the city. I had a good stay here and the service was excellent.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Verdict - good value but only if breakfast is included in the room rate. Ok if someone else is paying. You may feel a bit let down if you're on a personal trip.Summary: This is a huge, sprawling hotel, almost Soviet-Style in size, though not in opulence. You could get lost trying to negotiate the various entrances and exits. The rooms are fairly dated but perfectly adequate. And you will get your first experience of the legendary Japanese toilets (!). But it is well situated with easy access to the Tokyo subway system. The service is impeccable and everything you've heard about. No major gripes so a safe bet.Top tip - for a reasonable noodle meal, try the noodle restaurant in the hotel. The average price is about Y1000-2000. This is near the elevators in the Tower wing. Also, if you want to blow your budget I would highly recommend the buffet in the Sky View (revolving restaurant) where the food comes to you, in time! I paid for breakfast on one day, and it was pretty poor, so best avoided.There is a plethora of restaurants but all of them very expensive (but then, what isn't in Tokyo?).

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: we stayed here for over a week. the hotel is very big and luxurious and rooms are very nice. the hotel has magnificent gardens and lots of restaurants and bars.It has a good location only minutes from the metro and near a great eating area. The staff will do anything to make you happy and the concierge is very helpful and breakfast is amazing - the best you will get in Tokyo. all in all had a lovely stay

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Just come back from a weekend in Tokyo and I stayed at the Hotel New OtaniHaving initially booked my room from Friday to Sunday, work commitments eventually made me change my booking so I emailed the hotel to let them know. Having arrived in Tokyo, I only just realised they never came back to me so I was sweating over a) did I have a room and b) were they going to charge me for the extra night (as I now needed Saturday to Monday). In typical Japanese fashion, they said it was no problem and just amended my booking on the day. That to me already out the guys on a level above as service to me is key!The room I was given was on 13th floor (1392) and its as far away from the lifts as you get. I deliberately requested this plus a high floor in advance and again they delivered; very happy. The ro itself was spacious with a decent sized cupboard for luggage/ clothes storage, a nice desk, a nice single seat sofa and a very large Panasonic plasma TV. And i had a nice view ofthe roof garden belie. The room was nicely decorated in neutral browns and greys so inoffensive but calming. The only weird thing was the bathroom. Now this was very old and in a very typical pod style ie pre-fabricated and stuffed in without much consideration for surrounding decor! I didn't manage to check out the gym or the restaurants but I can assume they would have all been to a very reasonable standard. Within close proximity are a number of metro lines makes this a very convenient location, especially for the price. Only real complaint is that lifts were very very slow but if you aren't in a rush, I guess it's a non-issue. Would recommend this place for value.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Theer is no doubt that this is one of the best of many hotels that I have been in. Sheer professionalism from the minute you get there. The prices are just simply horrendous though. It is perfectly situated, has good connections - a bus to the airport and near the fabulous Akasaka Palace. In the area there are many bars and restaurants. The grounds of the hotel are just magnificant. But I will never stay there again because of the experience of breakfast - although nice - just to full of people and forget any service - and it is just too expensive!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I have been using the New Otani fairly regularly for more than 20 years with most of my visits free to me as I was travelling on business. Now that I pay my own bills I have tried cheaper places but they just don't have the same class so I have bitten the bullet and pay the price. The refurbished Main building has brought the fabric up to modern standards, while remaining classy and understated. The New Otani doesn't do flash. The young women on reception are as charming as ever and almost everyone in the hotel, provided you don't speak as if to a native speaker, so keep it slow and clear, understands English well enough to help with whatever you desire.The wonderful garden marks the hotel out from everywhere else in the city and even in Kyoto there is nowhere where you can find an ancient and magnificent garden without leaving the hotel. The hotel is vast which some people may not like but on wet days it is possible to browse quite a range of shops without leaving the hotel. Restaurant prices are well beyond my purse but I can't resist having breakfast in the lounge that overlooks the garden. There is a good range of more reasonably priced restaurants close to the back exit of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: It is very convenient to stay in this hotel, many restaurants and shops available inside the building, an ancient Japanese garden, and a fantastic view on Tokyo if you have breakfast at the top floor (you are just above the royal family palace). There are always taxis available at the front door and excellent service from all the people working in the hotel. A very good patisserie at the entrance where you can buy a piece of cake and enjoy it in your room

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I loved the situation of this hotel - within about 300 metres of one of the best subway stations in Tokyo (Asakasa Mitsuke). With the aid of the fabulous subway (very easy to use, even for complete novices like ourselves), we zipped around Tokyo like veterans. Our room was excellent - plenty of storage space and one of those really great Japanese bathrooms. They weren't cheap, but then can you find a really good, cheap hotel in Tokyo, especially one so well-placed?Staff were constantly helpful and sufficiently fluent in English to ensure no problems.The hotel is on the Narita Airport shuttle bus service, which makes it easy and economical to get back to the Airport for your flight, with a dedicated airconditioned waiting room for you when you wait for the shuttle to arrive.As usual in Japan, unless money is no object, you wouldn't think of eating in the hotel. We ate throughout at the fabulous, reasonably priced noodle and ramen restaurants which abound in Tokyo.I would heartily recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: I had a reservation for Friday and Sunday nights. obviously I needed a Saturday night stay as well. Checked in at 13:00 Friday. I spent the next 24 hrs attempting to extend my reservation on Saturday. I paid Peninsula prices to stay Saturday night only to be awaken on Sunday to be told I had to check out at ten am then I can check back in at 17:00 on the same day.This hotel is old, tired, dirty, and terrible. I lived in Japan and Thailand and I am quite respectful of different culture and customs. This hotel takes ten minutes to get outside. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in anywhere on earth. I have travelled around the globe and would not recommend this to anyone.Location is great; service is awful. I am so stressed out staying here and have not slept in two days from the hotel harassing me. I am pissed off beyond belief.
user_name:
G O
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Good hotel. Rooms are perfect, with space, all equipment, internet (not free though), a few restaurant (breakfast either at the top of the tower or in front of the garden). Many restaurants in the building for a large choice. Close subway and taxi stations.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: From arrival on the airport limo bus from Narita (about 75 minute journey after 30 minute wait), the staff welcome was first class, even though communication in English is somewhat limited. The reception, lobby and restaurant areas are appropriate for an upscale hotel, although as a first time visitor to Japan i was somewhat surprised by the cost of food and drink (even after reading other reviews) that is way above Four Seasons pricing in US for half size portions. Get out of the hotel and into the city, but suggest you have a basic phrase book at hand, otherwise prepare to point and gesture.The Japanese gardens with coy carp fish ponds are sensational, so well worth a wander after arrival from a 14 hour flight to relax in a city oasis. Took a look at the pool but decided it wasn't worth the fee.Location wise the hotel gives you great access to the entire city, but beware that taxi's are also very expensive so plan an itinerary in advance to avoid jumping around the city or perhaps venture into the subway.With my wife and daughter accompanying me, we decided to take a triple room in the Garden Tower. This provided the equivalent of a compact junior suite in US that allowed space for luggage, a sofa and a separate sleeping area which was beneficial as i suffer with jet-lag so I didn't disturb the family while watching the olympics at 2am.The room decor is dated, but clean, with a very slight hint/aroma of smoke (according to my wife, who once moved room four times in New York due to smoke, this time we didn't move). The AC in the room was ok, but in the hotel itself it was non-existent with corridors feeling like saunas. For any workout warriors, head to the main building on level 3 for a much better fitness room than the room in the Tower (no charge at both) or do the smart thing by running from the hotel for a circuit (approx. 7Km) of the Imperial Palace gardens before breakfast. Enjoyed our breakfast buffet on the 40th floor but at over $100, it was a one-time visit in a 3 day stay.Free wifi in the lobby or wired in the room (not very good for an iPad). Suggest you grab snacks and drinks in the shops in the tiny mall network underneath the property or head into the adjoining business tower called Garden Court where restaurant prices are about 50% the cost of the hotel equivalent and excellent.With a refresh on the rooms, i would have scored this hotel a four and would consider staying again depending on price available at the time.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: This hotel was so fun to stay in.I went with my family and it was so close to the city, but just far enough that I didn't feel too close to it.The view from our hotel is amazing, as it is in probably every hotel in Tokyo since the city never ends. We were on the 20-something floor and it was beautiful. The beds were nice and there were some good movies to watch. The service was great, as it always is in Japan. I absolutely love staying at the Westin in Ebisu, but that was too pricey so for the deal that we got, this hotel was great.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The New Otani in Tokyo's Akasaka neighborhood is a great choice. The area is safe for walking even late at night. There are multiple restaurants to choose from in the hotel, and many, many restaurants in the neighborhood in easy walking distance. The hotel is a very short distance from a large subway station, Akasaka-Mitsuke, so you can get anywhere from there. The hotel itself has very nice rooms, small in the Japanese style, but comfortable. Room service is quite good, and the staff is very helpful. It's a rather expensive hotel, but not quite as high as the Tokyo Westin (which is awesome) and has more of the feel of being in Japan than does the Westin. Ask for a garden view room in the tower building, and have breakfast at least once in the lobby restaurant overlooking the waterfall and Japanese garden -- gorgeous!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Huge hotel complex, be prepared to walk long distances. Well located, close to a metro station. Cool service. Services are very expensive, with average quality and some evident shortcomings: long time to provide in-room service, need to pay for WiFi in room, average very expensive breakfast. Rooms are OK, but the bathrooms are quite elementary.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The Hotel is one of Tokyos traditional Hotels with a high prestige factor. Accordingly you pay more than you get: standard rooms are big and ok, take a room in the Main; restaurants are good but very expensive (Hamburger: 34 Euro); Service was not so convincing: we had forgotten to book an extra bed beforehand and when we checked in the reception staff told us no extra bed was available ( in a 1400 bed Hotel!) and made no effort to find a substitute solution; thus one of our teens had to sleep on the floor for one night. We spent a day at the pool (2000 Yen per person), which is quite big, but has also seen better days ( all plastic chairs). When we asked for a taxi which can transport 5 persons we were told such a Taxi wouldn' t exist. The week before we had stayed at the Four Seasons in Tokyo: there such a Taxi was made available within 5 minutes!The Hotel is located in 10 min walking distance to a Metro station, the hotel does not provide a shuttle, which could easily be done as the road to the station hardly has any traffic.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: A very comfortable and very clean, excellent service hotel. Lots of restaurants to choose although most are overpriced. The Japanese garden is unparalleled and is a true beauty. Room is tidy and has reasonable size in Japan. Amenities are more than enough and business centre opens 24 hours. Staff speak good English which is quite out of my expectations. Location-wise is OK since it takes 15 mins walk to the underground. Breakfast is so so, not good variety but quality is good. Make sure you go to Top floor in garden wing for breakfast, the view is amazing.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Good hotel, very confortable rooms (we are in Japan, were rooms are usually tiny), lots of restaurants to choose from and, finally, very high service level. A bit expensive, but once again, it's Tokyo!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: The staff were helpful, efficient and, of course, polite. The rooms were quiet, clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. The included breakfast buffet was generous and delicious. There is shopping and dining within an easy walk and this hotel is well located for access to transportation to and from most of the main attraction areas of Tokyo. After a week stay, I won't hesitate to book here again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: THe New Otani is on the limo bus airport loop so getting from Narita to the hotel was easy and convenient. The rooms were inviting, clean, non-smoking and comfortable. There were an abundance of shops, restaurants, and even a small grocery store that was open at night. It was close to many transportations and within walking distance to many attractions. We'd stay there again!

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: the hotel is perfect place to explore tokyo and beyond; spacious room and great choices of breakfast. great level of service and not far from main attraction area of tokyo.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Stayed here several times and always enjoyed it. Service is impeccable - polite and friendly. Given prices in Tokyo, this hotel offers good value for money. Rooms are on the large size for Tokyo/Japan (average for anywhere else), clean, comfortable and functional. The hotel has a huge collection of restaurants with the Sky Buffet an excellent choice for dipping into Japanese cuisine. However, there is no doubt that these restaurants will leave a large hole in your wallet. That's Tokyo. A great plus is the Japanese Garden you can walk around. Convenient for business and tourist sights with vibrant Akasana and Raponggi close to hand. Will be going back.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: Absolutely enjoyed the place, the central location, the size of the rooms and the magnificent view over Tokyo from my 35th floor room.Staff very friendly, beautiful Japanese Garden with good restaurants.Ok, the carpet would need an update AND there is NO free wifi in the rooms (only in the lobby) but really all the rest made 100 times for it!! Just pick up a 3G card at the airport as anyway free wifi is difficult to find in Japan.Would definitively stay again.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
review_body: After having stayed three times at the New Otani Hotel in Tokyo, my wife and I believe to have a fairly objective view of the qualities and shortcomings of this place. This report is a summary of our experiences during all three stays. The hotel is located relatively close the Akasake-Mitsuke metro station and hence easily accessible by public transport. Just bear in mind that it is quite a walk from the metro station platform to the hotel reception, partly due to the size of the station, but also due to the sheer size of the hotel. If you have a lot of luggage to carry, you are probably better off catching a taxi to drive you to the hotel main entrance. A taxi ride from Tokyo Station to the hotel is about $20.The first time we used the New Otani, we opted to go for the least expensive room, in the Garden Tower. That room was sufficiently large, definitely to Tokyo standards, but we were nonetheless a bit disappointed by the fact that it looked quite old fashioned. Obviously this type of room had not been renovated for the past 30 years. On the second night of that first stay, we were rudely kept awake by very noisy neighbours. By 3 am, there was still too much noise, so we called the front desk. An attendant was sent up and this guy obviously heard all the noises coming from the neighbours room right into ours and into the corridor. But he did not do anything about it. I suppose it has something do with Japanese etiquette. However, we had paid for a good night's sleep and decided to take matters into our own hands. A couple of solid knocks on the wall and a hard-to-ignore "SHUT UP" quietened things down. The following morning we complained to the front desk manager about what happened during the night. In genuine Japanese style we got a thousands bows and as many apologies, but again, nothing was done to ensure that the subsequent nights would be quiet ones. Only after I got really upset -- something that is unheard of in Japanese etiquette -- did things start to move. We were offered an upgrade to a DeLuxe Room in the Main Building with the guarantee that that room would definitely be a quiet one. The rooms in the Main Building are in an entirely different league than the ones in the Garden Tower. They are as large, if not larger, and are very tastefully designed in Japanese style. It is like stepping from a 1980s Holiday Inn into a contemporary luxury hotel. The subsequent nights in the hotel were absolutely quiet. Our advice is to definitely book a room in the Main Building and forget about the Garden Tower. During our second and third stay at the New Otani Hotel, we automatically booked a room in the Main Building without ever looking back. All the amenities are provided: slippers, bath robe and toiletries.The hotel itself is very large and sits in beautiful grounds. The Japanese style garden is worth visiting, even if you do not stay at the hotel. There is a myriad of restaurants in the hotel, but we actually tried none of those. They are expensive -- overpriced in our opinion -- and with so many fantastic eateries in the back streets of Sotoboro-Dori (a very short walk from the hotel) it only seemed logical we tried those instead.The staff are extremely polite, as can be expected in Japan, and master a certain amount of basic English. Most of the staff speak about just enough English to keep things running smoothly. The moment you want to engage in a conversation that extends beyond their hotel vocabulary, things get a bit more tricky. Check-in went smoothly on all three occasions. There were no queues at the front desk and the attendants were courteous and considerate. Interestingly, it is surprising that in a high-tech country like Japan, the hotel still uses regular locks and keys for their rooms, instead of key cards. I cannot remember the last time I saw this in a major hotel. As can be expected from a big luxury hotel, they had no issues with keeping our luggage for two days while we were off to Kyoto. Check-out was just as smooth as check-in. Our luggage was brought to the hotel entrance were a taxi was waiting to bring us to Tokyo Station.One thing that is a bit annoying about this hotel is its size. Its back entrance is closest to the Akasaka-Mitsuke metro station. From that back entrance you have to take an elevator to the fifth floor of that building from where you can walk to the Garden Tower reception desk. If you stay in the Main Building (which we recommend) it is another decent walk along one of the restaurants and a number of shops before you reach the Main Building reception area. There you can take the elevator to your room. It reminded us a bit of the casino hotels you find in Las Vegas where you have to walk for miles until you get from your room to the street. The plus side of this all is of course that the rooms are isolated from the urban jungle and there is no street noise at all. If you want to be in the middle of the Tokyo buzz, the districts of Shibuya and Shinjuku are only a short metro ride away.If you are staying in Tokyo, you can do a lot worse than the New Otani. Of course there are the high-end hotels like the Peninsula and the Grand Hyatt, but their room prices are nearly double of what we paid at the New Otani. Value for money, the New Otani is excellent. The Main Building rooms are great and the location is wonderful -- centrally located, but away from the city noises. The size of the hotel is perhaps a bit overwhelming and the impeccable yet sterile service from the staff might be off-putting for some.

hotel_name: Hotel New Otani Tokyo The Main
